Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie S., from the village of Biasong, is a 56-year-old widowed mother of nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets, she is now requesting a new loan, her 12th, of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Rosie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita F. D. tiene la edad de 34 años vive en un municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada y su esposo es albañil, tienen 2 hijos, mayores de edad que estudian y apoyan a sus padres en los oficios del hogar, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida Nicaragüense, y desde hace 5 años ha sido una de sus fuentes de ingreso más fuertes de la economía de su hogar, fue con el apoyo económico de su esposo y sus ahorros que inicio su negocio, en este año su clientela a aumentado y la temporada de invierno ha causado incomodidades entre ellos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción  que le permitan la edificación de una caseta que salvaguarde  a sus clientes brinde mayores comodidades, y tras esto un aumento en las ventas que favorezcan a las condiciones económicas para beneficio de toda su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Margarita F. D. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  She is married and her husband is a masonry worker.  They have 2 grown children who study and help their parents with the house work.  She has a business selling Nicaraguan food.  This has been one of the most important sources of household income for the past 5 years.  She started the business with her husband’s financial support and savings.  Her customers have increased this year and they were uncomfortable during the winter season.  This is why she is applying for a loan, in order to purchase construction materials to build a small house to protect her clients and make them more comfortable.  Afterwards the sales should increase and improve economic conditions to benefit the whole family.

loans.use: Build a small house for her business.

loans.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Rudy Alberto tiene 35 años y vive con su esposa y vive en el barrio San Francisco. Pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta tener este medio de vida como es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es inicio para cuando anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa con lo poco que obtuvo logro empezar este humilde negocio. El señor Rudy utilizara el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener mejores ganancias.
Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, su meta es que su negocio sea grande y que tenga mucha variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, también nos comento que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rudy Alberto is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and they live in the community of San Francisco. He has demonstrated to be a very responsible person and he feels very happy to have her grocery store as his source of income. He has had this business for more than 4 years and he was once employed by a company and later he managed to start his business, though its beginnings were quite humble. Rudy will use his loan to invest in the purchase of inventory for his business with the goal of improving his profits. 

His business is located in his home. His goal is to expand his business and to offer a wide variety of products to meet his clients' demands. He dreams of providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella vende perfumes originales, hace 2 años. Sus lugares de venta son municipalidades, colegios y también vende a domicilio a clientes particulares. 
Con este préstamo comprará perfumes, ya que tiene varios encargos y también comprará para tener en stock. 
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo, con el fin de facilitar los viajes a Santiago (capital de Chile) para comprar sus productos y para vender en lugares más apartados y fuera de la ciudad.  
Para Carmen los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio y una gran ayuda, ya que no le pidieron muchos requisitos para  integrarse.  También le acomoda que los pagos sean semanales, ya que de esta manera las cuotas son de menor valor. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in San Vicente de Tagua Tagua district.  She has been selling perfume for 2 years.  She makes her sales in towns and schools and also delivers to the homes of private customers.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes since she has a number of orders.  She will also buy some to have in stock.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle so that she can travel to Santiago (the capital of Chile) to buy her products and to sell in places further from the city.

For Carmen, Fondo Esperanza's loans have been a great support for her business and a great help since they did not ask her to fulfil many conditions in order to join.  It also suits her that she pays weekly because this means her repayments are cheaper.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy perfume

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a thirty-two year old married man with three children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is seeing his children go to school and graduate since he did not have a chance to further his education.

 For ten years now, Emmanuel has been in the motorcycle transport business  and this has helped him  to earn money to pay fees for his children although he still has a challenge of high expectations from his boss, thus limiting his daily income.

In his dreams he really longs to have his own motorcycle as the motorcycle owner takes 70% of the daily income. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his own transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Norma Eunice

texts.es: La señora Norma Eunice Q. E. tiene un negocio denominado “Estanquillo Solís” desde hace 2 años; en el cual ofrece todo en abarrotes y venta de comida (hamburguesas, nachos con queso, hotdogs y mas). Eunice comenta que en la temporada de Diciembre es cuando tiene mas ventas por la razón de que la gente es cuando visita la familia en esta ciudad, para esto quiere estar preparada surtiendo su negocio para que incremente sus ganancias.
texts.en: Sra. Norma Eunice Q. E. has a business called “Estanquillo Solís” that she has managed for two years.  She offers all types of groceries and sells food (hamburgers, cheese nachos, hot dogs, and other menu items).  Eunice says that December is when she has more sales since people come to the city to visit their families.  For this reason, she wants to be prepared by stocking her business with more merchandise so that she can increase her revenues.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Betulia

texts.es:
La señora Betulia S. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la aldea las Piletas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, cremas, lociones, perfumes entre otros, tiene 4 años de haber iniciado con su negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos y tambien sale a vender a aldeas y caserios cercanos del lugar donde ella vive.
Betulia es bien responsable y honrada.
Betulia tambien se dedica a otra actividad que es la venta de golosinas los fines de semana.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos y otros producos, tiene una lista grande de pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.
Betulia trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para darles una mejor calidad vida.
su meta es que su negocio cada dia sea mas grande.
texts.en:
Betulia S. is 38 years old and lives in the Las Piletas neighbourhood in the city of Choluteca. She sells cosmetics, creams, lotions, perfumes and other products. She started her business 4 years ago. Her customers are her neighbours and she also goes out to sell in small towns and villages near where she lives.

Betulia is very responsible and honest. Betulia also works selling sweets at the week-end. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics and other products. She has a long list of orders placed by her customers. Betulia works very hard to support her children and give them a better quality of life. Her goal is to grow her business every day.

loans.use: Buy facial powder, perfumes, mascara, towels, baby lotion, lipsticks, creams, nail varnish and rimmel.

loans.name: Danilo Fernández

texts.es:
Danilo Fernández R. A. tiene 44 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Danilo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es superarse económicamente.

Le gusta asistir a las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Danilo Fernández R. A. is 44 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and child in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The members of the 'LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE" (Hope Is Never Lost) community bank live in the community of El Placer, 120 minutes from our Chillanes office.

The members of this community bank mainly work in agriculture.  Danilo is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases and sales in Chillanes canton, in the Sunday market

Danilo is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve himself financially

Danilo likes taking part in his community's fiestas.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en: Amarsanaa D. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His older two children attend a school while his wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their infant son. Amarsanaa operates a machinery part repair service specialized in increasing height of truck and trailer bodies. He started his business in 2000 and has since built a stable operation. Over the many years of business, he has experienced in his repair service and has gained a lot of permanent customers. For the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing necessary tools and equipments. Amarsanaa says, "My oldest son is a good at his school, he attended many mathematics Olympics with high achievements but I can not fully support my son with his education due to financial problem" He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase supplies and materials for his machinery part repair service as well as use for household's consumption.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials

loans.name: Mr. Sam Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: This fifteen-member loan group is made up of people who live in Traeuy Tonloab village, which is located in Takeo province. Mr. Sam P. has been selected by the group's members to serve as its president. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he supports his family by growing and selling rice. He has also been elected as his village's vice chief. Mr. P. plans to use his portion of this loan to raise his farm's output by improving the productivity of his soil and combating insects. He will also use some of the loan to pay school fees for his three childR.. His wife, Mrs. Vet Yen, contributes to the family income by working as a nurse.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pesticide

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre,  tiene una niña de 4 años y tres meses la cual es su adoración. El marido es chofer en una empresa de agua. Ella estudia a distancia en la Universidad de Guayaquil los sabados y domingos.

Tiene un almacén en el que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y accesorios de la marca Belessa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30  hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que  tiene su almacén hace dos años pero antes de eso se dedicaba  a la venta puerta a puerta pero poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta poner su local. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Huaquillas, Guayaquil y Ambato una o dos veces al  mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y  le gusta por la ayuda y por las charlas educativas. Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Las Piedras' community bank meet in Las Piedras neighborhood, in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is known for its traditional culture, the cheerfulness of its people and the San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas.

Here we meet María.  María is 23 years old and lives with her partner.  She has a daughter who is 4 years and 3 months old and is her little treasure.  María's husband is a driver for a water company and María studies at Guayaquil University on Saturdays and Sundays.

María has a store in which she sells all kinds of clothes and Belessa-brand accessories.  She works every day from 8.30am to 6.00pm.  She tells us that she has had her store for two years and before that she sold her products door to door.  She gradually saved up until she was able to set up her sales location.  She buys her merchandise in Huaquillas, Guayaquil and Ambato once or twice a month, according to what she needs.

María will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear and other clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for four loan cycles and she likes being a member because of the help she receives and also the educational talks.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To reinvest in his business selling salt, candles and general supplies.

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Dame  Falilatou est  mariée  et a 25 ans.  Elle  habite quartier   Kotokoukondji.  Elle  fait la  vente de sachets  pour  contribuer  au menage.   Elle  a  débuté  en   2007  et  achète  les  sachets  au  grand  marché de  Lomé.   Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter  12  douzaines de  sachets  ainsi   satisfaire  plus de  clients.
texts.en: Falilatou is married and is 25-years-old. She lives in the Kotokoukondji district. She sells bags to contribute to household costs. She began doing this in 2007 and buys the bags at the big market in Lomé. She is requesting a loan to buy 12 dozen bags so that she can meet the needs of more customers.

loans.use: To buy bags

loans.name: Hasa  Onzere

texts.en:
For 12 years Hasa Onzere has been working in a garage whereby he repairs vehicles for his customers in Dagorreti Corner; Nairobi. He earns an income of KES. 20,000 per month.  He is 25 years old, married and a father of one child.    

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan through KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase working materials (spare parts) for his garage.            


Hasa intends to use the anticipated profits to save and start a vegetable Kiosk for the wife. In the future, Hasa desires to grow his business and establish his garage to be the best in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha, age 34, sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. He has been running his business for one year and has one employee. He is unmarried. Besides being a businessman, Elisha works as an actor and a model. He dreams of having a well established business in the future.  

Elisha has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 kes to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a farmer from Banga, South Cotabato. He tills his land for planting rice and corn crops. Raul sells his harvest to his town's market. Raul is also a driver. He said that the additional income from driving helps with his family's daily needs.

Raul's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He hopes that his farm will grow.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 47 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 60 years old, married, and has two sons. Both of her sons work, the eldest one operates a grocery store while the youngest one works in a factory. 

Shameem stays at home and manages her household responsibilites. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to expand his grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to add to his store's inventory. 

He has been operating this business for the past five years and Shameem hopes that an investment will make his business more profitable. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Shameem.

loans.use: to buy inventory for a grocery store business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a hardworking, married man with seven children.  They live in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on him and his dream is educating his children up to university.  Ahmed is a farmer and has been farming for eight years.  He has challenges in price fluctuation of agricultural products and his aspiration is to farm at least 10 acres of land.  Ahmed is requesting a loan to purchase beans.

loans.use: To purchase beans for planting.

loans.name: Rabassiburkina Group

texts.fr:
Mme Salamata est la responsable du groupe RABASSIBURKINDI. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il a 4ans. Il ne va pas à l’école d’abord. Elle 1 personne en charge.

Mme vend des condiments depuis 4ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toécé (un village environnant).Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter un sac de gombo, un sac de potasse et un sac de sel.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider son mari à s’occuper de sa petite famille. Elle a pour ambition d’agrandir son commerce et de scolariser son enfant.
texts.en:
Madam Salamata is the leader of the Rabassiburkindi Group.  She is married and has one child.  He is four years old and has not yet begun going to school.  She supports one additional person.  Salamata has sold seasonings and foodstuffs for four years.  She buys her merchandise at Toécé Market (in a nearby village).  Her clients are women.

She wants to purchase a sack of okra, a sack of potatoes, and a bag of salt.  With the profits, she wants to help her husband in supporting her small family.  She aspires to grow her business and to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of okra, a sack of salt, and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 49-year-old housewife, who has had a talent for embroidery since she was young. She could not use her talent before because she was blessed by marrying and having six children who took most of her time. Now that all of her children are grown up, Sumaya decided to pursue her dream and started a small business at home two years ago making embroidered traditional dresses and selling them. During these two years, she has been able to sell her dresses at the market and has been making a good profit. 

Now, since Sumaya is having more dresses requested, she has applied for this loan to buy machines that can help speed her production and allow her to employ more people in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Eufemia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es electricista.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para conseguir algo por sus propios medios hace 10 años empezó con un negocio de venta de ropa el mismo que continua hasta la actualidad, trabaja tres días más que todo por las mañanas y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a todos sus clientes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella deja sus productos a crédito  y cobra semanalmente o en tres partes. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo en un lugar que encuentra buena mercadería y a buen precio. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende es la ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 16 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Madres Unidas” (Mothers United) meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Eufemia. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children (age 17, 14, and 8). The two older children are in high school and the youngest one attends elementary school. Her husband is an electrician.

Eufemia is an excellent homemaker who starting selling clothes 10 years ago so that she could earn her own income. She continues with this business and works three days each week, mostly in the mornings. The evenings are when she meets with all of her customers. Eufemia sells by going door-to-door and taking orders. She offers her products on credit and collects payment either weekly or in three installments. Eufemia buys her merchandise in Portoviejo at a place that offers quality products at a good price. According to Eufemia, women's clothing is what she sells most.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Eufemia has been with the Communal Bank for 16 years and likes being a member because the loans helped her to start her business. Her dream is to see her children finish their studies and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mr. and Mrs. Yu would like to support their two children in business.  Mrs. Yun is a vegetable seller in the market.  Her husband works as a construction worker in Phnom Penh.  To support her family, she requests a loan of $500 as a working capital loan for her vegetable business.  She will purchase more vegetables for sale in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Azizbek

texts.ru:
Азизбек родился 12 августа 1975 года. Его отец рано покинул их, и он остался сиротой. Его мать не могла обеспечить их необходимыми вещами, поэтому он рано начал бизнес. Он помогал своим родным, реализовать товары и зарабатывал денег. Кроме этого он научился выращивать сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводством. Данный момент он занимается купля продажей продукты питание. Для увлечения капитала он уже третий раз запрашивает кредит. Те займи, который он получил раньше, дал большой эффект, он намного расширил свой бизнес и улучшил свое жилищное условие. Азизбек хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки сельскохозяйственных культур. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Azizbek was born on August 12th, 1975. His father has left their family early and he became on orphan. His mother was not able to provide them with all the necessary things and this is why he started to do business early. He was helping his relatives by selling merchandise and making money. Besides that he learned to grow agriculture crops and animal husbandry. At this time he buys and sells food products. To increase his working capital he has been taking out the loan for the third time. His previous loans gave a big effect as he has grown his business a lot and improved his living conditions. Azizbek wants to get a loan in the amount of $1,500USD to buy agriculture crops.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy agriculture crops

loans.name: Milagros Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagros del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es propietaria de un taller de calzado desde hace 8 años. Ella inicio este negocio con poco en la actualidad ella vende aproximadamente 75,000 córdobas mensuales e invierte 63,900 en materiales pega, hilo, cuero, cuerina, plantilla…etc. y mano de obra.
Ella con el crédito realizara sandalias juveniles y de niña ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Milagros del Carmen is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has owned a shoeshop for 8 years. She started this business with very little, and she now sells approximately 75,000 córdobas' worth of merchandise every month and invests 63,900 in materials: glue, thread, leather, faux leather, insoles...etc., and in labour.
With this loan she will make sandals for youth and children, since she has many orders.

loans.use: to purchase materials: glue, thread, leather, faux leather, insoles...etc.

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita is married and has 12 children. Relita is 62 years old and lives in Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Relita sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy groceries and supplies to sell to customers of her convenience store. 

Relita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Relita hopes to earn more profit from her business to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and supplies to sell to customers of her convenience store

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Humberto tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la aldea Nagarejo del municipio de Agua Fría, Carlos esta soltero y no tiene hijos. Carlos se dedica al negocio de carnicería desde hace 1 año y medio, ahi vende todo tipo de carne de res, cerdo, chorizo y pollos, sus principales clientes son las personas que visitan el mercado y sus amigos.
Carlos utilizara el credito para la compra de carne de cerdo, carne de res, pollo y chorizos.
Su meta es lograr expandir su negocio y su sueño es llegar a formar una bonita familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto is a young man who is 23 years of age. He lives in the neighborhood of Nagerejo in the town of Agua Fría. Carlos is single and has no children. He has been in the meat business for 1½ years and sells all types of meat such as beef, pork, chorizo, and chicken. His main customers are the people who visit the market and his friends.

Carlos will use this loan to buy pork, beef, chicken, and chorizo. His goal is to expand his business, but his dream is to start a beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, chicken, and chorizo.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 55 years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business as a source of income. He is married and has three adult-aged children. He has been managing his hog raising business for five years. He is a patient and industrious father and husband. He operates a farming business as well as his hog fattening business. It is difficult to operate two businesses at a time, but his willingness to lift his family out of poor living conditions causes him to take on such a difficult responsibility.

Now, he is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and vaccine for his hogs. He wants to develop his hog fattening business more and earn a higher income in order to save for unexpected circumstances such as sickness.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for his hogs.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
With his hard work and perseverance to uplift their living, Jimmy is doing his best to obtain it. He is 45 years old and married with three children. Jimmy is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. With his determination to quickly respond to the needs of his family, Jimmy also plants and harvests vegetables to sell.

Jimmy has already experienced difficulties in life during his childhood. He doesn’t want his children to experience the same difficulties. He doesn’t want them to starve, that’s why he works hard to give them a quality life. Jimmy wishes to send his children to school until college and finish their education. He doesn’t want his children to be like him and not be given a chance to enter college or even high school.

With regards to his farming business, Jimmy is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that he will use in rice farming. He believes that the loan will have a positive impact on his farming because he is now able to buy the exact inputs needed for farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Lemapu

texts.en:
Lemapu is 42 years of age and married with six children. He owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. He has many years of experience in this business. 

Lemapu needs a loan of 1250 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. He plans to use the profit from his business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Lemapu  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lemapu's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Shanitah

texts.en:
Shanitah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 1 child and her child goes to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She sells soft drinks at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more passion fruits and oranges. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale one. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruits and oranges.

loans.name: Pamela Achieng

texts.en: Pamela is married and has two children at age of three and seven years.She runs a boutique where she sells ladies bags, shoes, body oil, etc to frequent and new customers. She has been running this business for four years. Her business faces a problem of lacking a permanent place to work from. She wants a loan of Kshs 15,000 to buy a sewing machine, bags and shoes. In the future, Pamela sees herself as a supplier of school uniforms to schools and other institutions. She describes herself as honest, charistmatic and obedient.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags and a sewing machine

loans.name: Edmundo Americo

texts.es:
Edmundo pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  tiene 48 años de edad; El socio  es casado; El socio tiene 3 hijos de 11, 7, 5 años de edad; el socio es distribuidor de licores, piscos, vinos; el socio tambien tiene otro negocio de venta de ropas, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de licores, vinos, champan, piscos para implementar y distribuir a sus respectivos cleintes en sus negocios. El socio solicita el prestamno para invertir en la compra de licores, vinos, champan, piscos, para estas fiestas navideñas.
  
El socio  está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Edmundo is a member of the "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank, located in the San Jeronimo district, within the Cusco province.

He is 48 years old, married, and has three children, ages 11, 7, and 5.  He is a distributor of liquors, ports, and wines.  He also has a clothes selling business.  He is asking for this loan to buy liquors, champagne, and ports to distribute to his clients over the holiday season.

He is grateful for the loan and appreciates the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Twisungane/kng Group

texts.fr:
Augustin  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/Kng. Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 9 à 13 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Augustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Augustin voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Augustin is part of the Twisungane/Kng group. He is 45 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 13, all 3 of whom are in school. His level of education is 6 years of primary school.

Augustin is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers. 

His strategy for growing his business is to grow rice on bigger pieces of land. In the future, he would like to become the rice supplier for his region. With his profits, Augustin plans to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Chrysologue

texts.fr:
Chrysologue est né au Rwanda et a 30 ans. Il est marie avec 1 enfant de 7 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de l’université.

Chrysologue est chauffeur d’un taxi voiture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des produits alimentaires pour le stock de sa boutique. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accroitre le stock de sa boutique pour éviter la rupture de stock et devenir un grand commerçant des produits alimentaire. Chrysologue voudrait offrir des services de qualité en commerce de boutique et avoir un mini super marché. Avec le profit  Chrysologue voudrait scolarise ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Chrysologue was born in Rwanda and is 30 years old. He is married with one 7-month old child. He completed three years of university.

Chrysologue is a taxi driver. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to buy food products to stock his shop.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the stock of his shop to avoid being out of stock and to become a great businessman of food products. Chrysologue would like to offer quality services at his shop and have a mini supermarket. With the profits, Chrysologue would like to pay for his children's schooling and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock his shop.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo es socio del Banco Comunal Capulí, tiene 44 años, se dedica a la venta de gelatinas, logró tener una Micro Empresa, es padre de 2 hijos, casado, esta en Finca desde hace 2 años, él aprendió por su hermano a preparar gelatina y desde la fecha se dedico a eso. Lamentablemente su negocio bajó debido a los gastos que tuvo que realizar cuando su esposa salió embarazada, debido a que tuvo algunas complicaciones, pero con la ayuda de Finca el pudo salir de ese problema y ahora sigue esforzándose y las cosas están mejorando. Agradece mucho a Finca que en el momento indicado el pudo tener el apoyo necesario, de las capacitaciones él aprendió mucho como tener una buena familia y progresar en su negocio.
Arturo tiene un proyecto que lo realizará con el préstamo que esta sacando para que pueda tener mas ingresos, lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios para damas.
texts.en:
Arturo is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank (Capulí is a kind of cherry tree). 

He is 44 years old and works selling gelatin, managing to have a micro-business. He is the father of two children, married, and has been with Finca for two years. He learned from his brother how to prepare gelatin and from that time he has worked in this field. 

Unfortunately his business has declined due to the expenses that he had while his wife was pregnant, because she had some complications, but with the help of Finca he can break away from this problem and continue with determination since things are getting better. 

He is very thankful to Finca because at the helpful time he could have the necessary support, and the training sessions helped him to have good progress in family and business matters.

Arturo has a project that he would work on with the money from the loan that he is asking for. In order to have more income, he will buy accessories for women.

loans.use: to buy accessories for women

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old, married and has five children. He has been running a timber and firewood retail business for the last 11 years.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET Ltd  of Kes 50,000. He intends to use the funds to purchase more stock of timber and firewood .With the anticipated profits he will separate the two products (firewood and timber) to run independently.

His hopes and dreams are to become a successful businessman in the timber retail industry

loans.use: To increase stocks of timber and firewood.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have five children between 4 and 15 years old who live at home and attend school. For the past nine years, Rena has been selling dried Bonnie fish in the market. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried Bonnie fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dried Bonnie fish for her business

loans.name: 16 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: Doña Vilma tiene 46 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario 16 de Septiembre, es madre soltera de cinco hijos. Inicio el negocio cuando sus hijos le daban mercadería para vender y después decidió sacar un crédito para establecer su negocio, ella desde hace tres se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, y también vende comida por encargo, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con uno de sus hijos y es quien le ayuda a trasladar la comida a domicilio. El préstamo que doña Vilma solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como ser: ropa y zapatos de todos los estilos, para ofrecerle a sus clientes nuevas modas y poder atraer más compradores a su negocio. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá tener mejor surtido su negocio y así darles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de ropa y zapatos. Sus sueños es ampliar su negocio y mantenerlo bien surtido para que sus clientes encuentren siempre lo que necesiten. Doña Vilma tiene dos ciclos de trabajar con FAMA y han cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Lingel Group

texts.en: Chaoba, the group leader of Lingel group is a jewellery artist by profession. Married and mother of 2 kids, she lives in Manipur. She runs this small business of jewellery making with other members of the group. Together, they make various kinds of finger ring, earrings, necklace. Further gold plating these products brings them decent amount of earnings every month. They are now requesting a loan of Rs. 75000 to expand their business. The loan amount will be used to purchase bulk stock of raw materials required for the business. They are well aware of group rules and agreed to abide by it and are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her jewellery making business

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of three from Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past 7 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Maryline is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. 

Maryline wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Maryline will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Maryline is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Maryline awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila B. has owned her business for two years now. She sells household goods to people in the north part of Guayaquil. Teofila’s husband taught her how to operate the business and built their house on an empty piece of land. He works as a property manager, leading construction of homes on unused land. They typically work from 7am until 10 pm. Teofila is asking for this loan so that she can invest in marketing materials and rent a location in the busy bazaar where other poor families can come to buy household items. Ms. B. is 56 years old and has lived in Guayaquil her whole life. Now that her children are grown, she focuses most of her time on the business and wants nothing more but to grow into a professional property company.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Teofila is asking for this loan so that she can invest in marketing materials and rent a location in the busy bazaar where other poor families can come to buy household goods.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela has a small bazaar in her home. Mariela began her business with the help of her husband who provided US$150 in investment capital. She began selling purses and backpacks to her friends and family. Now she continues selling purses and backpacks together with other items. Mariela will use the loan to invest in wholesale merchandise and thereby increase her income. She has faith that these new products will help her business grow. Mariela is a mother of three children, married and 23 years old. Mariela hopes that this loan can improve her family's quality of life and that it will give her stability to grow her business.

Mariela tiene un pequeño bazar en su domicilio. Mariela empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito un capital de 150 dólares. Se inicio vendiendo bolsos y mochilas a sus amistades y familiares. Ahora ella continua vendiendo bolsos y mochilas y articulos de bazar. Mariela usara el préstamo para invertir en mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecerá. Mariela es madre de 3 hijos, esta unida, tiene 23 años. Mariela tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le dará estabilidad y crecimiento al negocio.

loans.use: Comprar sus productos al por mayor

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos P. has a small piece of land in Santa Lucia, Ecuador. Although his farm is small, it has been providing for him and his family for about 20 years. He is now seeking to make an investment in order to make his lands become more productive. He wants to invest in fertilizers and pesticides in order to improve the rice he grows. William and his family also raise pigs on their farm, only selling them when they are in need of money. William has his rice processed and commercialized at his association’s facilities.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

He is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. They will use the microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each other's guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in rice production

loans.name: Meav

texts.en:
Mrs. Meav T. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she purchases bananas from someone’s plantation (i.e., wholesale) and resells them to people in the area where her husband is self-employed as a horse cart driver, driving a passenger cart drawn by a horse. Together, they make on average about $6/day.

Two of their children are working and the other three attend school. It is important to mention that one of their children is talented and would like to follow in his father’s footsteps. He intends to generate more income for their household by driving a horse-cart like his father. This is why Meave T. is requesting a loan to purchase another horse cart for her son to drive.

loans.use: `To purchase a horse-cart ( a passenger cart drawn by a horse) for her son to drive

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: The good soil at Faleu Manono and the financial assistance from SPBD are the reasons for Apolonia’s plantation's success. Apolonia is a 33 year old woman from Faleu Manono and currently owns a plantation. It is the main source of income for her and her family. Apolonia (pictured in the photo) is very happy, showing her plantation to the SPBD staff, and is asking for a loan of US$300 to help further develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Madame Kayi A. is a 48 years old widow living in Akoin. She sells small fish and condiments to provide for the needs of her five (05) children. This poor widow lacks working capital funds to increase her activities. This is why she is requesting a loan of $300 to revitalize her commercial activities. She is counting on your help to improve her living conditions and that of her children.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Kayi âgée de 48 ans est veuve et réside à Akoin. Elle est revendeuse de petits poissons et des condiments afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq (05) enfants. Cette pauvre veuve est en manque de fonds de commerce pour accroître ses activités. Pour cela, elle sollicite un apport financier de $300 afin de relancer ses activités commerciales. Elle compte sur votre aide pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de ses enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase and stock of fish

Achat et stock de poisson

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Mrs. Clara M. operates a bar where she sells drinks. She worked with her husband for a year to learn the business.

She is 28 years old, married, and lives in Benin City. She has been a client of LAPO for 3 years.

Mrs. M. requests a loan of $1200 so she can buy more drinks and pepper soup ingredients. This will help her serve her customers better. The loan will go a long way to help her increase her business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for pepper soup and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nanih

texts.en: Nanih is a 53-year-old woman who has a small shop from which she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn $44.50 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Nanih requests a IDR 700,000 loan to fill her shop. Her husband, M., has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Perla Marisol

texts.es:
Perla was married, however she had problems with her partner and decided to divorce and she is now in charge of her son. Because of this she began to make her own business, after not being able to find work. She began with very little merchandise and bit by bit it is growing and adding more merchandise to sell. Nowadays Perla is requesting a loan of $375 USD that is arranged to be paid over a term of 4 months. With this money Perla will be able to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell cold meats in her business. With your help Perla will be able to further her business so that she can provide her son with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Perla estaba casada, sin embargo tuvo unos problemas con su pareja por eso se divorció y ella se quedó a cargo de su hijo. Es por eso que comenzó a hacer su propio negocio, ya que no podía conseguir trabajo. Comenzó con muy poca mercancía y poco a poco fue creciendo y agregando un poco más de mercancía para vender.

Actualmente Perla está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Y con este dinero Perla podrá comprar un refrigerador para poder vender carnes frías en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Perla podrá sacar adelante su negocio para así poder darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for cold meats.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en: Torn Y., 36, is a mother of five children and works as a tailor in Phnom Penh City, earning approximately $4 a day. Her husband supports the family by working as a teacher in their village.  He earns around $2 a day. Two of their daughters work as garment workers and the other three are students. This couple plans to raise pigs to increase their income.  Therefore, they have asked for a $1000 loan to start this business.

loans.use: This couple plans to raise pigs to get more revenue.

loans.name: Gertrudis' Group

texts.es:
Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis have belonged to the Winarisun Communal Bank for 10, 7, and 11 years respectively. Reina is married; she is 42 years old and has 6 children. Reina lives in the district of Quinua where she has a small grocery store. Furthermore Reina travels to the market of Huanta where she purchases small animals and sells them in the small market in her district. Gloria lives with her boyfriend, she is 35 years old and they have 3 children. Gloria has a restaurant located on a central street in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, Gloria dedicates herself to raising small animals that she sells in the market in the city. Gertrudis is married, she is 48 years old and has 1 son, Gertrudis dedicates herself to farming alfalfa, an activity that she does on her own lands and other lands in the small valley of Huatatas, her sales take place in stores in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, Gertrudis dedicates herself to raising small animals like calves that she sells in the markets. Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis need loans of 450 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, sodas, chickens and for the payment of their rent. The dreams of Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis are that their children will be professionals; their businesses will succeed; to have a tourist attraction and a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Reina, Gloria y Gertrudis pertenecen al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun hace 10, 7, 11 años respectivamente.

Reina es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Reina vive en el Distrito D. Quinua donD. tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. Además Reina viaja a la feria D. Huanta donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el mercadillo D. su distrito.

Por otro lado, Gloria es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Gloria tiene un restaurante ubicado en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Gloria se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores que venD. en el mercado y recreos D. la ciudad.

Mientras que, Gertrudis es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Gertrudis se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa, actividad que realiza en sus propios terrenos y también alquilados en el pequeño valle D. Huatatas, sus ventas lo realiza repartiendo a tiendas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Gertrudis se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, animales menores que venD. a recreos.

Reina, Gloria y Gertrudis necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cuy, azúcar, fideo, gaseosas, gallina y para el pago del arrendamiento D. chacras.

Los sueños D. Reina, Gloria y Gertrudis son que sus hijos sean profesionales, sus negocios mejoren, tener un recreo turístico y un negocio estable.

loans.use: Reina, Gloria and Gertrudis need loans of 450 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, noodles, sodas, chickens and for the payment of their rent.

loans.name: Enoe Mercedes

texts.es:
Enoe is 24 years old and lives in the Anexo B neighborhood. She is married and has two children; her husband works as a vendor. She has been working in beauty salons for five years, and for the past two years has had her own salon, albeit with infrastructure problems. She started her business with money from her severance payment, which she then used to buy mirrors and other equipment that she needed for opening her business.

Enoe is going to use the loan to buy additional equipment so that she can set her business up outside the home. In the future she plans to continue making improvements to her business’s infrastructure. By consolidating her business Enoe will be able to contribute to her family’s economic development.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Enoe tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el barrio anexo B. Sur es casada y tiene dos niños su esposo es comerciante, ella trabajaba en salones de belleza tiene cinco años de experiencia y dos años de tener su propio salón aunque con dificultades de infraestructura. Comenzó con dinero de la liquidación y compro espejos y materiales para la apertura sus planes.

Con el préstamo va complementar materiales para establecer el negocio independientemente del resto de la casa y a futuro seguir mejorando la infraestructura y así aportar al desarrollo económico y familiar a través de la consolidación del negocio.

loans.use: Improvements to her business

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita, 46, was born in Bagua Chica. She is married and lives in the Manuel Arevalo District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad. She has a high school education and 3 children who still live at home and are in high school and college. She sells chicken broth from a rented space located a few blocks from her home. She and her husband have been doing this for 3 years now. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for about a year and a half now. The first loan for 300 Peruvian soles was used to make improvements to her business premises by buying some chairs. Sarita is a member of the Communal Bank "Santa Elena II" by invitation from some of the mothers at the school where her son attends. With a loan in the amount of 700 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy pots, a blender, and a coffee pot. She hopes to improve her business premises in order to have more customers, and to buy a new stove since the one she has now is in bad condition.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sarita tiene 46 años de edad, es natural de Bagua Chica, casada vive en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad; curso estudios secundarios completos, tiene 03 hijos, los cuales aun dependen del hogar, éstos están cursando estudios secundarios y superior. Se dedica a la venta de caldos de gallina, carnero en un local alquilado a unas cuadras de su casa, ella trabaja en este negocio hace 03 años conjuntamente con su esposo. Con Manuela Ramos viene trabajando un año y medio aproximadamente. Los S/.300. otorgado como primer préstamo, los invirtió en mejorar su local para su negocio, compró algunas sillas. La señora Sarita ingresa al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena II ” por invitación de algunas mamas del centro educativo donde asiste su hijo. Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses. lo invertirá en la compra de ollas, licuadora, cafetera. Ella aspira mejorar su local y si tener mayor clientela y comprar una cocina para su local ya que la que tiene esta en mal estado.

loans.use: To buy more merchadise for her business

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en: Khayal A. is a 29-year-old man who owns his own hardware store. He started his business in 2000 and since that time it is the only financial source for his family. With a loan, he would like to increase his inventory of items and make repairs in his shop to attract more clients.

loans.use: To increase inventory of items and make repairs of his shop

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry C. is a farmer in Chrork Sangkai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Kong Prum, is a firewood and coal seller. Mrs. Ry C. is 45 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are employed in different business activities while the remaining five are attending school.  Her plantation revenue is too small because she just owns a small rice field.  Mrs. Ry C. requests a loan to buy more rice field to expand her rice revenue. Previously, Mrs. Ry C. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart in order to transport to resell door-to-door and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more rice field.

loans.name: Niazllah

texts.en:
Niazllah is a young and uneducated man. He works in agriculture. He did not manage to obtain an education because of economic reasons. He has the responsibility for his hifamily. His father is dead and he has a small sister and brother. His mother is a home-maker, so she is not able to help with their family expenses. Therefore Niaz is the only bread-winner for the family.

He needs a loan. It is very necessary for Niazllah because he is unable to plant all his land, so he needs a lot of money to further his business and keep his family going. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy more seeds and complete his stock to cultivate all his land.

Niazllah is happy. He would like to thank both AFSG and Kiva for making this process of small loans possible in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership and he wishes to contribute other workers in agriculture in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and complete his stock

loans.name: Safia

texts.ru: Сафиямо, 1969 года рождения, замужем и имеет 6 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи зелени и овощей. Данный момент она торгует овощами и фруктами на рынке «Дехконбазар» Гисарского района. В ее ассортименте разновидность яблок, виноградов, персиков, перца и баклажана, помидоров и огурцов. Также в сезон в продаже имеются дыни, гранаты, хурмы, малины, клубники и т.д. Закупает свои товары с дехкан и у оптавиков из Узбекистана. Для увеличения ассортимента, закупа винограда и яблок  хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Born in 1969, Safia is married and has six children. She began her business selling vegetables, and currently sells both vegetables and fruit at the Gissar district Dekhkan market. Her inventory includes a variety of apples, grapes, peaches, peppers, eggplant, tomatoes and cucumbers. In addition, she sells melons, pomegranates, persimmons, raspberries, and strawberries, etc., when they are in season. She purchases her wares from Dekhkan and from Uzbekistan wholesalers. Safia wishes to participate in Kiva’s program to increase her inventory by purchasing grapes and apples. She would like a loan of $600 (2000 somoni) to increase the stock she has on hand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grapes and apples

loans.name: Meak

texts.en: Meak S., 43, is a widow who lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a member of the stage performances held in the village and also works selling different kinds of dessert. On average, she makes US$5 each day, but is also supported by two of her children who work in a garment factory and as a mechanic. She would like to take out a loan of US$800 to open a mechanic shop for her son so he can earn more profits to raise their standard of living. In the future, she would like to sell groceries instead of desserts as well.

loans.use: To open a mechanic shop.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Av. José Faustino Sánchez Carrión Mz. A Lt. 18, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad y es madre soltera con 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibó de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y lencería (ropa interior), tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. 
  
Con este préstamo de S/.  2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 4 docenas de blusas, ¼ de faldas, 2 docenas de pantalones, vestidos para niñas, 6 kilos de tela algodón, etc.

Gracias al banco comunal su negocio ha crecido. Se siente deseosa de seguir surgiendo en su negocio para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria V. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on José Faustino Sánchez Carrión, block A, lot 18, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is a 56-year-old single mother of 5 grown-up children. She decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300.00 PEN in making apparel. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 6 years.

She currently sells clothing and undergarments for men, women and children.

With this loan of 2,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 4 dozen blouses, skirts, 2 dozen pants, girl’s dresses, 6 kg of cotton fabric, etc. Thanks to the microfinance institute, her business has grown. She wishes to keep moving her business forward so that she can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, cotton fabric

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Mirna tiene 56 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Norte, es madre soltera y con dos hijos que son independiente, la Sra. Mirna vende Medicina botánica desde hace cinco años, medicamento que la gente ahora compra mucho, inicio con una liquidación anterior de su trabajo, con esta solicitud es la séptima la cual va invertir en comprar medicamentos, para revender y obtener ingresos, estos prestamos han sido de mucho beneficios para su negocio, a largo plazo es tener mas clientela y brindar otros servicios.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirna O. is a 56-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital city of Managua. She is a single mother with two independent children. Ms. O. has been selling herbal medicine, which people purchase a lot of nowadays, for five years. She started her business with the severance pay from her previous job. This is her seventh loan request, which she will invest in purchasing medication that she will then resell for a profit. These loans have been very beneficial for her business. In the long run, she hopes to increase her clientele and offer other services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase herbal medicine

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 36-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. He has been working as a blacksmith for sixteen years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to install a new light system for his shop, and he also wants to paint his house. This is the first time that Toufic has requested a loan.

Toufic is speciA. in his work because of his professionalism and his commitment. His clients are engineers, companies, friends and others. When he first started, he hadn't done a lot of networking, and it wasn’t easy to deA. with people. He has been working as a blacksmith for sixteen years and that’s how he got his experience. In the future, Toufic plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to install a new light system for his shop and paint his house

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana vive con su hermano, en un cuarto alquilado, tiene 27 años y ha decido progresar, sabe que mejorando su negocio lo podrá lograr, es por eso que esta dispuesta a poner todo de su parte, para conseguir su meta. Gracias a la creciente demanda por ropa de buena calidad, pero de un precio accesible, Yovana a podido cambiar su vida, tiene un pequeño puesto en Juliaca donde vende ropa barata y muy bien confeccionada, ella sola atiende a sus clientes y eso es lo que más le gusta, ya que puede aconsejarles sobre los últimos cambios de la moda, quiere tener un puesto más grande donde venda gran cantidad de ropa, aunque es conciente de que le será difícil conseguir toda la cantidad que necesita. Son 5 años que tiene en este negocio y se siente capaz de afrontar este cambio, con la única finalidad de forjar un futuro adecuado para su hermano y ella. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA y ha decidido ser muy cuidadosa en la inversión de ese dinero, además que tiene siempre presente los consejos de los miembros más antiguos de su banco comunal. Yovana planea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, ropa que este a la moda, para lo cual invertirá todo el préstamo en ello, ya que espera que este año, su puesto sea uno de los más concurridos.
texts.en:
Yovana lives with her brother, in a rented room, is 27 years old, and has decided to progress, knowing that improving her business is something she can achieve. This is why she is disposed to put everything for her part to achieve her goal. Thanks to the increasing demand for good quality clothes, but at an affordable price, Yovana has been able to change her life, she has a small stand in Juliaca where she sells cheap and very well made clothing. She attends to her customers alone and this is what she likes the most, since she can advise them about the latest changes in fashion. She wants to have a larger stand where she will sell more clothing, even though she knows it will be difficult to get the needed quantity. She has had this business for five years and she feels capable of facing this change, with the the sole goal of forging an adequate future for her brother and her. This is her first loan in Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has decided to be very careful in the investment of this money, also she always has the advice of the older members of the community bank. Yovana plans to buy a larger quantity of merchandise, fashionable clothing, so she will invest all of her loan in that, now that she is hoping that this year, her shop will be one of the most popular.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothes

loans.name: Jenny Francisca

texts.es: Jenny Francisca trabaja en la Escuela el Buen Maestro en colonia San Antonio a 7 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene 1 niño de 5 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja como auxiliar de emfermeria en  una comarca y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su 6to  crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en la construcción de una habitación,  esta profesora todos los dias tiene que madrugar para viajar a la 6:00 a.m. a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia,   ambos comparten los gastos familiares pues son una familia muy unida. Jenny estudia  una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educación y su esposo  una licenciatura en enfermeria.  Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo,  salud y llegar a ser una excelente profesional.stró capacidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jenny Francisca works in the school "El Buen Maestro" (meaning, The Good Teacher) in the colony of San Antonio located 7km from New Guinea. She has one 5-month old boy. She is requesting a loan for the sixth time through AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the construction of a house. This teacher gets up every morning at 6a.m. teach children in her colony. Both share the family expenses, given that they are a very close family. Jenny is studying to attain a license in Educational Sciences and her husband is completing training as a nurse. Her dream is to finish building their home for improved conditions, to have work and good health and to one day be an excellent professional. She has demonstrated capacity and timeliness in her monthly payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

Nous sommes de l'écovillage de Carabane qui est une zone très enclavée du delta du Fleuve Casamance. Notre écovillage est très pauvre à cause du conflit qui a reigné pendant longtemps dans cette partie du pays et- aussi par le fait du naufrage de bateau qui assurait la liaison avec le continant. Depuis cette date, nous vivons dans la pau vreté absolue, en essayant de nous en sortir avec le peu de moyens dont nous disposons.
