Nous sommes donc venues solliciter un prêt auprès de Kiva pour pouvoir commercialiser des produits halieutiques, des céréales et des fruits et légumes qui sont produits ici et que nous pourrons acheter auprès des agriculteurs et revendre dans les grandes villes. Les produits halieutiques et forestiers que sont produits dans les îles sont très recherchés dans le continent. La vente de ces produits en villes nous permettra de pouvoir acheter des céréales et divers articles domestiques que nous pourrons revendre chez nous et dans les îles environnantes.
texts.en:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

We are from the eco-village of Carabane which is in a very isolated area of the Casamance River delta. Our eco-village is very poor because of the conflict that reigned for a long time in this part of the country and also because of the wrecked ship, which used to ensure the link with the continent. Since then, we have lived in absolute poverty while trying to lift ourselves out of it with the few means we have. We have therefore come to request a loan from Kiva to be able to market seafood products, grain, and fruit and vegetables that are produced here and that we’ll be able to buy from growers for resale in the big cities. The seafood and woodland goods that are produced on the islands are highly sought after on the continent. The sale of these goods in cities will enable us to buy grain and various home items that we’ll be able to resell in our area and on surrounding islands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables and grain

loans.name: Orita

texts.en: Orita F. is 25 years old and married with 1 child.  She has 3 years experience in the grocery store business. She sells to the village people 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (250 USD).  SPBD loans are Orita’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees and for home improvement.

loans.use: Help pay for children school fees and purchase timber and cement for home renovation.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma and her husband sell slippers in their village as their source of income. They have four children: Arlene, 24; Nelia, 22; Junnie Francis, a 19-year-old graduating student taking a two-year course in college; and Melowin, a 14-year-old high school student. Their family lives simply in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela.

With her business and the help of God, they were able to send her two children to school. Emma wants to develop her business into a bigger one to sustain the needs of her children, but she lacks the capital to make it grow. She now seeks a loan of PHP 4,000.00 that she can use for business capital.

Emma feels happy in spite of the hardships in life. She remains strong and determined to move on. She just wants to uplift their poor living conditions. She knows that everything will be in good condition as long as they put God in everything they do and accompany it with perseverance and patience.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mme A. Akouvi est née en 1983 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de famille, elle n’a pas eu la chance d’évoluer dans les études par faute de moyens financiers. Elle s’adonna ainsi au commerce de vente de maïs frais pour se prendre en charge. Mme A. Akouvi sollicite donc un financement pour se ravitailler quotidiennement. Les revenus lui permettront de contribuer aux charges du ménage et à l’amélioration de son existence.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi A. was born in 1983 in Tsévié. She's married and the mother of a family. She didn't get the chance to pursue her studies, due to a lack of financial means. To support herself, she started selling fresh corn. Mrs. Akouvi A. is seeking a loan to get her daily supplies. The profits will enable her to help with the household expenses, and to improve her existence.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy daily supplies of fresh corn

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy F. vend des tissus qu’elle importe des pays limitrophes du Sénégal. Elle fait ce travail depuis  plusieurs années .Elle a eu a bénéficié de deux prêts de la caisse pour renforcer son commerce. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent d’aider son mari hôtelier dans l’entretien de la maison surtout des enfants. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il veut renforcer son activité en augmentant sa capacité d approvisionnement. Elle habit à Mbour ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 39 ans
texts.en:
Amy F. sells cloth that she imports from countries bordering Senegal. She has been doing this work for several years. She has benefited from two loans from the bank for bolstering her business. The revenues derived from it allow her to help her husband, a hotel keeper, with taking care of the house and especially the children. With the loan she's requesting, Amy wants to bolster her business by augmenting her ability to stock up on merchandise. She lives in Mbour, a coastal city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is 39 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Dora Margarita

texts.es: Dora Margarita M. V. de 36 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla junto su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde comercializa productos perecederos, y es así como a través de dicho negocio logra ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Dora solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder surtir mucho más su tienda de manera que pueda ofrecerle más productos a sus clientes  y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Dora Margarita M. V. is 36. She lives in Santa Tecla with her husband and two children. She has a store where she sells perishable goods; this business enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. Dora is asking for a loan because she wants to be able to stock her store more. Then she can offer more products to her customers and, in turn, get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products for her store

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
A. Nguyễn Thị (1044061339) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, A. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  A. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, A. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. has successfully repaid a previous loA. of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This loA. was used to purchase breeding livestock. A. is now requesting a new loA. of 10,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loA. will be her fifth from TYM Fund. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa G. L. D. C. resiD. en el municipio D. Sensuntepeque en el departamento D. Cabañas. Teresa tiene 51 años D. edad vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 17 años llamado Elías estudiante D. bachillerato. Teresa es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora para prueba  D. ello vale decir que tiene dieciséis  años D. dedicarse a la alta costura, negocio que le deja ganancias satisfactorias, Teresa tiene una buena clientela ya que es muy delicada y minuciosa para la elaboración D. sus prendas cosa que se ve reflejada al finalizar sus vestidos y es por eso que sus clientes la prefieren, el crédito que solicita Teresa es para la comprar tela que utilizara para fabricar vestidos D. porristas y bandas D. paz que salen a desfilar por las calles en pocas semanas que se acerca nuestro día D. independencia patria.
texts.en:
Teresa G. L. D. C. lives in the municipality of Sensuntepeque in the province of Cabañas. She is 51 and lives with her husband and her 17 year old son, Elías, who is a high school student. Teresa is responsible and hard working. Proof of that is the fact that she has been able to earn a good living in the high fashion business for the past 16 years. Teresa has a good customer base. Her clients prefer her services because she is careful and meticulous in her work; you can see the results in the dresses she makes. She will use the loan to buy material to make clothing for the cheerleaders and peace bands that will participate in a few weeks in the parades for Independence Day.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for clothing

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson  tiene un puesto de venta en la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto donde vende celulares por detalle, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su madre. Vive en la casa de sus tíos ubicada en la Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (más celulares), de esa forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por Edson.
texts.en:
Edson has a sales stall in the October 12 area of the city of El Alto where he sells mobile phones. This is his main source of income with which he supports his mother. He lives in his aunt and uncle's home located in Villa Tunari, Los Altos. He will use this loan to purchase stock (more mobile phones) thereby increasing his profits. This is his fourth loan with Impro and Edson's good repayment history permits approval of this additional loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock for his mobile phone sales business.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en: Pepita is 57 years old and manages a general store and a hog-raising business in their village.  Pepita is so thankful for being part of Kiva where she is given the chance to develop her business and now, she is again hoping to take out a loan from Kiva lenders for the improvement of her store. She wants to request the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional capital to buy additional inventory for her store.  She hopes that like her hog raising, her store will also grow successfully in the future to be able to help her attain all her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce started a local restaurant ten years ago and since then she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now forty years-old. She serves many kinds of local dishes such as fufu, rice balls, and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Joyce would like to use this loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, and firewood. She hopes to use part of the proceeds to expand her business. She would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: God First Group

texts.en:
God First is a group of five borrowers led by Daniel S. N., a single man who has the ambition of helping the sick through medical attention. His educational level is a diploma in nursing. He also cares for a sibling. Daniel lives and works in the Cemenco community, northern Monrovia, Liberia. It is a community that is like a slum, and the rate of poverty so high that an entire family has to feed on no more than US$2 a day.

Daniel's business is his little pharmacy. He buys medical drugs wholesale and sells to the residents of Cemenco. He has been running this business for more than three years and, through this business, Daniel can cater to his needs and upgrade his level of education.

The price level sometimes causes serious problems for Daniel. The price level always causes shortages of drugs on the market. But at that moment, Daniel buys drugs that are always needed by customers.

Daniel is planning to become a professional pharmacist so that, in the future, he owns a big pharmacy. He needs this loan in order to purchase more drugs to diversify his stock.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to diversify his stock

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: T. Eugénie est née en 1949 à Sakété, village proche de Porto-Novo capitale politique du Bénin. Eugénie vit depuis trente ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à OTEKPOLA Germain, Eugénie est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble et supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Eugénie vend de l’akassa (aliment fait à base d’amidon de maïs) et des poissons frits à son domicile à Sègbèya. Eugénie exerce cette activité depuis près de vingt ans déjà. Eugénie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Eugénie a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour agrandir plus son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Eugénie sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region so the lives in this region are miserable. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. has 6 people, including herself, in her family. She lives with her husband and four children. She has three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her sons are studying in grades 10, 7 and 6 respectively.

Both Mrs. L. and her husband Mr. DalBir L. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region they face lots of problems in their agricultural farming. Now Mrs. L. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: A. Rosine est née en 1965 et réside depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une divorcée ayant à sa charge six enfants, dont cinq sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent à Gbégamey avec Rosine. Rosine supporte seule les charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Rosine mène comme activité la blanchisserie depuis dix ans et vend également des vivres à son domicile. Rosine fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé ses crédits antérieurs. Rosine souhaite agrandir son activité, afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. C'est pourquoi, Rosine sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Rosine was born in 1965 and has been residing for 12 years in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a divorcée having six children to support. Five of them are her own. All of them are in school and live in Gbégamey with her. Rosine is the sole supporter of the family. To manage this, she has been running a laundry business for ten years, and she also sells staple foods out of her home. She supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. Rosine is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans. She wishes to expand her business in order to do better in providing for her children. This is why she’s requesting another ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap and staple foods

loans.name: Phân

texts.en: Mr. Phân S. was married years ago and his marriage has resulted in three children who are employed at different jobs. He has been working in construction since 2007. Phân S. has the skills to build local houses by hand using wooden housing materials. His wife has been cultivating a rice crop for years. Phân S. built his new house years ago, but his house is still not complete due to a lack of money.  He is, therefore, applying for a US$700 loan from HKL to be used to finish building his new house.

loans.use: To finish building his new house

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
Felna V. is from the village of Palilan,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Felna is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Felna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector vesting and buying fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the local community. Felna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aridna

texts.en:
Aridna R. is from the village of Larayan. She is 45 years old. Aridna is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aridna runs a food stall selling a variety of food products including viands in the local community. Aridna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,900 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Aridna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aridna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Aridna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Aridna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and especially to pay for the education expenditures of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda A. is from the village of Miputak. She is 55 years old. Alfreda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Alfreda owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Alfreda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2006, Alfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase of livestock feeds and supplies for her pig-raising business. 

Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her grocery store and to use as working capital. This will be Alfreda's fifth loan from PMPC and her second loan on Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Los Andes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Andes, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. frutas, quesos, verduras, salchipapas, abarrotes en general, helados, leña, ropa, cereales, tubérculos y transporte D. pasajeros.

Como es el caso D. la señora Irene que es casada y tiene 47 años, Irene venD. frutas en el mercado 12 D. abril, actividad que realiza todos los días, Irene necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas.

Mientras que Jeorgina es conviviente y tiene 47 años, Jeorgina se dedica a la venta D. quesos D. manera ambulatoria en el puente nuevo. Jeorgina necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quesos.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 11,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. frutas, quesos, verduras, arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, papa, helados, leña y trigo.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales, tener casa propia, ampliar su negocios.
texts.en:
The Los Andes community bank is starting its fourth cycle with 16 members. The members engage in a range of businesses selling products and services such as fruits, cheeses, vegetables, salchipapas, miscellaneous grocery products, ice cream, firewood, clothing, grain and taxi services.

Irene, for example, 47 and married, sells fruit in the 12 D. abril market, work that she does every day. She needs a 300-soles loan to buy fruit for resale. Her fellow member, Jeorgina, 47 and partnered, works as a street vendor, selling cheeses at the new bridge. Jeorgina needs a 300-soles loan that she will use to buy cheese for resale.

The members need different amounts of credit--300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles--that add up to a total of 11,700 soles, the amount the community bank is applying to borrow. The loan will be used to buy fruit, cheeses, vegetables, rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, potatoes, ice cream, firewood and wheat for resale.

The members dream of seeing their children finish school and start professional careers; owning their own homes; and expanding their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S. was born in 1982 and is a married woman, but she doesn’t have a child. Her husband is Chantha, age 32, and he earns a living as a rice farmer.

Keo S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs, which she sells when they are grown. Also, she works with her husband on the farm.

Because the pig-raising enterprise is a very profitable one for Keo S. and her family, she has requested a loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. Any remaining money from the loan she will use to construct a rice store in order to store mature rice.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali F. is from the village of Purok-Bularan, Miputak. She is 35 years old. Ali is married and has two very young and two school-aged children. To make a living, Ali owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ali is just starting this business.

In 2008, Ali joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ali has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Ali is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ali from PMPC. She want to have a better and more comfortable house to live in. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Rosana Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Rosana  del Socorro L. Méndez, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, realiza las labores de camarera en un hotel de playa, se encarga de la limpieza de las habitaciones y otras actividades que le asignan en su trabajo, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de un equipo de sonido, esto por que en las casas comerciales tienen que pagar el doble del valor del articulo, con lo cual al solicitar este financiamiento se ahorran mucho dinero.
texts.en:
Rosana del Socorro L. Méndez is the mother of two school-aged children. She works as a housekeeper in a beach hotel, in charge of cleaning the rooms as well as other duties assigned to her on the job. She is requesting this loan to buy a stereo system. Customers who finance the purchase with the store have to pay double the value of the item, so this loan will save her a lot of money.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying electronic equipment

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita A. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Pta Salong Manapla, Negros Occidental with her husband and their five children who are between 7 and 27 years old. Three of the children are already working and two currently go to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her family's living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Nenita is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so she can sustain and expand her general store business. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: El Malinche Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Malinche I lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y emprendedoras un ejemplo de ello es la señora Aura Lila B. Simones  quien desde hace cuatro años se dedica a realizar enchiladas y sopas los fines de semana ya sea de mondongo, de albóndiga, hueso, de res, de queso y de marisco.
Sus compañeros de grupo son Julia Pérez vende gaseosa pollo, helados  y cría animales domésticos  como gallina y cerdos mientras Maricela G. tiene una pequeña miscelánea. Ellos invertirán el crédito en productos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The El Malinche I group is made up of three hard-working, purposeful, enterprising women. An example is Aura Lila B. Simones who has made mondongo (tripe), meatball, beef bone, cheese and seafood enchiladas and soups on weekends for the last four years. Her fellow group members are Julia Pérez, who sells soft-drinks, chicken and frozen treats and also raises small farm animals like chickens and pigs, and Maricela Gonzalez who has a small general store. They will invest the funds in products for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, vegetables, meat, soup bones, etc.

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Phem L. is 59 years old and married. To help provide for her family's needs, Phem L. sells a few grocery items out of her home. She has been in this business for years and earns approximately $2.50 per day. To help contribute to the family, her husband works as a wood builder in the village. This couple has been married for years and they have six children: five are married and have already moved into their own homes and one is single. Phem L. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell.

loans.use: to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell

loans.name: Rolando Domingo

texts.es: Domingo Rolando su actividad económica es una miscelánea, hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio pues esta es la segunda vez que realiza financiamiento ya que la experiencia ha sido muy reconfortante, pues junto a su esposa ha logrado superar ciertos obstáculos que se le han presentado como la competencia, pues Domingo siempre ofrece muy buenos consejos a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. El desea tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Domingo Rolando carries out miscellaneous economic activities. For more than 15 years, he has dedicated himself to this business. This is the second time he has received financing, as the experience has been very comforting. Together with his wife, he has managed to overcome certain obstacles that have presented themselves, such as the competition. Domingo always offers very good advice to his customers. The funds he requests are for the purchase of raw materials. He wishes to have another business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francis Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Francis Verónica S. R., es casada y su esposo labora como taxista, tiene dos hijos menores de  edad que se dedican a los estudios, ellos habitan en el populoso Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ella realiza los trabajos domésticos, y es su esposo el que lleva el sustento económico, ellos habitan en una casa muy humilde que con sus esfuerzos físicos y ahorros personales la han remodelado lentamente y afectaban de sobremanera la sobrevivencia diaria de la familia.

Uno de sus principales planes es precisamente la culminación de las reparaciones a la infraestructura de su hogar, que por sus condiciones limitadas de habitad, no les ha permitido llevar a cabo la culminacion de estos planes, razón por que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para la edificacion de un muro que proteja de las lluvias y ventarrones y brinde una mayor seguridad de la delincuencia que amenaza dia a dia a los pobladores del barrio donde ellos residen, un mejor habitad les brindara a los padres la tranquilidad y satisfacción de ofrecerle a sus pequeños, la posibilidad de que ellos se desarrollen en un ambiente digno y seguro en donde morar.
texts.en:
Francis Verónica S. R. is married, and her husband works as a taxi driver. They have two minor children; they go to school. They live in the populous Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. She does the domestic chores, and her husband supports them economically. They live in a very humble house. With their physical efforts and their personal savings, they have been able to slowly renovate the house. This greatly affected her family’s daily survival. One of their main plans is to finish the renovation of the infrastructure of their home. Due to its limited living conditions, they not been able to complete this plan. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. The loan is to build a wall, which will provide protection from the rains and the windstorms. The wall will also provide greater security from the delinquency, which is a daily threat to the inhabitants of their neighborhood. A better place to live will give the parents peace of mind. It will also give them the satisfaction of proving their children with the possibility of growing up in a decent atmosphere and a safe place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockpile beans, cassava flour, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Celinda tiene 63 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y una de sus hijas, ya que sus dos hijos son mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica en la venta de comida en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la localidad donde vive. Su forma de trabajo consiste en captar clientes que trabajan en un conocido mercado, en donde ofrece ciertos platillos y a pedido los prepara para luego distribuirlos. Es por ello que obtiene ingresos diarios, resultándole muy rentable este negocio, pero el tener que trasladar las viandas de comida hasta el puesto de cada comerciante le es muy pesado y difícil. Celinda se siente contenta con su trabajo, y día a día se esfuerza para lograr hacerlo bien. Es su treceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para facilitarle la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Celinda, 63, lives in her own home with her husband and one of her three children - the other two children are grown and live alone. Celinda sells food at one of the more popular markets in the area. Her customers are market workers to whom she delivers custom made dishes. Her business does quite well, but the food containers can be heavy and hard to transport, making delivery difficult. Celinda loves her job, and works hard every day to do it well. This is her 13th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make timely payments. With the loan, she wants to buy more food preparation materials.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food prep materials

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en: Buenaventura P. is from the village of Delusom. She is 58 years old, married and has 3 adult and 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Buenaventura owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Buenaventura has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Buenaventura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenaventura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Buenaventura is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Buenaventura from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en: Faleseu R. is 46 and married with seven children. She plants and harvests taro for sale. Faleseu has four years of experience in this business. Faleseu needs a loan of 2,500 Samoan tala to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or about $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees. In 2007, Faleseu joined SPBD. This is her fifth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faleseu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La Señora Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos,  la señora estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora Asunta esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado, que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le permitió  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. compra y  venta D. animales menores.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar  mas animales para luego engordarlas y poder venderlas en las ferias.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar el negocio y obtner mayores ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Señora Asunta is a member of the ‘Mataro Chico’ community bank which is located in Santiago D. Pupuja district, Azángaro province, Puno department. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She completed primary school. Asunta has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four months. She used her first loan of S/.500 to buy more young animals to fatten and then sell. Now she is asking for another loan of S/.500 to buy more animals to fatten and then sell in markets. Her dream is to improve her business and increase her income. Asunta really likes the meetings and training sessions organised by the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young animals to fatten

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 35 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Rosalie owns and operates a general store, selling NFA rice, corn grits, dried fish, soft drinks and canned goods. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angela Flor

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

La señora Ángela tiene 71 años de edad, se caso hace 33 años y fruto de esta relación tuvo dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, ella vive sola con su esposo, pero uno de sus hijos tiene su casa al lado de ellos, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y a trabajar en el campo.

Ella  además de ser una ama de casa, en la noche se dedica a la venta de chifles acompañado de pescado y carne hornadas lo cual hace un plato delicioso y muy solicitado, toda la semana sale con el esposo hasta la plaza central de la parroquia para poner su  puesto, no lo ha dejado de hacer desde hace 30 años ya que son los únicos en vender este plato, la señora Ángela prepara todo para su negocio, tiene que comprar los plátanos pelarlos y freírlos para en la noche servirlos con un buen pescado de la zona y con una  buena  ensalada.

Este nuevo crédito la señora Ángela lo invertirá en su negocio y otra parte se lo va a dar a su marido para los sembríos que tiene. Tiene cinco años en el Banco Comunal y siempre le han gustado las reuniones ya que en ellas comparte con sus amigas.
 
Su sueño es gozar de buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Picoaza is recorded as one of the aboriginal villages part of the Manta culture. This urban parish, located just ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi province, and rich with stories, is where the members of the Banco Comunal María Asunción loan group meet every couple of weeks. 

Angela is 71 years old. She has been married for 33 years and she has two grown-up children. She lives with her husband. One of their sons lives in the house next door. Her husband works as a building worker and also in the fields.

Besides being a housewife, in the evenings Angela sells banana chips and roasted fish and meat, which make a delicious dish that is in high demand. Every week she goes to the central square in the parish with her husband and sets up her stall. She has done it for 30 years, because they are the only ones to sell this particular dish. Angela prepares everything for the business: she buys the bananas, peels them and fries them, to serve them in the evening with delicious local fish and a tasty salad. 

Angela will invest the loan in her business and give a part of it to her husband so he can use it towards his crops. She has worked with the loan group for five years and she has always enjoyed the meetings, because she has good friends in the group.

Her dream is for her and her family to be healthy.

loans.use: Buy bananas, fish, meat, vegetables and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: Valeriana tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas sembrando principalmente alfalfa ya que es uno de los productos que le generan mayores ganancias. Asimismo siembra otros productos mas que le sirven para complementar sus ganancias. También cría animales que lleva a campos lejanos para pastar y después de varios meses venderlos. Valeriana tiene muchos deseos de seguir progresando es por ello que esta pensando sembrar en más extensiones de terreno para continuar su producción. Es el noveno crédito que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Valeriana, 51, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  She has been a farmer for many years growing primarily alfalfa which is one of the most profitable products.  She also plants other products to add to her profits.  In addition, she raises animals that she takes to pasture in distant fields and after a few months sells them. Valeriana has many wishes to continue to progress so she is thinking about planting larger fields to continue with production.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she’s known for being a responsible person with respect to repayments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.

She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan that will be so helpful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure to use on the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
Maria Paulina tiene 56 años, vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Paulina se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora y su actividad económica principal es la preparación de tortas y los vende a la cadena de supermercados “MEGA” y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de cosméticos. 

Maria Paulina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 1000 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, leche y muchos cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Paulina is 56 years old.  She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Maria Paulina considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother and her main business activity is baking cakes which she sells to the “MEGA” supermarket chain.  Her additional business activity is selling cosmetics.

Maria Paulina will use her loan for $1,000USD to increase her business capital and buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk and a lot of other things.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk and a lot of other things

loans.name: Eyra De La Soledad

texts.es: Eyra  tiene 59 años. La actividad económica es la venta de cerdos y gallina. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio por su esposo ya que anteriormente ella se hacía cargo y por no dejar inactivo el negocio le dijo propuso a su esposa que continuara con el negocio. Los propósitos de ella para su negocio son de ofrecer buena calidad en sus animales para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo comprar cerdos y gallinas y al mismo tiempo el alimento de estos animales. El sueño de Eyra es ampliar su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Eyra is 59 years old.  Her business is selling pigs and hens.  She has been in this business for more than 8 years.  She started this business because of her husband.  He used to be in charge of the business and, in order not to leave it inactive, he suggested to his wife that she take it over.  Her suggestions for the business are to offer good quality animals in order to gain more customers.  The loan will be used as working capital to buy pigs and hens and, at the same time, feed for these animals.  Eyra's dream is to expand her small business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva P. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Eva is married and has one child of school age. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a bakeshop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of staple products, including breads, for the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was invested in renovating the business. Eva is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients and provide working capital

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 48 años, vive con su hija en una casa alquilada. DesD. hace 20 años venD. dulces, gaseosa y frutas en L. plaza principal D. su localidad. Todos los días su actividad lo realiza en compañía D. su hija, quien L. ayuda en las ventas. Su trabajo requiere D. mucha constancia para poder vender toda L. mercadería que tiene, además cada dos días D. semana se abastece D. mercadería. Le agrada estar en su trabajo porque es independiente y tiene ingresos diarios que le permiten solventar los gastos D. su hogar, su deseo es seguir dedicándose en su negocio con L. idea D. mejorar e incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Es el crédito número 17 con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en: Simona is 48 years old and lives with her daughter in a rented house. She has been selling candy, sodas and fruit for 20 years now in the main square of her town. She works there every day with her daughter, who helps her with sales. Her job requires her to work quite hard in order to sell all of her merchandise. She also stocks up on goods every two days. She is happy with her job because it allows her to be independent and to earn money every day which allows her to cover her household expenses. She would like to keep working at her job and to improve and increase the amount of merchandise that she sells. This is her 17th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She is also glad to be part of her community bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive individuals. Likewise she would like to thank everyone who contributes to the loan she is requesting as it will be very helpful for the development of her business. She plans to use the requested loan to buy more merchandise for her stand.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to keep her stand well-stocked

loans.name: Nélida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus familiares. Hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y los vende de casa en casa a amigos y familiares, es así que sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos. Dichos productos son de garantía ya que provienen de empresas reconocidas en el mercado y eso le da mucha ventaja en las ventas. Su gran entusiasmo que tiene le ha llevado a cumplir sus propias metas por lo que ahora se propone a tener ventas mayores para asegurarse en sus ganancias. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos al por mayor.
texts.en: Nélida is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in her relatives’ house.  She has worked selling cosmetics for three years and she sells them every day from house-to-house to friends and family members.  These products are of good quality as they come from companies that are renowned in the market, giving her a great advantage in her sales.  Her great enthusiasm has helped her to accomplish her own goals, which is why she is determined to have greater sales to secure her earnings.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because she knows all of the group members and they are responsible and supportive people.  She is grateful for all those who will find the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the loan requested to invest in the purchase of more wholesale cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Mayra Natali

texts.es:
Mayra es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una localidad de terrenos bastante fértiles que se encuentra bastante cerca a la sierra de norte de nuestro país. Se encuentra situado aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Mayra se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos, ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes (en su mayoría vecinos y conocidos), el pedido le llega los fines de mes y ella gana dinero de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que realice. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Mayra desea adquirir productos por cuenta propia para poder contar con un stock fijo que le permita satisfacer rápidamente la demanda con la que cuenta, sin tener que llegar a fin de mes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and young son in the agricultural district of Oyotún, a place of fertile lands which is located quite near our country's northern mountain range, approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years, Mayra has been selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She takes orders, offering her products to her customers (mainly neighbors and acquaintances).  Her goods arrive at the end of the month and she earns money according to how many orders she has taken.  She uses the income that she makes from this business activity to help her husband support their family financially.

Mayra would like to acquire products with her own money so that she can have a fixed stock that will allow her to quickly satisfy the demand that she has, without having to wait until the end of the month.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire cosmetics with her own money so that she can have a fixed stock

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng N. was born in 1984.  She lives with her husband and 5-year-old child in Roluos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phat Tok, is a Khmer cheese seller at a local market, where he is able to earn some extra money for the family. Since her husband’s business is going well, Mrs. Sieng N. wants to expand it. To support this goal, she is seeking a loan to buy more Khmer cheese to resell; she will save the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding and start a new business.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cheese to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia produce flores ella les brinda el cuidado necesario para luego venderlo a sus clientes que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en Cusco  especialmente en el mercado de Huancaro los días sabados de feria , a la vez la socia es docente del nivel primario ahora ella se encuentra de vacaciones y esta mas dedicada a cultivas sus flores, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para la plantación de sus flores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the Los Angeles communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Sonia. She is 31 years old, married, and she has a son. She grows flowers and she brings them when needed to sell to her clients in Valle Sagrado and Cusco, especially to the Huancaro market on Saturdays. She is also a primary school teacher but she is now on holidays and she dedicates more time to grow her flowers. She is a very happy individuals and she eager to move forward.

She requests a loan to purchase seeds for her flower plantation. 

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow flowers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school. Mary has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 18 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more charcoal. The main business challenge for Mary is transportation. Her goal is to buy her own plot of land. Mary has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca B. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Prisca is single. Prisca owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services of motorcycles & small vehicles to local community members. Prisca has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Prisca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 15,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service.

Prisca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase tools & utilities needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy restaurant furniture

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Tob S., 38 and living with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, sells rice and noodles, typically making US$7 per day, while her husband, a construction worker who builds houses, earns on average US$2 each day. Tob S. is requesting a loan of US$1200 for two purposes: she will use half  to invest in her current business of selling rice and noodle and the rest  to finish her construction.

loans.use: to expand her business of selling rice and noodle and to finish her construction

loans.name: Mercelinda

texts.en:
Mercelinda O. lives in the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old, widowed and has four school-aged children. She earns a living by making and selling snacks and local delicacies such as balot or hard-boiled duck eggs. She has been in this line of work for more than four years and earns about 4,500 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Mercelinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 4,000 PHP to buy ingredients such as duck eggs. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as duck eggs

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Lamin, who is married and has three children aged 8, 12 and 14 years. In 2003, Lamin established his used clothing business as a means of support for his family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business.

Having already received and repaid two loans, Lamin requires a new loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy bales of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000 and in the future plans to open another used clothing business to be managed by his wife. Lamin thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family.  Luciana is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Luciana requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like soft-drinks, snack etc. to sell in her stall.

Luciana has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future, Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft-drinks, snack etc. to sell in her stall

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is 57 years of age and is married with nine adult children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. Melecio's wife is a housekeeper, and at the same time, she is planting and harvesting vegetables to sell. 

Melecio is asking for a loan to buy inputs needed in his farm such as fertilizers (like manure) and seeds of corn. He will also use the loan to pay for the services of land preparation of his farm. Of his nine children, only two have not yet finished their education. 

In the future, Melecio hopes that his business will earn a higher income from the yields to continue sending the last two children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of corn for his farm.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is married and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Celia is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables to earn a living. She delivers vegetables like leafy vegetable, squash, and beans to the local market. She has been doing this business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. Celia has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Celia hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 72 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. bisutería, ella hace aretes, collares y pulseras y lo venD. en forma ambulatoria, la socia también es profesora y por medio D. este trabajo y negocio sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como plata para hacer aretes, collares y pulseras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank "AMAUTA" located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is 72 years old, married and has 2 children. She combines her daily activities with her jewelry business. She makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets and sells them on the street. She is also a teacher, and through her job and her business she helps her children to get ahead. She wants to improve her jewelry business. She asks for a loan to buy materials like silver to make earrings, necklaces and bracelets. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials like silver to make earrings, necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 55 and married with nine children, with the last three still schooling. She has been in active farming in her hometown of Nyamira in South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces tea, milk, beans, and bananas among others with all going to the local market.

Joyce has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional income will help her provide food and improve the general living standards of her family. In future she would like to run a cereal-grinding business in the local market.

She mentions high costs of farm inputs especially fertilizers as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is single. He is doing interior design, which is a mobile kind of business. He has been running this business for eight years. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy materials for his trade like tiles, carpets, paint, wallpaper, etc.
 
He desires to establish his trade in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his trade like tiles, carpets, paint, wallpaper, etc

loans.name: Felipa Esperanza

texts.es: Felipa Esperanza tiene 66 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Tiene 6 hijos a su cargo y todos los días busca la forma de mejorar la atención que les proporciona a sus clientes. Uno de sus desafíos han sido los problemas de salud que ha tenido, pero siempre está luchando y buscando como sobrevivir. Ella se levanta temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche que todavía llegan ciertos clientes a comprar. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su materia prima en granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, huevos, sardinas, café, gaseosas y jabón.
texts.en: Felipa Esperanza is 66 years old.  She owns a small grocery store, which has been her livelihood for 8 years.   She has 6 children under her care and everyday she looks for ways to improve the service she provides to her customers.  One of her challenges has been health problems that she has had, but she is always fighting and looking for ways to survive.  She arises early and works from 7:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night because certain customers still come in to shop.  The loan she is requesting is to increase her inventory of basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juices, eggs, sardines, coffee, sodas, and soap..

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juices, eggs, coffee, sardines, soda, and soap.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking mother. She doesn't want to laze about at home. She has had a farming business for almost 13 years. They plant and harvest rice for future sale. She has helped her husband in maintaining their farming business. She wants to improve her crop production and generate more income in order to sustain the education of her only daughter, who might also need money for daily expenses. During the crop season in May, she usually earns about 35,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to have additional revolving capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

Edna aims to continuously produce an abundant harvest to earn enough money for the college education of her child. She would like to provide a better education for her child, leading  someday to good employment, and in that way help her improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, cheese and pork crackling for her store and pupusa business.

loans.name: Meni

texts.en:
Meni is a 34-year-old lady who is married to Melki, a 43-year-old man. They are blessed with four children: Yulmen, 18, and Sani, 16; both are at Senior High School and currently living with their grandmother in another village; Jesica, 8, at the fourth grade of Primary School and Alda, 1, not at school yet. 

Meni’s husband supports their family by selling fish from door to door, but the profit generated is often insufficient to fully cover their daily needs. Meni then decided to run her own business, a kiosk, to support her husband in generating more income. Meni has been running the business for three years. She initiated the business by using her own small capital. 

Meni and her husband are a hard-working couple. They are thinking about running another business such raising livestock: cattle and pigs. Meni is optimistic that the business will help them generate more income for their family. Therefore, she would like to request a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to purchase young cattle and piglets to be raised and to purchase more stock such as instant noodles, shampoo, snacks, etc. for her kiosk business. Meni is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle and piglets to be raised and to purchase more stock such as instant noodles, shampoo, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. She lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Mary Ann has been farmng for 8 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 1,200. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm. Mary Ann has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business so that she can give moral support to her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her  farm

loans.name: Connie Joy

texts.en:
Connie Joy is 26 years old. She is married and has a child..

Connie Joy is into the business of cooking different viand, after which she packs it inside plastic cellophane and sells it to her neighbors by going house to house. She has had this business for two years.

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy the needed materials to be used in cooking the different kinds of viand like meat, vegetables and other cooking condiments.

Connie Joy joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients in cooking different viand, which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Kitagata Women Group

texts.en: Perezi is a thirty-eight-year-old widow with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in coffee for one year. She was initially buying coffee in basins and now buys it in sacks. Her hardships are customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Her business goals are buying land, moving her business to a more permanent location and expanding her business to new markets. Perezi needs the loan facility to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee.

loans.name: Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La joven Leniz Yolanda tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, reside en el Barrio Jesus en el municipio de Juticalpa, y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz.

Leniz se graduó en la carrera de Administracion de Empresas y por varios meses anduvo buscando trabajo y no pudo encontrar alguno. Entonces como ella tenía la urgente necesidad de ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento del hogar, decidió crear su propio negocio y fue asi como se le ocurrió instalar una tortilleria, y aunque al inicio fue algo pequeño al dia de hoy ya cuenta con dos empleadas y tiene dos años de haber inaugurado su negocio. Su horario de atencion al cliente inicia a las 4 am y culmina a las 12 del mediodia. Su principal desventaja es que paga un alquiler muy alto, pero gracias a Dios tiene muchos clientes y nunca a tenido problemas con el pago del local.

El prestamo que Leniz está solicitando lo necesita para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y maseca. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella y sus empleadas podrán seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos que les permitiran cubrir algunos de los gastos del hogar. 

El sueño de Leniz es tener su propia casa y tambien su propio local, ya que gran parte de sus ganancias se van en el pago de alquiler del local. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
The young woman Leniz Yolanda is 24 years old. She is married and has a small son, age 4. She lives in the Jesus neighborhood in the municipality of Juticalpa and makes and sells corn tortillas.

Leniz graduated with a degree in business administration and was looking for work for several months but wasn’t able to find anything. Then, since she had an urgent need to help her family support the household, she decided to start her own business. That’s how she began her tortilla shop, and, although at first it was a small business, today she already has two employees. She began the business two years ago.

Her work day begins at 4:00 a.m. and ends at noon. Her main drawback is that her rent is very high, but, thanks to God, she has a lot of customers and has never had problems paying for the shop.

Leniz needs the loan she is applying for in order to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and corn flour. With the support of this loan she and her employees will be able to continue having a source of income that will permit them to cover some of their household expenses.

Leniz’s dream is to have her own house and also her own shop since a large part of her earnings goes to pay rent. This is her first cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make all her installment payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime, and corn flour.

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: Melania mujer emprendedora, comerciante desde hace un tiempo, oficio costurera, los planes que sus hijos alcance estudiar una carrera, obtara a mejor salario un futuro mejor que el de ella. Con el préstamo anterior logro construir las paredes de los cuartos y para este nuevo ciclo de préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales como: láminas de zinc corrugadas, perlines, golosas, pintura contra oxidación, entre otros materiales entechado los cuartos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su proyecto de construir su vivienda por completo obteniendo seguridad, comodidad para su familia.
texts.en: Melania is an enterprising businesswoman who’s been sewing for some time.  Her plans include her children having careers and making more money than she’s been able to make.  She used the money from the previous loan to build the walls in her home and this loan will be used to buy corrugated zinc sheeting, iron bars, finishing, anti-rust paint, and other things to finish the rooms.  She appreciates the financial support for her home building project, helping to improve the security and comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries and clothes  for resale

loans.name: Boniventure

texts.en:
Boniventure, 43 years old and a father of four, sells coffee, dried beans, rice and peas in Ibanda. This has been his business for nine years now.

On the face of it, he is making a killing selling most of the aforementioned crops. Demand is high and clients come from as far off as Mbarara, the biggest urban center in the West of Uganda.
