For that reason, he feels that expanding his business beyond the borders of Ibanda would be a good proposition.

He says he will use his loan to purchase more bags of coffee, beans, rice, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coffee, beans, rice, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Elsa Aurora

texts.es:
Elsa Aurora tiene 39 años es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Elsa Aurora se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 5 años,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza de la casa.
texts.en:
Elsa Aurora is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas canton in the precinct of Campo Alegre. 

The San Jacinto community bank is located in the Campo Alegre precinct, near Guare parish, which is in Ventanas canton. The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. 

Elsa Aurora has been working in agriculture growing corn and rice for five years. She buys her products from Comercial Jiménez in Ventanas and sells her goods in the same city. 

She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to care for her crops, which are helping her increase her family's income. Her dream is to have a house and plot of land. 

She enjoys cleaning her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionicia tiene 59 años está casada con el señor Gerónimo juntos tienen  3 hijos que aun dependen de sus ingresos y además están estudiando en la universidad, una de sus hijas estudia en el colegio militar, a pesar de su edad  juntos trabajan muy duro para casar adelante a sus hijos, viven en la comunidad de Playa Ancha de la ciudad de Cochabamba, viven en su casa propia su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, la leche entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos y también se dedican a la producción de semillas de  Cebolla y Zanahoria en sus terrenos agrícolas que tiene.
El destino del crédito es la para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero con lo cual incrementara su producción y tendrá más ingresos mismo que lo usara para los estudios de sus hijos.
Entre sus sueños de doña Dionicia es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y que de esa  manera puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida y además  ya no trabajaran tanto y descansaran ya que están en la edad de hacerlo.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionicia is 59 years old and married to Sr. Gerónimo.  They have three children who are financially dependent on them and are also studying at the university.  One of their daughters attends a military college.  Despite their age, Dionicia and her husband work very hard as a couple so that their children can move forward.  They live in the community of Playa Ancha in the city of Cochabamba.  Dioncia and her husband own their home and her main business activity is raw milk production.  The milk is delivered to a company that makes dairy products.  Dionicia also plants onion and carrot seeds on the farmland that she owns.  

This loan will be used to buy one head of dairy cattle so that she can increase production.  She will have more income to designate for her children’s studies.  Doña Dionicia dreams of seeing her children finish their education so that they can have a better standard of living.  At that point, she and her husband can stop working and rest since they are already at the appropriate age to do so.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Ces dernières ayant un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois ont su développer un esprit de solidarité leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Bintou (assise à l’extrême droite  avec la main  gauche levée) est représentante du groupe, âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 01 fille. Malgré son jeune âge elle reste très courageuse et sérieuse dans la gestion de ses activités. Elle s’active dans la vente de cuisse de poulet et de poisson frais. Elle achète le poisson par caisse à 7000 F Cfa et le carton de cuisse à 8 000 F Cfa pour la revente par peser au besoin de sa clientèle respectivement 1 600 et 2 000 F Cfa le kg. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter  4 caisses de poisson frais et  4 cartons de cuisse pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de participer activement dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group consists of women who show great determination in their income-generating activities. Having extensive experience with the Banc Villageois programs, they have developed a spirit of solidarity that helps them to face many situations. They work in small trade.

Mrs. Bintou (sitting at the far right with her left hand raised) is the group’s representative. She is a 60-year-old married mother of a daughter. Despite her young age, she is very brave and she takes the management of her activities very seriously. She sells fresh fish and chicken thighs. She buys the fish at 7000 FCfa per crate, and the chicken thighs at 8000 FCfa per carton. She sells this merchandise by weight at 1600 FCfa and 2000 FCfa per kilogram respectively.  

She will use this loan to buy 4 crates of fresh fish and 4 cartons of chicken thighs to sell.

The profits earned will allow her to save and to play an active role in supporting her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy 4 crates of fresh fish and 4 cartons of chicken thighs to sell.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BADENYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 43ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de SETOU qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
SETOU, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excellente dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (soumbala, poivre, tomate, oignon, choux.).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de condiments

loans.name: Luxmi Group Two

texts.en: Kunjeshwori lives with her family of 4 in Imphal East district of Manipur state in the Eastern part of India. She is the group leader and runs a cloth shop where she sells shawls, phaneks, salwars, kurtas, etc. As the price of clothes have risen, she could not get the profit margin she used to have and hence she wants to add more clothing items so that the profit margin increases. Similarly, the remaining members of the groups are also engaged in the cloth selling business and all of them needed extra capital to expand their businesses. Hence they decided to form a group and applied for a loan. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items to expand her cloth shop and sell shawls, salwars, kurtas, etc.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose owns a fish stand at a local market near his home. He has been working in the seafood industry since he was young when he helped his father. When he married his current wife he already had this business which has always helped him support his family. He wakes up everyday at 5 in the morning to buy the freshest fish and take it to his stand. His wife helps him on the weekends which are always busier at these markets.

He needs this loan in order to fix up his stand. He will also buy much larger quantities of fish at discount prices. He believes that this will help him increase his revenue and profit. With the increased money from the loans he plans to also fix up the run down walls and floor of his home. He is also planning on converting the rooms where his kids lived to an apartment he can rent out for a complimentary source of income.

Jose is 56 years old, is married and has three children. His wife has been his right hand for the business as she has always had the capacity to take lead as well as assist. He has three college aged kids who have jobs but who he still helps financially.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Make improvements to his stand at the local market and buy fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: I am a single man. I am the head of a 6-person household. I am the main bread-earner. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents due to HIV/AIDS in 2005.

loans.use: I will use the loan to purchase bicycle repair equipment.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok P. is 32 years old and lives with her mother and sister in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She works as a tailor and can make about $7.00 per day in revenue.  As she is a single woman, she struggles to support the family.  P. would like to use this loan to purchase sewing machines and also to buy clothes in order to expand her business and increase her income.  In the future, P. would like to open a grocery store in her village because she feels that grocery is a more lucrative business than tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and more clothes for her business

loans.name: Mar

texts.en:
Mrs. Mar C. L. is 43 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a grocer and her husband is a security guard. They have 5 children, three of whom are still in school. They earn 4 dollars a day. Mrs. Mar C. L. wants to increase her grocery so she has to buy a grocery store.
In the future, she would like to expand her business by providing a wide range of products.

loans.use: To purchase a grocery store to operate a business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Vụ and her husband Lê Duy Hoàn live in Quảng Hùng, Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. They have 4 children. The living conditions are tough, they are having a hard time financially so the oldest of the children had quit school to go to work. The other three are still going to school. Mr Lê Duy Hoàn is a state employee working in a brick factory but work is not stable. They are requesting a loan of 400 USD to start a business of breeding pigs and chickens. They've already renovated the pigs pen. They have high hope to succeed in this venture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Gia đình anh chị Lê Thị Vụ có 4 người con, hiện đang sống tại xã Quảng Hùng, Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Điều kiện gia đình khó khăn nên cháu đầu phải nghỉ học đi làm trợ giúp bố mẹ. Hiện nay anh chị đang nuôi 3 cháu ăn học. Bản thân chồng chị, anh Lê Duy Hoàn, là cán bộ nhà máy gạch K2 nhưng vì công việc không nhiều nên không có việc làm ổn định. Với số vốn vay 400 USD anh chị định mua thêm lợn gà về chăn nuôi. Chuồng trại đã được anh chị sửa sang hoàn chỉnh hy vọng đợt chăn nuôi này sẽ đạt được kết quả cao hơn nữa.

loans.use: to buy chicken and pigs

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer valiente y con alto sentido de servicio que cada día busca obtener ganancias con su labor y también procura que las personas que acudan a ella por su servicio se beneficien. Desde siempre se ha caracterizado por sus inmensas ansias de conocimiento y es gracias ha este apetito que en sus años de juventud decidió estudiar la carrera de sociología porque siempre tuvo anhelos de observar y ayudar a construir una mejor sociedad; es por ello que se dedicó por mucho tiempo a la docencia al igual que su esposo. Pasaron los años y cuando su esposo se jubiló recibió una liquidación por sus años de servicio y después de hacer un análisis de demandas generales en su sociedad ambos decidieron abrir sus pequeñas microempresas para continuar satisfaciendo sus necesidades con éxito y sin ninguna premura. Rosa se decidió por instalar un molino de granos y su esposo por una empresa productora de yeso. Gracias a su incansable labor les ha podido brindar educación y bienestar a sus hijas y ahora desea seguir cumpliendo esa noble labor con su hija menor de 14 años. Ahora desea implementar e incrementar los servicios de su molinera para seguir ofreciendo a las diligentes familias de su localidad un excelente servicio además de las rebajas y promociones acostumbradas con el objetivo de que ellas también puedan verse beneficiadas al momento de realizar la venta final de sus productos. Tu aporte será muy valioso decídete hoy a colaborar con esta solidaria mujer.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa is a strong woman with a great work ethic who, every day, seeks new ways to increase her earnings by working hard. She also works every day to ensure that the people who depend on her are satisfied. She has always been characterized by her immense thirst for knowledge and it is thanks to this that in her younger years she decided to study sociology. She always had a desire to observe and help others in building a better society; it is because of this that she chose the same course of study as her husband. A few years later, when her husband retired, they received a pension for his years of service. After analyzing their community, they saw a demand and decided to open a small business to continue to meet their needs successfully and quickly. Rosa began work on a grain mill and her husband on a plant producing herbs. Through their tireless efforts they have been able to provide for education and wellbeing of their daughters and hope to continue with their youngest daughter who is 14. Now she would like to begin and increase different services in her mill to be able to continue offering excellent service to the local families who depend on her, besides the usual discounts and promotions, with the hope that they too might benefit from the final sale of their products. Your contribution will be very valuable! Decídete today to work in together with this Rosa!

loans.use: Improvement on the mill to increase productivity

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella O. is 38 years old of age.  She lives in Benin City and is married with 6 children.  She sells fabric and rubber slippers. She trained in her business for 6 months and started her own in 2002.  She is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and slippers for sale.  She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and slippers for sale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
I have a children’s party entertainment business. This is my family’s sole source of income, and my whole family is involved. I have been in business for over 20 years because it is one of the happiest types of jobs around. My family and I would like to buy a higher capacity sound system in order to provide our customers with better service. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD to buy the sound system.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan Carlos se dedica a la animación de fiestas infantiles. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que en el trabajamos todos. Tengo ya mas de 20 años dedicándome a este trabajo ya que es uno de los más alegres trabajos que hay. Mi familia y yo queremos comprar un equipo de sonido con mejor capacidad y así darles un mejor servicio a las personas que contratan nuestro show. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. para la compra de un sonido.

loans.use: Purchase of DJ sound system

loans.name: Ivette Del Rosario

texts.es:
The manufacture of blouses and shirts requires a skill that not everyone possesses, as it requires great interest and ability. Ms. Ivette G. has been devoted to her work as seamstress for the past three years, at her home in the city of León.

She went through great difficulties as she started her business, with no clients and the pressing need to support her little child. She has improved her business with the years, by means of loans she has requested to Ceprodel. Today, thanks to these loans, she has been able to acquire sewing tools and materials and has invested in a new and better sewing machine. Her greatest wish is to win more clients, in order to keep providing for her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La elaboración de blusas y camisas es una destreza que no todas las personas poseen, por ser una labor que necesita de mucho interés y sobre todo mucha habilidad para su elaboración. En la ciudad de León, la señora Ivette G. se dedica al trabajo de costurería, teniendo este negocio desde hace 3 años en su casa de habitación.

Comenzó el negocio con mucha problemática ya que no poseía clientes y además tenia urgentemente que mantener a su pequeño hijo. A través de los años, ha venido desarrollando su negocio por medio de créditos que ha solicitado en Ceprodel para el mejoramiento de su negocio. Hoy en día, gracias a estos créditos otorgados ha adquirido sus productos de costurera y además ha invertido en la compra de una nueva máquina con mejores condiciones que la anterior. Su mayor anhelo es captar más clientes para seguir manteniendo su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., 53, works as a farmer earning around $1 a day. Her husband supplements the household's income by also working as farmer.  Normally he earns about $1 a day. This couple has applied for a $800 loan to purchase a water pump to improve yields in their rice field.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for rice farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 27 and 24. Mary is a fish wholesaler; she started her business in 2004. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Mary has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria C. lives in the Batahola North neighborhood, she is single, 52 years old and has a 15 year old daughter who studies high school. She sells snacks, coffee, ice cream, etc. Her goal is to help her daughter become a professional. She's had her small business for 9 years and started with a loan from AFODENIC selling clothes, but with the opening of a school it was better for her to sell in the cafeteria every day, the challenges she has faced are the changes in prices. With the loan she wants to invest more and use it in the school, she also wishes to buy a dresser. Maria is hardworking and has excellent references both personal and credit references.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. María C.: vive en el barrio Batahola Norte es soltera con 52 años de edad Tiene una hija de 15 años cursa la secundaria su actividad económica es venta de golosinas, cafetería y helados, etc. Su objetivo es formar a su hija como toda una profesional. Ella tiene 9 años de tener este pequeño negocio comenzó prestando en AFODENIC, vendiendo ropa, pero con la apertura del colegio le beneficio vender cafetería que es diario, las dificultades que ha tenido son las variaciones de los precios .Con el préstamo que se le dará lo quiere para invertir mas y estabilizarlo en el colegio también desea comprar un ropero, la Sra. María es trabajadora y con referencias excelentes tanto personales como de crédito.

loans.use: To purchase a dresser and merchandise to sell at school cafeteria.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Mrs. Doumbia Assitan Diakité is 41 and a married mother of six children. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children. She began working for her aunt at a very young age, and she has a lot of experience in running food stands. To start her own business, Assitan Diakité decided to join a group loan association in her neighborhood. After three group loans, she has now moved on to an individual loan. All of her previous loans were repaid in full. She purchases beverages, rice, tomatoes, oil and condiments in Bamako. Mrs. Assitan Diakité makes various types of dishes, including rice with lard and rice with different types of sauces. She sells her dishes at the bus station in Bougouni. Her customers are generally travelers and drivers. She earns a monthly profit of 85,000 CFA francs, a part of which she intends to invest to pay off the interest on her loan and help pay her family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Doumbia Assitan Diakité est une femme mariée de 41ans et mère de 06 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants. elle a commencé les activités économiques, dès son jeune âge auprès de sa tante et elle a accumulé beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine de la retauration. Pour obtenir un fonds de commerce Assitan Diakité décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Après 3 prêts solidaires elle est passée au prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précedents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne en boissons, riz tomates huiles condiments à Bamako. Madame Assitan Diakité prépare plusieurs sortes de plats à savoir: le riz au gras et le riz avec plusieures qualités de sauces. Elle mène cette activité à la gare routière de Bougouni.Ses clients sont généralement les voyageurs et les routiers. Elle réalise ainsi un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000FCFA Avec ce bénéfice elle compte investir une partie pour payer les interets de prêt et assurer les dépenses familiales.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for her food stand

loans.name: Atabala

texts.en:
Atabala A. is a 53-year-old farmer who has been breeding calves in the small village of Saatli since 1992. He is married and has five children.

Calf breeding is the only financial source for his family. As summer is peak season for weddings, and meat is very popular for wedding parties, Atabala would like to take this opportunity to purchase four more calves for an estimated cost of $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase four calves for meat production

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
The "Mujeres Activas" Committee was formed by neighbors of the San Pedro and Tres Nacientes neighborhoods, in the city of Ypané. From the start, this committee has been a solid organization. All of the members are working mothers. Twenty of the 22 members appear in the photo. All have their own businesses and work overtime so they can increase their income. The members have shown their unity by establishing and comply with rules and regulations, and in addition, they organize fairs and raffles to raise funds for the committee.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El Comité “Mujeres Activas” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del asentamiento San Pedro y Tres Nacientes respectivamente de la ciudad de Ypané, este comité desde un principio se ha mostrado sólido en cuanto a su organización. Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras, por lo que las une ambas cosas. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran 20 de las 22 integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad estableciendo normas y reglamentos internos a ser cumplidos, a mas de organizar ferias de comidas y rifas para obtener fondos para el Comite.

loans.use: Purchase goods for their businesses.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is 50 years old, and she is married with 10 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business of selling palm oil and groundnut oil since 1995. She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years. She needs the loan amount of $550 to buy more palm oil and groundnut oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more groundnut and palm oil for sale

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 43 years old. She is divorced with 3 children, aged between 21 and 15. She has been a potato and onion seller since 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes and onions for her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and onions for her business

loans.name: Isma

texts.en:
Isma was born in 1963 and lives in Gračanica, a small village in Bosnia. She is married and lives with her two children, who are 15 and 23 years old. Her husband works in construction, but in order to support their family, Isma also does agricultural work from their home. She grows vegetables and raises two cows, selling milk and milk products to earn roughly 200KM/month. (The equivalent of $132 USD.)

Isma requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women International to buy food for her cattle. This loan is vital for her, as rising food prices make it impossible for her to otherwise purchase the food to sustain the cows through the winter.

Isma is excited to report that one of her cows is pregnant. She plans to sell the newborn calf and hopes to make extra money from the additional milk produced by the mother.

loans.use: to purchase food for her two cows

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
La elaboración y venta de tortillas es el negocio al que se dedica la señora María B. en el mercado la Terminal en León.
 
Desde hace 38 años se ha dedicado a este negocio el cual le ha sido el sustento para llevar el pan de cada día a su mesa y a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que ha atravesado, ha superado y mejorado en parte su tramo. Hoy en día ha solicitado un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Esperanza B. bakes and sells tortillas in La Terminal, a market in León. For thirty-eight years she has been in this business. It is what puts the bread on her table. She has partly improved her business -- in spite of the difficult circumstances she has seen and overcome. Now she has requested a loan in Ceprodel to buy raw material for baking tortillas. She hopes that her request for a loan will be granted so that she can use it to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by HannahLily P, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business of selling used clothing in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.en:
Since Bunyod was very young he has been in the agriculture business. He has experience in this business as he has always helped with the cultivation of crops in his home community of Istaravshan, Tajikistan. Now he is the father of two kids who are the main motivation for him. Bunyod has managed to improve his family’s economic situation thanks to the help received from IMON International through a loan that he has used directly for his agricultural business. On this occasion, Bunyod is looking for IMON International’s help so that he can benefit from technical assistance in his farming so that when harvest time comes around he can improve his economic situation.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Srin

texts.en: Mrs. Srin U. lives in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a pig breeder. Since her  business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Sin Soeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srin U. has three children, one of whom is a polisher while another is employed in a garment factory and the third is a construction worker. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To expand a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is forty years old. She is a single parent of one child, a girl who has completed senior high school. Janet says she and her husband divorced because he was unfaithful. She has since decided to remain single, but she says her ex-husband helps to care for their daughter, who is currently pursuing a nursing course in their community.

Janet lives with her daughter in a relative’s house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Janet trades in all kinds of rubber and plastic products such as plates, pans, buckets, etc. She says she procures her goods from the nearby big cities and sells them in the local market square. Janet also treks to other places to sell. She has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy the goods in bulk.

loans.use: To procure plastic products

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa A. est née le 31Décemdre 1964 à Adoguidi. Mariée et mère de huit (08) enfants, elle a pour activité principale la production et la vente de la farine de manioc « gari », un aliment très apprécié dans le sud Togo. C’est à travers cette activité qu’elle aide son mari cultivateur à supporter les charges familiales. Cependant ses moyens financiers ne lui permettent pas de produire à grande échelle afin de faire face aux demandes de la clientèle. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement lui permettant d’acheter suffisamment de manioc pour une production considérable. L’octroi de ce financement augmentera ses revenus et ensuite améliorera ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa A. was born on December 31, 1964 in Adoguidi. She is married and the mother of eight children. Her main work involves making and selling cassava flour, gari, a highly appreciated food in southern Togo. Through her work, she helps her husband, a farmer, to cover family expenses. Yet her financial means don’t allow her to produce on a large enough scale for addressing customer demands. That’s why she’s requesting financing that will enable her to buy enough cassava for a considerable level of production. The granting of this financing will increase her revenues and then improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан мужчина 43 лет, имеет семерых детей.Работает постухом в колхозе.Ему вместо денег оплату производят продуктами питания.Его жена помогает по уходу за скотом.У него крупнорогатый скот.на следующий кредит он хочет закупить корм и пару голов коров.Хусан кредитуется уже второй год. Его кредитная история положительная.Он благодарен Микроинвест и KIVA за финансирование.
texts.en:
Husan is a 43 year old man, he has seven children. Husan works as a shepherd at the collective farm. Instead of getting paid in cash he is paid in food products. His wife helps him to take care of the livestock. He has large livestock – Husan would like to use his next loan to purchase feed and a couple of heads of cattle. This is Husan’s second year as a borrower. He has a good credit history. Husan is grateful to MicroInvest and to KIVA for their financing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed and two cows

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a native of Cagayan, Province. She is 29 years old, married and has two kids, ages 11 and 3. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business (a community-based variety store) in their village. Her store is made from very simple materials and is quite small. When she has no customers, she does household chores and takes care of their youngest child.

Her store is open from 6 in the morning until 8 in the evening. She hopes to improve her store into a bigger one and to be able to sell different commodities to meet the demands of her customers and also to generate a higher income. Thus, Juliet is requesting a loan from the lenders in the amount of PHP 12,000.00 as additional capital for her business to become productive.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Since 2007 Naomi F. has worked as a trader selling provisions at Yamoransa in Cape Coast.  She is married with 1 child and has received an education through Senior High School. Her husband works as a pharmacist.  She is responsible for paying for her family’s various expenses, primarily utilities. Her loan will be used to purchase provisions in bulk for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the enterprise.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase provisions in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana Arana is 32 years old and is married to Mr. Miguel Denis. Together they have a young daughter and live in the city of Carapeguá, in the neighborhood of San Miguel. 

Adriana is a street vender who dedicates herself to the buying and selling of different articles during the weekend when she works with her husband. The rest of the week she works as a manicurist.

Because she was orphaned at a young age, Adriana began to work very young as she is the oldest of all of her siblings and she was in charge of taking care of the rest of them.

Adriana applied for a loan with Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Fuad M.

texts.en:
This is Fuad M. C., a local entrepreneur in Magburaka town. Fuad owns a provision shop right at the entrance of the Magburaka town market. He sells mayonnaise, cheese, butter, sugar, milk, eggs and much more. 

This is the first loan that this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. He chose to apply for a loan in order to help him develop his business at a faster rate. He is asking for a loan of SLL3,500,000. He would like to use this loan to buy ten cartons of cigarettes. He wants to introduce cigarettes into his business because he has discovered that cigarettes are a lucrative business.

Fuad is now forty years of age. He was born in Gbonkolenken village about twenty-nine miles from Magburaka town. Fuad is married to a businesswoman. They run the business together. They have eight children, some are in secondary schools and others in primary schools. Fuad has been a businessman for over twenty years. This loan, he says, will help him improve on his business, his life and that of his children.

loans.use: Invest in his business.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda  vive en el Manzano “M”  de la zona Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus dos hijos  de 6, y 1 año respectivamente, su esposo por razones de trabajo tuvo que emigrar a otro departamento en busca de fuente de trabajo.

Tiene un salón de peluquería donde realiza cortes de pelo, tanto a varones como a mujeres, también realiza tintes y peinados a señoras.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de algunas maquinas de peluquería y así mejorar la atención a sus clientes
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Emilda lives on Block “M” in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto.

She lives with her 2 children who are 6 years old and 1 year old, respectively. Her husband had to move to another department in search of employment.

Emilda has a hair salon where she cuts hair for both men and women. She also does hair dyeing and styling for women.

She will use the loan to purchase hairdressing equipment, which will improve the service she provides to her customers.

This is her second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that she is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair cutting tools for her hair salon.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is divorced and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Grace sells gari (a fried cassava dish), sugar and fish at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 1989. She uses her income to pay bills.

Grace will use the loan to buy more stock for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell essential goods

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
42-year old Lucia P. is engaged to fish selling activity. She likes fish because she earned reasonable income for her family. The income that she gets from selling fish helped a lot to buy their needs and pay the daily cost in their family. She has eight children and wished to send them all to college for a better future.

The purpose why she would like to avail loan from CEVI is to buy a pump boat engine. For now, the engine of their boat was badly destroyed and a loan with small interest is 
really  a big help to buy new one to help them continue their family business.

loans.use: pump boat engine

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel N. P. es un señor de 41 años, vecino de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Desde hace 3 años don Angel se dedica a la siembra de papaya, por lo tanto, dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo, tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Angel es un micro crédito de ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Don Angel forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su tercer crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Angel N. P. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Los Tijos de Upala, located in the province of Alajuela. It is a rural community with a relatively large area and somewhat mountainous topography, located in Costa Rica. The community works especially in the agriculture of basic grains, and on a lessor scale, raising livestock. For 3 years Angel has worked sowing papaya seeds. Therefore, he says he possesses quite a lot of experience in the care and maintenance of this kind of cultivation. He has a small plot of land in which he has planted papaya previously and has had very good results. Because of this, he wishes to expand his plantation. Thanks to this business, his family's quality of life has improved considerably. What Angel is currently requesting is a loan of ¢680,000 colones to buy fertilizer, seeds, and different materials in order to give the best maintenance and assistance possible to his harvest. This way he will be rewarded and will be able to have a very good production. Angel is a part of the Empresa de Credito Comunal de Los Tijos, one of 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third credit, and he says that with it he hopes to continue growing as a small entrepreneur and keep his business moving forward. He also emphasizes that thanks to these types of organizations and means of facilitating credit, he is able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials for planting and maintaining papaya.

loans.name: Kelly Delelia

texts.es:
La señora KELLY DELELIA LOZANOG.  tiene 58 os de edad, vive en el distrito de MACHE , provincia de OTUZCO, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores.
Presenta estudios hasta 3ero de primaria ya que refiere que eran 10 hermanos y  sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para poder darles ni comida y estudios, por eso desde niña ella y todos sus hermanos empezaron a trabajar en el campo, en casa, en restaurantes, etc
KELLY  se dedica a la venta de productos en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa , pero también se dedica al campo ala siembra y cosecha de trigo, menestras, papas, ocas, menestras en unión de su esposo e hijos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles empezó a comprar sus primeros 
Productos alimenticios al por mayor en especial el arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Este crédito de 1,200 lo invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios al por mayor y en la compra de chanchos y cuyes que empezará a criar.
KELLY sueña con criar y comercializar chanchos con mayor frecuencia.

loans.use: comprará productos alimenticios al por mayor y en la compra de chanchos y cuyes

loans.name: Yulya

texts.en:
Yulya is married with two grown sons. She is a private entrepreneur from Nikopol. She owns two vending locations in different marketplaces of her home town and sells women’s clothing items there. Yulya has been in business for 8 years. She has about 40,000 Grivnyas in working capital. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas each month.  

Yulya is seeking a loan of 13,500 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise of skirts she offers for sale in her kiosks.  She is hoping to meet the demand for warm quality skirts that always sell well in cold season. Yulya is known for her integrity and prompt repayment of previous loans. We are hoping the current loan will be beneficial for Yulya’s business development.

loans.use: to increase turnover capital

loans.name: Antonio Mandito

texts.pt:
António G., natural de Gôndola, província central de Manica, tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 05 filhos de 14, 11, 09 e 04 anos de idade, os três primeiros vão a escola. Estudou ate 10ªclasse, parou de estudar quando ingressou no Serviço Militar Obrigatório. Vive na casa própria em Boane e não sustenta mais ninguém além dos filhos.

Em 1992 saiu de Manica em missão de serviço para o distrito da Manhiça, província de Maputo, dois anos depois juntou-se com a sua esposa. Fixou sua residência neste distrito.
É funcionário do Ministério da Defesa Nacional (militar), há 28 anos e faz 08 horas diárias, ingressou no Serviço Militar em Gôndola em 1981, o seu rendimento mensal e de 7.725,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para investir na sua obra.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca tinha trabalhado com nenhuma outra instituição financeira. Conheceu a Hluvuku através dos colegas do serviço que também são clientes da instituição tendo aproximado e solicita este seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 18.000,00mt para comprar cimento barrotes e outros para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para iniciar uma actividade comercial
texts.en:
António G., a native of Gondola, in Manica, Mozambique, is 42 years old, married and the father of four children ages 14, 11, 9, and 4, all students. He finished 10th grade but had to drop school to join the army. He lives in his house with his family and supports all of them. He's been employed at the Ministry of National Defense for the past 28 years. He works 8 hours a day and makes 7.725,00MT (U$260) per month. With that money he supports his family and uses what's left to finish building his house. This is Antonio's first loan and he's asking for 18.000,00MT (U$650) to buy cement and other construction materials in order to finish his house. He hopes to pay this without a problem so he can get other loans in this future and start his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sop

texts.en: Sop L. has a recycling business and earns an average of $3 each day to help cover her family’s living expenses. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with two teenage children. One of her daughters helps support the family by selling a few cakes. Sop L. is married to Sman Yass, 49 years of age, who earns a living selling ice-cream for pupils. Sop L. requests a loan to allow her husband to buy more equipment for his ice-cream business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for an ice-cream business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en: Rogelia T. is from the village of Lumbayao. She is 37 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Rogelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2007, Rogelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rogelia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abdou Karim

texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Karim M. has a small carpentry workshop in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  Mr. M. has been a member of UIMCEC since 2000 and this will be his fourth loan.  Mr. M. and his six apprentices do almost all of their work by hand, carving intricate designs and sandpapering the wood for a smooth finish.  After not doing very well in school, Mr. M. said he chose this profession thanks to an uncle who was also a carpenter.  A bedroom set (bed, armoir and nightable) can take up to six weeks to finish.  

With the credit, Mr. M. will replenish his stock of wood for his work.  He will also help his brother relaunch his small business.  Mr. M. is married and the father of two young children.

loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods like rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Noemí es soltera, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Noemí vende abarrotes en general y ropa variada, sus ventas los realiza en la feria del Distrito de Tambo a donde viaja semanalmente.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias y ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Noemí son tener una tienda estable en Tambo y que su hija de 9 años grabe su primer disco musical.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the communal bank Juanito. Noemí is single, 28, with 2 children. She sells general groceries and a variety of clothing in the Tambo District Market that she travels to weekly. Noemí needs a loan of $75 to buy stockings and underclothing. Noemí's dream is to have a permanent stand in Tambo and that her 9-year-old daughter could record her first music album.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of socks and underclothing

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 44 years old. Marlene is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marlene owns & operates a bakeshop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking & selling a variety of confections such as cookies and cakes in the local community. Marlene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Marlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running her general store which has been in operation for over 5 years.

Elvira’s 50-year-old husband, Henrico, is a tricycad driver.  They have 4 children aged between 12 – 26 years old with some of them currently going to school and helping out in the business as part of their daily chores.

Elvira joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running the general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 3,000 from her business activities.

Elvira is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used for the operations of her general store which had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th loan the amount of Php 17,000, which she also intends to use on her general store. Elvira is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita B. is from the village of Patawag, Liloy. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Carmelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Huon Sek Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for thirteen people I. the Trapeang Thum village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Huon S. is the village bank president, who has been selected by all the members. They will each use the loan I. pursuit of a different goal that will improve their living conditions. Mrs. Huon S. is a dessert seller, and is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bou Ren Pech, is a taxi driver who owns an old car. They have a problem, however, because their wheels are too old to use. I. order to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Huon S. decided to ask for a loan to buy new wheels to replace the old ones. She is a mother of three children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy new wheels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana T. is from the town of Talibon. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Valeriana owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Valeriana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years already.

In 2008, Valeriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Valeriana is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Sirenas” esta representada por la señora Mirian y conformada por 11 miembros todas mujeres trabajadoras y muy unidas a pesar D. ser su primer ciclo las socias D. este grupo ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a créditos en instituciones similares  ala Fundación Agrocapital. La señora Mirian tiene su venta D. productos varios y también hace pan casero para venderlo en su barrio, su esposo trabaja en el parque industrial en la fábrica D. aceites Sao y tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar y en la universidad, ella desea poder incrementar sus ingresos para poder darle una mejor educación a sus hijos es por esta razón que desea poder incrementar mas su mercadería y aumentar la producción D. pan casero el cual se venD. muy bien en sus barrio. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta productos varios como tablillas, empanadas, venta D.  comida, empanadas, refrescos, servicio D. manicura y al alquiler D. carrozas matrimoniales. Las socias tienen mucha competencia como en todo trabajo hay días que se gana y hay días que no pero gracias a su experiencia saben como salir adelante. El crédito por lo general lo utilizan para hacer crecer su negocio, aumentar su capital con la compra D. insumos, material D. trabajo y la reparación D. sus vehículos, para poder generar mejores ingresos que les permita darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The La Sirena Group (The Mermaids Group) is represented by Mirian, and composed of 11 members. They are a group of hard-working and close-knit women, notwithstanding this being their first cycle: in fact, they all have had previous experiences with other solidarity groups thanks to their reputation in other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. Mirian sells different products on top of baking her own bread and selling it in her neighborhood; her husband works in the industrial park for the Sao oil factory, and they have 4 children in school and attending university. She wishes to increase her income in order to offer a better education to her children, and this is why she would like to buy more products and expand the production of her homemaD. bread, which sells very well in her neighborhood. The other members dedicate themselves to different activities such as the sale of chocolate bars, meat pies, meals, meat pies, soft drinks, manicure services and renting out of weeding carriages. As it happens with every job, these women face a hard competition: some days they earn money, and some others they don’t, but thanks to their experience they know how to get by. In generic terms, the loan they are requesting will be used to buy ingredients, working tools and to repair their vehicles, in order to obtain better incomes that will allow them to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different core products and tools

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: Juanito, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa  Elena (42), y 3 de sus 7 hijos, pues el resto son mayores de edad.Desde hace 20 años cultiva plátanos, achiote y café, en sus terrenos propios, lo que le disgusta es no tener capital de trabajo suficiente para comprarse  una hacienda, pero ama la labor de campo. Recuerda como su padre le enseñó todas las técnicas agrícolas, que ahora practica y  enseña a sus hijos con mucho orgullo,  para no perder la tradición familiar. Para la labor agrícola cuenta con la  ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos, porque las buenas ganancias que perciben en la agricultura le alcanzan para vivir cómodamente y también para asumir algunos gastos. Como  es un hombre emprendedor tiene planeado continuar plantando en mayor cantidad todos sus productos que se desarrollan en la selva central.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete seguir pagando  puntualmente sus cuotas, como hasta ahora lo hace, porque quiere  continuar trabajando con su banco comunal.Juanito tiene planeado invertir el dinero del préstamo en comprar varios sacos de abono que necesita  para cuidar sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Juanito is 46 years old and lives in his own home alongside his wife Elena, 42, and three of his seven children. The rest of his children are grown. For twenty years, Juanito has farmed bananas, achiote [a small tree grown for its rust-colored seeds] and coffee on his own land. What upsets him is not having sufficient working capital to buy himself a ranch, but he loves farm work. Juanito remembers how his father taught him all of the farming techniques that he now uses and proudly teaches them to his children so as to not lose the family tradition. For farm work, he counts on the help of his wife and children because the good profits that they receive in agriculture enable them to live comfortably and to take care of some expenses. An entrepreneurial man, Juanito has planned to continue to plant large quantities of all of his products that grow in Peru’s Central Jungle. This is the second loan that he has with Microfinanzas Prisma and he commits to making his payments on time as he has done so far because he wishes to continue working with his community bank. Juanito has planned to invest the money from the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer that he needs to take care of his next sowings.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for Crops

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is a devoted, serious and very determined businesswoman. She owns a business centre at the central main market in Makeni and is married to a businessman who is a partner in her business. Adama has a child and dependents who are her relatives.

Adama started her foodstuffs business five years ago, her initial capital being provided by her husband. She goes to work at 7:00 a.m. and returns home at 6:40 p.m. Her provisions shop attracts many families who buy provisions for their homes.

Since the wholesale prices of goods increases frequently and transportation costs are very high, Adama needs a loan to help her buy stock in larger quantities so that changes in price do not immediately affect her business.

Adama’s challenge is how to make enough money from her business to help her husband support the home while continuing to invest in her business so as to be able to meet the cost of sending her child to university. Also, she is looking forward to buying a piece of land for erecting their own family house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her stall

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas  ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Divinas esta conformado por 10 mujeres que luchan día a día  mejorar la economía de sus  hogares, y esto lo reflejan en su trabajo, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, la misma que es conocida por ser la tercera ciudad mas importante del Ecuador, sus paisajes, sus 4 ríos, su gastronomía y su gente hace de esta ciudad una de las mejores del país.

La Señora. Esther M. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo con los créditos en la fundación Espoir, los cuales le han beneficiado en  su negocio, ella elabora pinchos, trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo, empezó con su negocio hace 3 años, fue incentivada por su madre  a trabajar en esta actividad.
 
Nuestra socia es de 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 niños quienes se encuentran de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están en la escuela y por el momento se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. Su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de otra carreta y así ir poco a poco creciendo en su negocio, su meta es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación  para que de grandes lleguen muy lejos.

La Señora Adriana Sánchez vive en la comunidad Santa María de Sayausi, es su primer crédito y ha sido incentivada por una gran amiga a que forme parte de este grupo de mujeres muy unido y solidario, tiene 18 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 5 meses, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y comparten los gastos, sus padres no tienen casa propia por lo que arriendan.

Nuestra socia tiene un gabinete de belleza, el cual esta empezando ya que recién lleva 2 meses trabajando en el, todo lo aprendió en una academia de belleza.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de instrumentos para el gabinete, su meta es crecer en su negocio ya que le falta mucho aun.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Divinas” (Divine Women) Communal Bank is comprised of ten women who struggle day to day to improve their home finances. This is reflected in their work. They live in the city of Cuenca. It is known for being the third most important city in Ecuador. Its four rivers, its food, and its people make this city one of the best in the country. Esther M. lives in the city of Cuenca. She is in her fourth loan cycle with the Espoir Fundación. The loans have benefited her business. She makes snacks. She works everyday from Sunday to Sunday. She started her business three years ago. Her mother, who works in the same business, motivated her. Our member is 25, married, and has three children. They are six, four, and two years old. The first two children are in school. She is eight months pregnant. Her husband works in the area of construction. They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live. She will use the new loan to buy another cart. That way she will, little by little, be growing in her business. Her goal is to give her children the best education so that they will go far when they are grown. Adriana Sánchez lives in the Santa María de Sayausi community. This is her first loan. She was motivated by a great friend to become part of this group of united and supportive women. She is 18 years old. She is a single mother, and her daughter is five months old. She does not have her own house, so she lives in her parents’ house. They share expenses. Her parents do not have their own house, so they rent. Our member has a beauty salon work station. She is just starting with it; she has been working there for two months. She learned everything in a beauty academy. She will use the loan to buy implements for her station. Her goal is to grow in her business because she still needs a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cart and implements for hairdressing

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El Sr. Gonzalo es cliente nuevo que se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir de señoras, especialmente embarazadas, el realiza trabajos de vestidos, polerones, pantalones etc, y distribuye en la zona sur, en las tiendas, tambien dichas tiendas le proporcionan los modelos de trajes o ropa que necesitan, el St. Gonzalo vive con su esposa y sus hijas que se encuentrtan en edad escolar, el generalmente se encuentra en su casa, en el taller que tiene instalado allí, la esposa se dedica a trabajar de empleada del hogar por la zona sur. El crédito que solicita lo empleara en la compra de telas y otros materiales que necesita para sun trabajo, este oficio lo realiza desde hace mas de trece años.
texts.en:
Mr. Gonzalo is a new client. He makes ladies’ garments, specializing in maternity wear. He also makes work clothes, sweatshirts, trousers, etc. which he distributes to the stores in the Zona Sur. In turn, these stores provide him with suit or clothing models as needed. Mr. Gonzalo lives with his wife and school aged daughters. Usually, he is at home in his workshop. His wife is a domestic worker in the Zona Sur. He will use the loan to purchase fabric and other materials for his work. He has worked in this trade for over thirteen years.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabic

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en: Palolo R. is 44 and single with no children. She owns a business venture to sell pork products in the local community. Palolo has five years of experience in this business. Palolo needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about $208 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2007, Palolo joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Palolo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Nuevo Horizonte” consists of 17 associates from the city of Temuco. These individuals have diverse livelihoods. Some sell things like vegetables, sausages, and salads; others sell new and second-hand clothing items.There is an owner of a local grocery store, a clerk, and a hairstylist. Still others produce and sell things like pastries and apparel.
 
Rosa is the treasurer of the group. In the photo Rosa can be found in the third row and third form left to right wearing a red jacket and her hair is loose. Rosa’s business is of apparel of various items, for example formal clothing and sport outfits, costumes and curtains, and other things. Rosa studied hemming and costumes for three years and she has made it her profession for the past 25 years. Rosa´s workshop is located in her house, where she counts on three machines and works on set orders from clients. Rosa plans to use this loan to generate more items such as the traditional Chilean outfit of a huaso y huasa chileno, being that September is the month when Chile hosts various patriotic parties. Rosa also plans to purchase some fabric to fabricate polar shirts, as she has already collected some orders for this type of material. 

Rosa´s goal is to purchase a sewing machine that does intrinsic borders; she also dreams of one day extending out her workshop. Rosa´s motivation stems from gaining enough earnings to provide for her 12 year old son now and in the future when he decides to continue his studies. 

The aspect that Rosa enjoys about working with Fondo Esperanza is the great help that she has received from her fellow group members and loan officer, also learning about money management skills. 

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the place where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: purchasing fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan P., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a good housewife and stays at home taking care of their three children. Her husband, pictured here, has been a moto-taxi driver since 1999. On average, he is able to earn about US$5 per day. This couple is also supported by two children who are employed. Since her children spend a lot on transportation, Chan P. would like take out a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for them to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Gregoria Magdalena

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

La señora Magdalena tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y ya casados, en su casa vive un nieto de 10 años que es como si fuera su hijo menor y al cual adora, su marido es comerciante, vende jugos y colas en el centro.

Tiene un pequeño puesto de comida en su casa, prepara empanadas, corviches y algunas variedades de platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 16h00 hasta las 19h00 en la venta, pero, en la preparación desde las 12h00.
 
Este crédito es para comprar  mesas y sillas que le hacen falta y  alimentos para la preparación de la comida.
Esta en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y esta muy contenta con la ayuda que ha recibido de la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande
texts.en:
There are records of Picoaza as one of the aboriginal settlements of the Manta people. It is an urban parish, situated just 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, and it is full of history. It is also where the members of the María Asunción Communal Bank meet every 5 days.

Señora Magdalena is 58 years old. She is married and has three children, themselves grown up and married now. Her 10 year old grandson lives with her, however, and she adores him. Her husband is a businessman, selling juices and soft drinks in the city centre.

She has a small eatery in her house, where she serves empanadas, corviche and other local dishes. She works every day, selling from 4pm-7pm but preparing food from 12 noon. 

This loan is to buy tables and chairs, which she doesn't have at present, and ingredients for preparing her food. She has been in the Communal Bank for over 10 years and is very happy with the support she has received from Fundación Espoir.
 
Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and ingredients

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is a married woman who lives in Purok Golden Rosary, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She operates 2 business ventures: a general store and a pre-paid cellphone E-loading businesses. Her husband, Antony, who is 22 years old, works abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) to support his family. They have a 2-year-old child. 

Marites joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marites has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, lifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000. She intends to use this to purchase dry goods for her store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Marites C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank group "Active Women II," located in the district of Juliaca, in the province of San Román, and the department of Puno.  She is 31 years old and in a common law marriage with two children.  She studied until the fifth year of her primary education.

Norma has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, to increase the capital for her business selling livestock.

She is now asking for a loan of 800 PEN to buy animals for her business.  Her dream is to have a grocery store and to have more animals.

loans.use: Purchase more animals for her livestock selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn M. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 41 years old. Charlyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Charlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. This is not the only means for generating revenue, as the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, beverages, instant noodles & breads in the local community. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities.
