Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Charlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Giselle Marjorie

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Giselle, tiene 38 años de edad y está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos  de 18, 15 y 11 años, la mayor esta en Universidad, otra en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su marido es chofer de la cooperativa intercantonal.

Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa es comerciante de productos de Avon, Yanbal, Lebel(productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas)  también vende ropa y joyas de Romanel,  trabaja todos los días unas seis horas en la mañana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y además vende en su casa donde esta adecuando un pequeño bazar. Lo que es ropa y Romanel los va a comprar en Chone y Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar  productos Yanbal, Romanel pero en especial ropa para aprovechar esta temporada que es cuando más se vende este producto. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the 'La Unión Hace La Fuerza' (Unity Is Strength) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that its residents make.  They are known throughout the country.

Here we meet Giselle.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children aged 18, 15 and 11.  Her eldest child is at university and her other two children are in school.

As well as being a good housewife, Giselle sells Avon, Yanbal and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She also sells clothes and Romanel jewelry.  She works for six hours every morning.  She makes her sales door to door and she also sells from her home where she is setting up a small store.  She buys her clothes and Romanel jewelry in Chone and Guayaquil.

This loan will be used to buy Yanbal and Romanel products but especially clothes so that she can take advantage of this season which is when she sells most clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for 5 years and she likes it because the interest rates are low.  Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: To buy Yanbal products, Romanel jewelry and clothes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica D. L. O R. cuenta con un negocio D. abarrotes llamado “Yessica”  desD. hace 7 años que se encuentra en su mismo hogar, pues elL. prefirió trabajar en su casa para no desatender a su familia. Verónica desea el crédito para comprar mas mercancía para que en esta época naviD.ña sea incrementadas sus ventas.
texts.en: Verónica D. L. O R. has had a grocery business called “Yessica” for 7 years. The business is located in her home, as she preferred to work from her home so as to not leave her family unattended. Verónica wishes to use the loan to buy more merchandise so that her Christmas holiday season will have increased sales.

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Roka village in Kandal province has formed a village bank.  The members have selected Mrs. Soung N. to be the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of this loan for their different needs.

Mrs. Soung N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to pay for the laborers needed to work her farm, so she decided to ask for a loan to pay for this labor. 

Mrs. Soung N. is a widow with four children, one is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To pay for laborers to cultivate rice

loans.name: Juvelin

texts.en:
Juvelin L. is a mother with two children. Eight years ago, Juvelin had the idea of starting a business growing rice in their field and selling the rice to traders. She  grows her harvest to be able to provide her family with an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic needs.

Juvelin has requested a loan from CEVI in order to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She chose CEVI because she likes the micro-insurance package that they have for all borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Aba Mansiwa Mary

texts.en:
Aba Mansiwa Mary A. goes to the seashore to buy fish from the fishermen.  She then fries the fish for sale at Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She has been selling fish for four years now. 

Aba is a single parent who cares for 4 children, and she is responsible for the upkeep of her home.  Her loan will increase the capital she can use to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To provide working capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a computer, a binding machine and a scanner

loans.name: Santos Manuela

texts.es: Doña Santos Manuela T. T., de 40 años de edad, estudio todos grado de estudios en nivel primario, tiene 2 hijos de loas cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de consumo diario, donde vender articulos basicos de primera necesidad, lleva 12 años de experiencia con esta tienda, incio siendo un tienda pequeña y espera ver su tienda grande y con mejores ingresos de ganacias, gracias al prestamos que esta haciendo hacieindoen ASDIR.
texts.en: Mrs. Santos Manuela T. T., 40, finished all grades of elementary school and has two children one of whom is in school.  She is a merchant.  She has a grocery store selling basic need items.  She’s been in business with the store for 12 years.  It started out as a small store and she hopes to see her store grown and improve profits thanks to the loans she’s making with ASDIR.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik T. lives with his wife and two children in Talin city. The main income for the family comes from agriculture and exploiting Gagik’s truck. The truck was obtained thanks to Gagik’s savings and the loan he took previously from SEF. Although Gagik only uses the truck for four months during the agricultural high season, the profit from that period helps the family a lot. Gagik has also acquired a good reputation as a mechanic and is able to earn some income from providing services in that field too. Gagik and his wife take care of their small farm and also cultivate land. To increase their number of cattle and maintain the machinery, Gagik has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle and renovate the machinery.

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Magdalena. Tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 4 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad, la menor esta en colegio y es la única de sus hijos que vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de zapatos y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a  puerta y también vende en su casa lugar donde tiene su mercadería a disposición de sus clientes, vende al contado y también deja a crédito pero solo en dos pagos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las 15h00, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil una vez al mes ya que allá hay más variedad y le sale más barata. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio cinco años y que fue una amiga la que la impulso a poner este negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.

Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y construir un  local comercial.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Corrales" meets every 15 days in a town called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, where most people earn their living in different ways, such as making handicrafts or trading in general.

Here we met Señora Magdalena. She is 43 years old, and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has four children, three of whom are grown up, and the youngest is in school and is the only child who lives with her. Her husband is a trader. 

She is a housewife who sells shoes and jewelry, both door to door and from her house where her merchandise is readily available to customers. She takes cash and also credit, but only in two installments. She works every day from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Once a month she goes to Guayaquil to purchase her goods, as there's more variety there and it's cheaper. She tells us that she has been working in this business for five years, and it was a friend of hers who encouraged her to launch the business.

This loan is to buy more merchandise. She has been with the community bank since its inception and she enjoys the support she receives from the bank.

Her dreams are to improve her home and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida T. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old and the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Aida is married and has 10 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Aida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia N. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old, married and has 2 infants. Ofelia owns and operates a business providing computer games services to local community members. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Ofelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to maintain her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ofelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to maintain her business

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 42 years old, married, and has three sons. She couldn't educate her children due to financial constraints. All of her sons work to financially contribute to the family. Her eldest son operates a Punjabi food restaurant, the second one operates a cigarette selling shop, while the youngest one is only 14 years old and works in a factory. 

Robina's husband also involved in selling Pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes. His shop is located in the market. 

Robina is also a working lady. She is a nurse by profession. After her nursing job, she comes back home and spends time on her housework. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business of selling pan and cigarettes. With the loan, he will purchase pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes of different brands to fulfill the demands of his customers. 

Robina hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for her husband and her family's living standards will become better. 

This is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: to buy pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes for resale

loans.name: Live Show Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! In the middle of this picture you will see 37-year-old Nyasha from Mutare. She is married and has four children, ages 2, 8, 11 and 17. Three of her children attend school.  For the past three years, Nyasha has run a cross-border business at a flea market where she sells clothing. Her main business challenge is the lack of working capital. 

Nyasha is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase more clothing to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have more disposable income and thus improve her quality of life. In the future, Nyasha plans to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es: Sonia Beatriz de veinticuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de artículos de belleza y ropa, esto le ayuda a mantener a flote su hogar; Sonia vende artículos de muy buena calidad y a un buen precio se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que necesitan además ella se caracteriza por su amabilidad y su carisma. Sonia sabe que la clave de un futuro exitoso está en el trabajo duro y esto la motiva a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como cremas, cosméticos, perfumes y ropa con variedad de estilos así Sonia podrá seguir vendiendo su mercadería y no decepcionara a sus clientes. Ella tiene fe que al prosperar su negocio le podrá dar a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Sonia Beatriz, 24, lives with her life partner and her child in her own home.  She has a business selling beauty products and clothing, which helps her to keep her household afloat.  Sonia sells good quality products at a good price.  She has attracted a lot of customers, because she always has what they need.  In addition, she is known for her friendliness and charm.  Sonia knows that the key to a successful future is hard work.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy more products such as creams, cosmetics, perfumes and clothing in a variety of styles, so that Sonia can keep selling her merchandise and avoid disappointing her customers.  Sonia has faith that with a thriving business she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy creams, cosmetics, perfumes and clothing

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 39 years old and single.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Cris has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling clothes.  Mary Cris aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kawkab

texts.en:
Kawkab is a 63-year-old widowed woman with three sons and two daughters. Kawkab lives in Qalqilia city in Palestine and owns a shop selling computers and computer accessories.

Kawkab wants to expand her shop by purchasing a variety of accessories.  As Kawkab doesn't have the liquidity to pay now for the accessories, she came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for them. FATEN's loan will help Kawkab expand her business and attract more clients without exhausting her financial situation.

Kawkab is a conservative woman. Therefore, her son is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Charles is a focused and hardworking businessman, married and blessed with four children who attend school. Since 2002, Charles has been repairing automobiles to earn a living, and within the next five years wants to have expanded his garage to serve more clientele. His dream is to venture into other business sectors via investment.

Charles is requesting a loan of 15000 Kenya shillings to buy tools such as spanners. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now able to save and access credit.

loans.use: to buy tools such as spanners.

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia is 30-year-old single woman blessed with one child. She runs a retail shop. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. She is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy a fridge for the business and add stock for the current business and open a butchery.

She will use the anticipated profit to add more stock and probably open another kiosk. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and more stock for her business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 34 años de edad vive en la urbanización La Playa con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 15 años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio donde ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones y de videojuegos llamados “Comunícate ya” negocio que inició después de haber recibido una liquidación de la empresa en la cual trabajaba, iniciando con dos equipos y dos mesas sencillas en la ciudad de Santa Marta  donde en ese momento residía y trabajaba acompañada de su hija mientras desarrollaba las actividades domésticas. . Cundo se mudó a la ciudad de Barranquilla emprendió el mismo negocio y gradualmente fue agregando otro computados, posteriormente servicios de internet video juegos, fotocopiaje, scaner, fax y transcripciones. En la actualidad su negocio se ha extendido y está adecuando su local para organizar su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su meta más adelante es continuar estudiando, pues es bachiller y sueña con estudiar análisis y programación de computadores para conocer más del tema y perfeccionar su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando su primer credikiva, financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará dos equipos de computación, dos mesas, dos sillas, pues bien la época de vacaciones y quiere ofrecer un servicio más efectivo pues su demanda se incrementará. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo para lograr rápidamente alcanzar sus metas y permanece trabajando para lograr con financiamiento de Kiva aumentar sus posibilidades de invertir y multiplicar su inversión. Actualmente sus indicadores financieros de rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 56% maneja un margen de contribución de 64,28% y desde aquí planea su crecimiento.
texts.en: Verónica is 34 years old. She lives in the town of La Playa with her spouse and her two children, aged 5 and 15. She has a business offering telecommunications services and video games, called “Comunícate ya” ["Get in touch now"]. She opened the business after receiving severance pay from a company where she used to work. She started with two computers and two simple tables in the city of Santa Marta, where she lived at that time, and she worked alongside her daughter while also pursuing her household activities. When she moved to the city of Barranquilla, she set up the same business, and she gradually added more computers. Later, she added more services: online video games, photocopying, scanning, fax and transcriptions. Currently, her business has expanded and she is renovating her shop to better organize her business and offer better service. Her goal for the future is to continue studying, since she is a college student and dreams of studying computer programming and systems analysis so that she will know more about the subject and can improve her business. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, financed through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy two computers, two tables and two chairs, because vacation time is approaching and she wants to offer better service since demand will be increasing. Her greatest challenge is the lack of working capital that would let her achieve her goals rapidly and keep working. With the Kiva financing, she can increase her opportunities to invest and multiply her investment. Currently, her financial indicator of profitability on sales is 56%, and she maintains a contribution margin of 64.28%, and she is planning for growth on that basis.

loans.use: to buy two computers, two tables and two chairs.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rodelyn is borrowing 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodelyn has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
La señora Susan es socia del banco comunal Siete Estrellas, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, actividad que realiza en un local lejos de su casa y lo atiende en horas de la noche, durante el día se dedica al cuidado de su hija y al arreglo de su hogar porque no tiene a nadie que le ayude con los trabajos domésticos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 comprará: 10 cajas de cerveza, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 2 paquetes de agua mineral.
Con este negocio se ayuda con los gastos del hogar y no permite que su esposo sea el único que aporte en la casa, sus ingresos no son mucho pero son muy significativos para su familia.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir trabajando.
En la foto se muestra junto a su hijo
texts.en: Susan is a member of the Seven Stars communal bank, in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 29 and is married and has one child. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva field partner) for two years. She sells drinks in a place outside of her home and works in the evening. During the day she takes care of her daughter and her home because she doesn't have anyone to help with housework. With this new loan she will buy ten cases of beer, five cases of soft drinks, and two packages of mineral water. This business helps her with household expenses and doesn't allow her husband to be the only one to support the household. Her earnings are not much but they are very significant to her family. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue working. The photo shows her together with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of beer, 5 cases of soft drinks, and 2 packages of mineral water.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Kann, 31 years old, resides in Siem Reap, Cambodia, which is a province known for ancient temples and tourism. She is an animal seller and earns $7 per day. Her husband transports dirt to sell and earns $10 per day. She has three children, all of whom are studying. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy pigs to feed and then sell. Before, she was a farmer, but found that if she fed a few pigs at home, she could make a good income.  So she decided to feed more pigs at home for more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and then sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, he runs a 'posho' (cornmeal) mill.  He has been in the business for three years.  He also sells cereals in the same business premises.  He has created a good relationship with his customers.  This has helped him to retain his customers in a very competitive business environment.  Previously, he was employed as a driver.

John hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: John Mark

texts.en: John Mark is married. He is 24 years old and resides at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. John Mark owns and operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting mangos for sale. The mango tree is behind him, he sprayed it with a pesticides for flowering. John Mark sprayed also pesticides to kill the insects for the flowers not to die. so that it will bear a good fruit. He has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 4,420 PHP a month.John Mark is requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase pesticides for the better growth and for the mangoes to produce good quality. John Mark's future plan to renovate his house for better living and make his mango farm bigger.

loans.use: to purchase flowering pesticides and for the insects

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 35-year-old single mother of five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells used clothes and shoes. 

She started her business with capital of 40,000 UGX but now its worth 2,500,000 UGX. Even so, she faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Jackline's dream is to educate her children and buy a motorcycle. She needs the loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Pedro nació en la provincia de Chumbivilca y tiene 45 años de edad, él trabaja en un hotel de mucho prestigiosa en el área de limpieza. Ya son 20 años que trabaja en el hotel y le va muy bien. 

Pedro requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar ósea para la educación de sus hijos. 

Pedro se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Pedro belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Las Palmeras” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Pedro was born in Chumbivilca Province and he’s 45 years old.  He works in a very prestigious hotel in the maintenance area.  He’s been working in the hotel for 20 years now and does very well.  Pedro needs the loan for a family expense; that is, to pay for his children’s education.   Pedro is grateful for the opportunity provided him by this means and commits to make his payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to pay his children's schooling cost.

loans.name: El Sueño Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El sueño del futuro” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de artículos de librería, ventas de ropa, artesanía en lana, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Angelina integrante y delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ubicada en el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera manga larga color negro, jeans azules, su cabello está tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la repostería, específicamente chocolatería desde hace tres años. Comenta que aprendió cuando ayudaba con las labores a su cuñada.
Los chocolates y bombones los producen en su casa por las mañanas y los envasa y distribuye por las tardes, en almacenes y ferias artesanales. 
Su mercadería la compra una vez por semana en distintas distribuidoras. 
Comenta que le va muy bien y tiene bastante clientela, sin embargo cuando las ventas disminuyen reemplaza su producción con cuchuflis (galleta cilíndrica, rellena con manjar). Comenta que está postulando a un proyecto para vender sus productos en una feria artesanal y poder instalarse. 
Con el crédito comprará insumos para el negocio de los chocolates, cuchuflis y bombones. 
Sus metas son expandir su negocio para otras comunas, para esto necesita comprar un vehículo que le permita trasladarse. Además le gustaría brindarles trabajo a personas que lo necesiten. 
Angelina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 4 y 2 años de edad, la mayor asiste al colegio por lo que puede flexibilizar sus horarios de acuerdo a sus tiempos libres. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que se ha generado confianza y respeto entre los integrantes. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “El Sueño del Futuro," has 17 enterprising members who all work in different activities, including: selling office supplies, clothing sales, wool handicrafts, among others.  They all live in the city of Concepción.  Angelina, a member and representative for the group, is found in the photograph in the first row, second from the left, in a long-sleeved black polo shirt, blue jeans, and hair tied in a ponytail. 

She has had a confectionery business, specifically, a chocolate business, for three years.  She comments that she learned this trade by helping her sister-in-law with this type of work.  She produces the chocolates and chocolate truffles in her house in the mornings, and in the afternoons she packages them and distributes them to the stores and handicraft markets.  She buys her merchandise once a week from various distributors.  

She comments that the business is going very well, and she has quite a few customers.  However, when her sales fall off, she produces "cuchuflis," a cylindrical cookie with a sweet caramel filling.  She says that she is making a plan to sell her products in a handicraft market where she can set up a sales post.

With this loan, she will buy supplies for her business making chocolates, chocolate truffles and cuchuflis.

Her goal is to expand her business to other townships, and to do this she needs to buy a vehicle so that she could get around.  In addition, she would like to be able to provide jobs for people who need them.  

Angela lives with her husband and their two daughters aged 4 and 2.  The oldest attends school; she can arrange her schedule according to her free time.  

Angela is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels very comfortable with her communal bank, since she has gained confidence and respect for the members.  

Concepción is seated at the mouth of the Biobío river, one of the largest in the country, in the Biobío region in the south of Chile. This region has played an important role in our country, being at the center of important battles, such as the War of Arauco, and related settlements, since it borders the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development.   It is increasingly considered as one of the most important urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business making chocolates, cookies and chocolate truffles

loans.name: Achol

texts.en: Achol is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan, for three years. Achol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase salt, onions, and soda. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase salt, onions, and soda for sale.

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Nana Adjoa sell jewelry at Ankwanda near Elmina. Nana has been educated through senior high school. She is married to a fisherman and has 7 dependents. She has been in this trade for 15 years, and she assists her husband in the upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy additional jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Jacinta Nicolasa

texts.es:
Jacinta Nicolasa tiene 34 años es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Jacinta Nicolasa se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 2 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa y un vehiculo.

Le gusta tejer ropa de lana para los hijos.
texts.en:
Jacinta Nicolasa is 34 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in the canton of Ventanas.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre, which is near the parish of Guare in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Jacinta Nicolasa is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for two years. She learned this trade from her parents. Her purchases are made at the Jiménez Commericial Center in the city of Ventanas and she sells her products in the same city. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts for taking care of her crops. This will also help increase her family’s income. Her dream is to have a house and a vehicle.

Jacinta Nicolasa enjoys knitting clothes out of wool for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en: Ayen is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She has had a food-stall business in Bor, South Sudan, for one year. Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and oil. She will use her extra income resulting from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil to sell

loans.name: Madou

texts.fr:
MADOU  est âgé de 36 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et ses époux à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la Préfecture de KATI, Région de KOULIKORO.
MADOU   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de poulets. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, des poussins et leurs nourritures. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
MADOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  s’investir dans les activités d’achat vente de poulets.

loans.use: Achat de Poussins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve and add stock and purchase bulls for ploughing.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica has been in the business of selling onions for the last five years. Her business is situated in the busy Kibuye market of Kisumu. She buys the onions in bulk and sells them to other traders on a retail basis. She is educated to level 8 and dropped out of school due to poverty. She is married and has seven children, five of whom are going to school.

She started her business with $200 from her grandmother. With the loan, she wants to increase the stock she buys on a weekly basis to enable her to meet the demands of her customers.

She will use the profits from her business to educate her children and expand the business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en: Salimata O. is a dynamic 38-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children in Treichville, a popular commercial township in Abidjan. Salimata started the production and sale of stewpan in March 2004 with a USD 450 loan from AE&I. She has developed the business over the last three years and now wants to increase production in order to sell stewpan in the neighbouring countries of Burkina, Faso, and Mali, where she has relatives. Salimata O. is an example of a brave and courageous person who has shown excellence in self-taught management skills. She has applied for a loan of USD 750.

loans.use: Ouattara Salimata will use the loan to increase her production of stewpan.

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Although having 5 perches of rice-field and 5 perches of orchard, Mrs. Doan Thi T., who is 33 years old, still decides to open a grocery store. In order to do so, she would like to borrow money from TYM Fund. Her husband, Ngo Dinh Thoa, a security officer, also gives her a lot of support. According to him, TYM Fund does not only lend people money but also teaches them how to use the money wisely and helps them increase social knowledge. Having been a TYM member for 10 years, he knows that what he believes is right. Now total income of both T. and Thoa is $130 per month, which is a big improvement compared to theirs before joininng TYM. Their sons, one is 15 and the other is 12 years old, also help their mother with the store during their free time. She is looking forward to borrow $575 to expand the store and increase the number of goods sold everyday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Mặc dù làm 5 sào ruộng, 5 sào cây ăn quả và một ao cá, chị Đoàn Thị Thịnh, 33 tuổi, vẫn quyết định mở thêm một cửa hàng tạp hóa. Để có tiền mua hàng chị tham gia vay vốn Quỹ tình thương. Chổng chị, anh Ngô Đình Thoa, một cán bộ an ninh thôn, cũng rất ủng hộ vợ trong việc này. Theo anh tham gia Quỹ không những được vay vốn mà còn được học cách sử dụng vốn, nâng cao kiến thức về mặt xã hội. 10 năm tham gia Quỹ cũng đã chứng tỏ những điều anh suy nghĩ là đúng. Thu nhập của hai anh chị hiện nay là 2 triệu đồng/ tháng, tăng lên so với trước khi vào Quỹ. Hai con trai anh chị, 15 và 12 tuổi ngoài giờ học cũng giúp đỡ mẹ trông hàng. Hiện chị đang làm dự án vay 575 USD để tăng số lượng hàng bán ra mỗi ngày.

loans.use: Buy more goods to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Soliya

texts.ru:
Soliya B., 42 is married and has 3 children. She grew up in a working class family and has a high school education. In 2002, Soliya B. took her first MicroInvest loan of $140. Then, she sold pies and chebureki (a fried pita bread stuffed with meat). Gradually, having taught her children the trade, Soliya B. switched to cattle farming. Soliya and her husband are feeding cattle and then hand it over to butchers. Soliya’s son then uses the meat to prepare a variety of meat products such as pies, kebab, etc. (some of which you can see on the photo). Today, Soliya’s business assets grew up to $1000. In the future, Soliya B. plans to transition to wholesale delivery of fresh meat and build a farm. P.S. On the photo is her son.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Боймирзоева Солия – 42лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее, росла в семье рабочих. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 2002-го года с активами на 140 $.Тогда она торговала пирожками и чебуреками. Постепенно научив, своих детей этой деятельности она, перешла кредитоваться в сфере животноводства, так как место расположенность ее дома очень идеальна для откорма скота. Она можно сказать создала контейнер в семейном бизнесе. Солия с мужем откармливают скот до полноты, сдают мясникам на убой, а сын использует мясо для изготовления мясных блюд, такие как пирожки, чебуреки и шашлыки, что мы можем видеть на фотографии на месте деятельности ее сына. Сейчас ее активы возросли до 1000$, а в будущем она планирует перейти на оптовую поставку свежего мяса и построить ферму.На фото ее сын.

loans.use: Transition to wholesale delivery of fresh meat

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
My name is Reina S. and I've made a living the past two years making and selling sweets made of sugar and honey. I sell these door to door, on the streets of neighboring villages, and at the local tobacco factories. Presently I need a loan to buy more raw materials, packaging materials and containers to be used in the production of my sweets, as my customers' demand is increasing and my business is growing. This will allow me to increase my sales and my earnings, which I need in order to cover my family's living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Reina S. me dedico a la produccion y venta de dulces de azucar y miel, actividad que realizo hace un par de años y los reparto de forma domiciliar y ambulante en aldeas vecinas y fabricas de tabacos, en estos momentos necesito un prestamo para comprar mas materia prima, material de empaque y recipientes para la elaboracion de mi producto ya que mi negocio esta creciendo y la demanda de mis clientes es bastante, esto me permitiria aumentar mis ventas y asi obtener mayores ganacias las cuales las necesito para cumplir con mayor solvencia los gastos familiares.

loans.use: To buy sugar, food colorings and flavorings, honey, firewood

loans.name: Yatinah

texts.en: Yatinah is 35 years old and is mother of a child aged 10. Selling flavoured ice (popsicles) was her business before joining MBK. She usually earns $2 per day, but in the summer she can earn up to $4 per day. Her husband, U., sells vegetables in Tangerang, Banten, Indonesia and earns $20 per week. Yatinah needs a loan of US$ 100 (about IDR 900,000) to expand her business so she can sell various flavours such as fruit-flavoured ices or milk flavoured pops and also to expand her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her own and her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Erika Magali

texts.es:
I am Erika C.. I sell shoes and women’s clothing from catalogs. I am a single mother and my son is 6 years old. I have worked very hard to expand my business. When I began it, I sold my products by going door to door. As the years passed, I was able to rent a small store location near the San Raymundo park, near where I live.

Now that I have a store, I see my customer’s needs, which is why I need capital to bring them the variety of products that they request from me. I now sell not only women’s clothing, but also men’s and children’s clothing and also clothing for special occasions. I also sell phone cards. I now have a good number of people who order things from me. Because of this, I have had to hire two people in order to distribute the orders and tend to my store, since I have to go to the capital to buy.

Through much hard work, I have been able to buy the store that I used to rent. I want to continue investing in and improving my business so that I can give my son the opportunity to have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Erika C., me dedico a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y de ropa para damas. Soy madre soltera, mi hijo tiene 6 años de edad, me he esforzado mucho en poder ir incrementado mi negocio, ya que cuando inicie lo hacía ofreciendo mis productos de casa en casa, pero conforme han ido pasando los años pude alquilar un pequeño local cerca del parque de San Raymundo, donde vivo. Ya contando con un local vì las necesidades mis clientes por lo que necesito capital para poder llevar variedad de productos que los mismos clientes me piden, por eso ahora no únicamente vendo ropa para dama, sino también cara caballeros, para niños y para diferentes ocasiones especiales, también venta de tarjetas telefónicas, ya cuento con buen número de personas que me hacen pedidos, por tal motivo tuve que contratar la ayuda de dos personas para distribuir los pedidos y atender mi local, mientras yo tenga que viajar a la capital para comprar. Con mucho esfuerzo he logrado que el local que antes era alquilado, ahora sea propio, por lo que deseo seguir invirtiendo y mejorando mi negocio y dar oportunidad a que mi hijo tenga una buena educaciòn.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing for resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis O. is married and has two children. For the past 7 years he has run a small beverage stand just below one of the Christian Rural Aid Network’s unit branches. He is requesting a loan of $525 to buy soft drinks in bulk from wholesalers so he can buy at a discount. Francis is also a member of a lending group called “Calvary Group”, which consists of eleven members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: Francis would like to buy soft drinks in bulk from wholesalers so he can buy at a discount.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 35-years-old and is married with four children; ages 15,13, 8 and 3. Rehema has been selling fish since 2005. She works from 11AM to 6PM and earns a monthly profit of approximately $250.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Jenny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jenny lives in the neighborhood of Recreo. She is 33 years-old, married, and has two sons. Her husband works as an Urbina bus driver to support the household. Four years ago, Jenny began selling cosmetics and watches. She would like a loan to build a room. In the future, she would like to diversify her products and capture new segments of the market to support herself. Her main goal is to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jenny habita en el barrio el Recreo tiene 33 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos varones. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de una ruta de la cooperativa Urbina de esta manera el aporta a su familia con los gastos. Doña Jenny vende cosmético juguetes y relojes tiene cuatro años de experiencia y inicio sus ventas con cosméticos, el préstamo lo quiere para construir un cuarto. A futuro quiere diversificar su producto y acaparar nuevos segmento de mercado y así sastifacer sus deseos y necesidades pero su propósito es poner una pulpería.

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma N. is dedicated to making dresses for brides, Quinceaneras (special parties for girls turning 15) and all kinds of party dresses. She is a very successful seller with a clientele who advertise among their friends and acquaintances that her work is really good.

Zulma is married and has a one-year-old son. She told us that the arrival of her baby was a much hoped for blessing and says that she is in a very happy stage in her life with much success and that she now is at the level where she has enough work.

Due to the large amount of work and variety of models that are increasingly more demanding, she needs a particular Ovelor industrial sewing machine, which makes a specific type of seam that helps garments have a better finish. The loan that she asks for will be invested to purchase this machine.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Zulma N. se dedica a la confección de vestidos de novias, quinceañeras y todo tipo de vestidos de gala. Es una emprendedora muy exitosa, ella ya posee una clientela formada quienes además de ello siempre le hacen publicidad entre sus conocidos ya que su trabajo es muy bueno.

Zulma está casada y tiene un hijo de tan solo un año de edad. Ella nos cuenta que la llegada de su bebé fue una bendición muy esperada y dice que esta en una etapa muy feliz de su vida, y con muchos éxitos también al nivel laborar pues hoy día tiene bastante trabajo.

Debido a la gran cantidad de trabajo y que la variedad de los modelos hoy día son cada vez mas exigentes ella está necesitando una maquina de coser industrial tipo Ovelor, esta máquina realiza un tipo de costura específica que ayuda a que las prendas tengan un mejor acabado. El crédito que solicita ella lo invertirá para la compra de esta máquina.

loans.use: Purchase of an Ovelor industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Comite La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The women belonging to this group are dedicated to diverse activities. They use the loan as operating capital to promote what they are already making, to purchase more merchandise, or, in the case of the women who sell handmade food, to buy raw ingredients. The women who work in recycling use the loan to buy recyclable materials from small businesses and sell them to large factories for recycling.

They women yearn that their children will not have the same limitations that thay had, so they put in double effort to earn more income and offer the possibility that their children might study and obtain good employment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuffs

loans.name: Stanimirka

texts.en: Stanimirka is housewife and she lives at Pale. She is not married and she does not have any monthly income for her household. She applied for this loan from our foundation to buy the materials needed for tailoring services, which she already offers to a small number of customers.  Tailoring is the only income generator for her. She wishes to earn and to save enough money to buy additional sewing equipment, which would improve her services. That way she would improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Material for tailoring.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac A. is 38 years old, married with 3 children. He is into the sale of palm kernel, cocoa and cashew seeds and pods. He lives in Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in this business since the past thirteen years. He needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more palm kernel for sales.

loans.use: To buy palm kernel seed for sales

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman A. is a 47-year-old cattleman who is married with two sons. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Telman has been associated with this business since childhood. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them.The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Telman gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals. And alll day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Telman says that he works with only one aim in mind -- to provide his two sons with proper education. 

Now, Telman would like to expand his business and purchase one cow and two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for $1200 USD and, with your help, he hopes to reach his aim.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Mrs. En Leng Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight members in Khvet Village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. En L. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a pig breeder who raises three pigs. Mrs. En L. is 28 years old and the mother of a two year old and a three-month-old baby.

Because her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to breed. Her husband, Mr. Bi Sat, has a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. 

Mr. Uth H. and Mr. Tol R. did not coM. to the loan meeting where the photograph was taken, but their wives were there, so they appear in the photograph.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Group members who have an EoT loan are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. 

Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on tiM.. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Lav

texts.en: Mrs. Lav L. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She is a 60-year-old widow and the mother of two; one child is employed in a garment factory while the other one stays at home to do the housework. She currently faces an obstacle in that her house is old and she does not have enough money to solve this problem. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to use in rebuilding her house.

loans.use: To buy timbers to help build her house

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Ramona Pérez B. tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Ramona tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella una adolescente de 20 años  de edad recientemente cursa el 1 año de su carrera en una universidad publica unan-león y su hijo de 39 años de edad que no trabaja, sus deseos son de ofrecerle a su hijos una casa propia para que el día de mañana no tengan necesidades de alquilar una casa, en sus propósitos esta darle mejorías a su vivienda como seria la instalación de piso para  que así tenga mas presentación.


La actividad económica a la que Doña Ramona se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general la ubicación de su negocio es el mercado central en donde vende los productos de: sabanas, lentes para el sol, delantales y camisones, da inicio a este negocio por la necesidad  de obtener un trabajo el cual le ayudara a mantener a sus hijos y decide comprar productos como: sabanas y manteles mas tarde decide trabajar con Fundación León 2000 ya que así obtendría  ayuda para la compra de mas productos y así agradece trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las diferentes organizaciones, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mas productos ya que se acerca la temporada festiva y necesita obtener variedad en sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Ramona Pérez B. is a 66-year-old single mother with 5 children, two of whom are her dependents. One is a 20-year-old who is in her first year at the UNAN-León public university, and her son is 39 years old and unemployed. She wishes to give her children their own house so that they will not need to rent a house in the future. Her goal is to do some home improvements, such as installing flooring, so that it can look more presentable. Ms. Ramona Pérez B. sells general merchandise for a living. Her business is located in the central market, where she sells products like bed sheets, sunglasses, aprons and nightgowns. She started this business out of a need to support her children, so she decided to purchase products like bed sheets and tablecloths. She later chose to work with Fundación León 2000 because she would receive help to purchase more products. She is grateful to work with Fundación León 2000 and other organizations. This loan will be used as business capital to purchase more merchandise because the holiday season is approaching and she needs to offer a wide variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: A. Madeleine est née a 1970. Elle est veuve et elle a 3 enfants – 16, 13, et 10 ans. Elle n’a pas eu l’occasion d’aller a l’école, mais deux de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Elle a commencé son commerce il y a 21 ans avec la vente de la farine de manioc, l’igname, et le mais. Actuellement, elle fabrique sa propre fromage, et elle achète les crains de soja et le manioc au Marche Dantokpa. Avant les crédits de Kiva elle a acheté en détaille, mais grâce au crédit elle peut acheter en gros. Le crédit lui a permis de garder ses revenus pour les frais de scolarité. Elle voudrait focaliser sur la vente des vivres dans l’avenir parce que le feu n’est pas bon pour sa santé.
texts.en:
Madeleine A., born in 1970, is a widow with three children, ages 16, 13, and 10. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school, but two of her children are in school. She started her business 21 years ago selling cassava flour, yams, and corn. Currently, she makes her own cheese, and she buys soybeans and cassava at the Dantokpa Marketplace. Before Kiva loans, she bought at the retail level, but thanks the loan, she can buy wholesale. Her loan will enable her to reserve her income for covering schooling costs. She would like to focus on selling staple foods in the future because fire is not good for one's health.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soybeans and cassava

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. lives in Trapaing Chork village in Kampong Cham province. She is 47 years old and the mother of two children; one sells firewood and the other is enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Pun Thol, uses a motorbike to transport the firewood to sell.

Mrs. Oun S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassavas. In her cassava farming, she faces a problem because she does not have money to hire laborers to help her in the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field.

Mrs. Oun S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N., 59ans est veuve avec 01enfant  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de rafraîchissements qu’elle prépare  à base de pain de singe, sucre, bissap et de produits aromatisants. Elle s’approvisionne à Goudomp et au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang.  Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de son enfant et de renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou N., age 59, is a widow and has one child. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. Her work involves selling refreshments that she makes from “monkey bread” (the fruit of the baobab tree), sugar, hibiscus flowers, and flavorings. She acquires her supplies in Goudomp and at the weekly market of Yarang. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell refreshments

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Муж Шахнозы работает на заработках в России. Сама Шахноза уже несколько лет занимается предпринимательством – она продает детские игрушки в центральном магазине города Исфара. Шахнозе исполнилось 32 года, у нее 2 детей. За детьми следит ее свекровь дома, а Шахноза торгует. Бизнес налажен, за товаром она ездит на оптовый рынок и приобретает у местных оптовиков. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже несколько лет и показала себя образцовой клиенткой. Собирается и дальше сотрудничать с МикроИнвест и подала заявку на очередной займ.
texts.en:
Shahnoza's husband works as a laborer in Russia. Shahnoza has been doing business for several years - she sells children's toys in the central store in the town of Isfara. Shahnoza just turned 32, she has two children. Her mother in law is sitting with the children while Shahnoza works. Her business is steady. She travels to the wholesale market for the merchandise and buys from the local wholesalers. She has been with MicroInvest for already several years and has proven to be an exemplary client. She plans to continue taking out loans from MicroInvest and has applied for another loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden V. has been raising water buffalo, called carabao in Tagalog, for one year. Many consider carabao to be the national animal of the Philippines. Eden is 54 years old and lives in Sibalom municipality in beautiful Antique province. She is married to Niamedez, a farmer, and together they have three sons and two daughters. Their oldest child is a 34 year old son, and the youngest is a 15 year old boy who is still in high school.

Eden plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy one carabao. Eden hopes she and her family can enjoy a comfortable life and would like to see all of her children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат и ее муж работают в колхозе. Ей недавно исполнилось 40 лет, воспитывает 3 детей. Сейчас сезон полевых работ и работы очень много. Но по выходным Мухабат и ее муж выходят на рынки и занимаются куплей продажей скота. Это один из дополнительных видов заработка и супруги планируют немного расширить его и для этого подали заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhabat and her husband work on a collective farm. She recently turned 40, and has three children. The field work season has begun and there is a lot of work to do. Still, on weekends Muhabat and her husband go to the market to buy and sell livestock. This is one way that they make extra money, and the couple plans to expand the business a little with the help of a Kiva loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Cosmos Rsr Group

texts.es: Banco Comunal “Cosmos RSR” esta representado por la señora Margoth y conformado por 12 socios en su mayoría mujeres, el grupo ingresa a su primer ciclo pero anteriormente ya trabajaron con la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. grupos solidarios. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como  la papa, el chuño, hortalizas y otros productos naturales que son traídos D. terrenos D. los socios en el campo, otras D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como tiendas D. abarrotes, ropa, sombreros, comida y al transporte público. El destino del financiamiento es la compra D. llantas en el caso D. los transportistas y a la compra D. insumos y materiales en el caso D. las socias comerciantes. La competencia en el mercado central del la ciudad es bastante alta pero las socias tienen experiencia en ventas y saben como salir adelante ya que D. eso depenD. el sustento D. su familia.
texts.en:
Village Bank “Cosmos RSR” is represented by Mrs. Margoth and is comprised of 12 members who are mainly women, the group is entering its' first cycle but previously worked with Foundation Agrocapital and therefore already know the moD. of solidarity groups. The majority if the members work in the sale of products such as potato, el chuño (dried potato), vegetables and other natural products that are brought by partners from the countrysiD.. Other partners have grocery stores, sell clothing, hats, food and offer public transportation. The funding will be used to purchase tires for transport carriers, and in the case of retail sales members it will be used to purchase supplies and other materials . The competition in the central market of the city is quite high, but the members have sales experience and know how to come out ahead because the livelihood of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters. Some are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school. She lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Her husband is a trader.

Faustina is a trader. She works very hard to help her husband to provide for the family. She trades in canned vegetables: tinned tomatoes, oil, spices, rice, etc. She buys her products from Kumasi and sells on a table in her community market. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Faustina has been in business for over ten years. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To procure food items to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de  Puno, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos, posee estudios de educación superior incompleta (técnico en Ingeniería civil) y vive en el Barrio Ricardo Palma.

Hoy se inicia con el movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de preparación y venta de jugos de quinua al paso, con el cual comprara quinua, azucar, leche y otros insumos.

Le gustaría mucho crear otro negocio como la  preparación de desayunos al paso. 

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago y la forma de trabajo que se da en su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Rufina belongs to the Semillas del Futuro Community Bank, which is located in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 38, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She has some upper level education as a civil engineering technician, but she has not finished. She lives in the Ricardo Palma neighborhood. She is starting now with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos with a loan for 500 PEN. The loan is for her business of making and selling quinoa juice. She will buy quinoa, sugar, milk, and other supplies. She would really like to start another business like making fast food breakfast. She likes her community bank’s ease of payment and the way they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies (quinoa, sugar, milk, and others) to make quinoa juice

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix vive en casa propia en la Av. buenos aires de la zona las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; la esposa se dedica a la venta de comida en la misma casa. Felix tiene un minibus con el cual trabaja como transporte publico de lunes a sábado y con estas dos actividades ellos mantienen a sus hijos. El crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor y comprar batería así de esta manera mantener en funcionamiento su herramienta de trabajo ya que no tienen mas ingresos.

Este será su primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio económico lo califica.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix lives in his own house on Av. Buenos Aireas in the area of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. His wife sells food in their house. Felix has a minibus, which he uses as a form of public transportation from Monday to Saturday. With these two activities, they take care of their children. This loan will be used to repair the motor and to buy a battery to keep his vehicle functioning, since he needs it for his job and he doesn’t have another source of income. This is his first loan with Impro, and his socio-economic status qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his minibus

loans.name: Unidas Somos Mas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas Somos Más, es un banco formado por seis socias, esta ubicado en la Parroquia de San Pedro de Quingeo, comunidad Nonadé, sector las Rosas,  en su templo se venera una efigie de Cristo Crucificado, muy visitada y conocida como, el Señor de los Milagros En esta parroquia, fueron célebres, durante el Carnaval, los juegos del Pucara, que significa: fortaleza. Consisten en la lucha entre dos rivales, generalmente indígenas muy fuertes y de pequeña talla, provistas de ondas y masas de hierro que lanzaban contra su contendor, el que se defendía escudándose con un sombrero de cuero, de grandes faldas, que al agacharse protegían su cuerpo. 
En la foto se encuentran las socias y por esta vez el coordinador de Fundación Espoir, el mismo que hacia una visita de control.
Sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, tejer sombreros con paja toquilla, su gente es muy trabajadora y cumplida como podemos darnos cuenta en este grupo por ejemplo las señoras:
Sra. Carmen Leonor S. C..
Carmen es oriunda de Quingeo, tiene 38 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos, de 14 y 10 años de edad, la de 10 estudia en la escuela Rumipamba ubicada en Quingeo, y la mayor le ayuda a su madre en las labores cotidianas y domésticas, vive en casa de sus padres conjuntamente con sus hermanos pese a que son mayores y casados siguen viviendo con sus padres,  Carmen por su falta de educación dice que no le queda más que dedicarse al campo a trabajar ya que no ha conseguido en que más laborar, se dedica a más de la agricultura a tejer sombreros que luego de terminarlos en el tiempo de 2 a 3 días, los comercializa en el mismo barrio a un costo de 12 a 15 dólares cada uno, según la dificultad que lleve cada uno de ellos, tiene pollos en su casa pero son muy pocos para lo que desea comercializar, solicitó crédito de 440 dólares para comprar más pollos y así dedicarse más en su casa al trabajo y no tenga que salir a trabajar en los campos.
Sus metas es poder independizarse construyendo su propia casa y poder poner allí su negocio de pollos.
Sra. Eva Beatriz S. C.
Eva es socia mucho tiempo de la fundación ESPOIR, realiza su tercer crédito, tiene 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene una niña de 7 meses de edad, vive  conjuntamente con sus hermanos pese a que son mayores a ella,  siguen viviendo con sus padres, por su falta de educación dice que no le queda más que dedicarse al campo a trabajar ya que no ha conseguido en que más laborar, se dedica a más de la agricultura a tejer sombreros que luego de terminarlos en el tiempo de 2 a 3 días según como se dedica, los comercializa en el mismo barrio a un costo de 12 a 15 dólares cada uno, según la dificultad que lleve cada uno de ellos, tiene pollos en su casa pero son muy pocos para lo que desea comercializar, solicitó crédito de 330 dólares para comprar más pollos y así dedicarse más en su casa al trabajo y no tenga que salir a trabajar en los campos.
Su sueño es poder hacer un criadero grande de pollos, y comprar vacas lecheras porque dice que la venta de la leche es buena por el sector y sus padres tienen terrenos de hierba.
texts.en:
The Somos Más Community Bank consists of six members. It is located in the San Pedro de Quinego parrish, Nonadé community, Rosas sector. In their temple they worship an effigy of Christ Crucified. It is very visited and well known as the Lord of the Miracles. In this parish, the fighters were celebrities. During Carnaval, they held the games of Pucara, which means strength. The fight was between two rivals, who were generally very strong, but short indigenous people. They had metal weapons, which they threw at their opponent. They defended themselves by wearing a leather hat with large flaps, which they lowered to protect their bodies. The members and the current coordinator of the Espoir Foundation, who was making a supervisory visit, are in the photo. The community’s inhabitants work in agriculture, raise animals, and weave panama hats. The people are hard working and responsible, as you will see in the examples of this group: Carmen Leonor S. C. Camren is from Quingeo. She is 38, divorced, and has two children ages 14 and 10. The 10 year old goes to the Rumipamba school, which is located in Quingeo. The older helps her mother with the daily work and household chores. She lives in her parents’ house together with her siblings. Even though they are grown and married, they still live with their parents. Carmen, with her lack of education, says that there is nothing else for her to do but work in the fields. She has not found other work. She does more than farming. She weaves hats, and after two or three days she finishes them. Then she sells them in her own neighborhood for $12 or $15 each, depending on the difficulty in making them. She has chickens at her house. She would like to sell them, but she has very few. She has asked for a loan for $440 to buy more chickens. That way she could work more at home and not have to leave to work in the fields. Her goals are to be able to become independent, build her own home, and be able to set up her chicken business there. Eva Beatriz S. C. Eva has been a member of the ESPOIR Foundation for a long time. This is her third loan. She is 27, single, and has a 7 month old daughter. She lives with her siblings. Even though they are older than she is, they continue living with their parents. Due to her lack of education, she says that there is nothing else for her to do but work in the fields. She has not found other work. She does more than farming. She weaves hats, and after two or three days, depending on how she makes them, she finishes them. Then she sells them in her own neighborhood for $12 or $15 each, depending on the difficulty in making them. She has chickens at her house. She would like to sell them, but she has very few. She has asked for a loan for $330 to buy more chickens. That way she could work more at home and not have to leave to work in the fields. Her dream is to be able to be a big chicken farmer and to buy milking cows. Milk sales are good in her sector, and her parents have good, grassy fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and cows

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 04 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en Barrio Tupac Amaru.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo utilizó para la compra de combustible. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de combustible, repuestos para carro (solo por pedidos), esta operación ella lo realiza una vez por semana.

Su deseo es construir su casa, poner una tienda de repuestos para autos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Señora Candelaria belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Bellavista” Community Bank which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, Puno department. Candelaria is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She has completed high school and lives in the neighbourhood of Tupac Amaru. She has worked with Kiva partner, Manuel Ramos, for three years. Her first loan was for S/.300 soles which she used to buy gas. Now she needs a loan of S/.1000 soles to buy gas and spare parts for cars (orders only). She takes orders once a week. One day she would like to build a house and open a store selling spare parts for cars. She enjoys saving money with the bank and meetings with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy gas and spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey P. is 31 years old farmer in Trento Agusan Del Sur. His main crop is rice and he has been doing this business since he was a child. Aside from rice, he also raises pigs and earned bigger profit from selling meats to his regular buyers. Now, he has three children, 6 years old the eldest. He always looks after the needs of his family. He wished to grow his rice farm business so that he could easily provide all their needs. 

He would like to ask a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy rice seeds and to pay the laborers in his farm and feed as well to grow pigs.

She chose CEVI because she likes its services. She said that the staff was very friendly and the interest rate is really small than the others.

loans.use: piglets, feed and rice seeds

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Mitapasamana Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Santa Rosa De Mitapasamana está ubicado en la Comunidad de Mitapasamana, en el distrito de Vinchos, Provincia de Huamanga en el departamento de Ayacucho.

La comunidad está en la zona altoandina a 50Km de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la vía es asfaltada, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura (cereales), ganadería (vacunos, ovinos).

Isabel, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la compra-venta de quesos y cereales. Isabel compra sus productos en las ferias y recorre los diferentes lugares donde hay cereales.
