Su familia le ayuda en su negocio. Isabel solicita su préstamo para incrementar su capital y para aumentar sus productos. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos para asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

Julia es divorciada, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de queso y cereales, aprovecha las ferias locales para vender sus productos, recibe el apoyo de sus hijos para acopiar cereales. Julia solicita su préstamo para incrementar su capital, comprar más cantidad de queso y mas cereales. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Los 12 socios solicitan su prestamo para invertir en sus negocios

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Severina C. from Mbeya, married with three children between the ages of 2 and 12. Since 1998 she has been running a clothing business. Working for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week, Severina currently earns about $150 USD per month and is now requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve both the quality and range of her products. Severina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Tomas Benjamin

texts.es: El señor Tomas es chofer propietario, y esta inscrito en el sindicato 16 de julio, su negocio es sacrificado porque el tiene que trabajar desde las primeras horas de el dia hasta muy tarde, solo asi puede tener un ingreso significativo; su dia de descanso es el dia jueves, ese dia es su restriccion del centro de la ciudad o sea no puede entrar al centro de la ciudad, ese dia aprovecha para realizar la reparacion de su movilidad, su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa  en la feria 16 de julio, de la populosa ciudad del El Alto. Considerado un cliente antiguo y puntual, el destino del credito es para la construcción de su casa, comprara  ladrillos y arena para la fachada de su casa.

loans.use: Invertira el credito en la compra de ladrillos y cemento, para la construccion de su casa

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace S. lives in the village of Barangay San Antonio, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She is 29 years old, married to Roger S., who is a tricycle driver, and also serves as one of the elected Barangay (village) Councilors. The couple is blessed with two young children who are 8 and 9 years old. Their common dream is to improve their business, be able to send their children to school and have them graduate with bachelor degrees, and to be able to buy a truck so that they can earn a good living for their family. Even before she married, Mary Grace already had a general store which helped her support her parents. When she got married, she knew that she had to earn more to continue helping her parents as well as help her husband provide for their family. In 2002, to get additional capital, Mary Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could expand her business operations. With more capital to use, she is able to maintain a wider inventory for her general store, which effectively earns her a bigger monthly income, which is now averaging PHP 14,000 per month. Mary Grace borrowed PHP 22,000 in her previous loan, which she used as additional working capital for her general store. Now that she has fully repaid that loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000 for her 17th loan to use as working capital for her general store so that she can offer a wider variety of goods to her regular customers. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
			LUZ D. LA ESPERANZA
Hace 3 años empezó su negocio D. productos D. belleza mediante catalogo, negocio que pudo manejarlo muy bien ya que a la vez  tenía que mantener a sus 3 hijos,  es lo que nos manifiesta Nelly J.,  presidenta del grupo. Algo que le agrado D. este negocio a nuestra socia fueron las capacitaciones que tenían en cuanto a belleza  como cuidados D. la piel,  del cuerpo, del cabello y otros.  La socia muy entusiasta,  comparte toda la información con sus compañeras además ayuda a que  también ellas  puedan vender los productos y beneficiarse.
Norma L. se dedica a las confecciones,  ella nos manifiesta que tiene temporadas altas en  las cuales tiene que invertir mucho en  materiales, pero eso no la desanima porque tiene  como objetivo,  crear su propio taller para dar trabajo a otras personas. 
Otra D. nuestras socias que se dedica a las confecciones es la tesorera Esperanza Bazán,  ella tiene un taller en sociedad con una amiga, nos comenta que es un trabajo sacrificado pero tiene sus recompensas,  ya que durante mucho tiempo pudo ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios,  además del pago D. los servicios básicos en casa.
Todos los socios D. la Alcancía Comunal desean mejorar sus negocios en  infraestructura así como también en la compra D. mejores productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.  El  préstamo será destinado para la compra D. material D. trabajo y algunos insumos.
texts.en:
Luz D. la Esperanza Communal Bank Three years ago she started her business of selling beauty products by catalog. She was able to run the business very well and at the same time take care of her three children. That is what Nelly J., president of the group, tells us. One of the things that pleases her about the business is the beauty trainings like how to take care of the skin, the body, hair, and other things. She is a very enthusiastic member, and she shares all of the information with her colleagues. She also helps them so that they can sell products and receive the benefits. Norma L. makes clothes. She tells us that she has high seasons when she has to invest a lot in materials. This does not discourage her, because she has her objective of creating her own shop to give work to other people. Another member who makes clothes is the treasurer, Esperanza Bazán. She has a shop in partnership with a friend. She says that you need to sacrifice in this work, but it has its rewards. For a long time she could help her children in their education. Also, she could help with paying for the basic services in the house. All of the members of the communal bank wish to improve the infrastructure of their businesses. They also want to buy better products to offer their customers. The loan is to buy work material and some supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Martha Argentina

texts.es:
Martha Argentina S. de 58 años tiene desde 2002 una librería la cual ha ido surtiendo con la variedad de productos escolares como cuadernos, hojas de construcción, cartulinas, tijeras, lápices, lapiceros, borradores, tajadores, marcadores, colores, tarjetas y calcomanías entre otras cosas. 
Este modesto negocio es el único de su tipo en el barrio lo que le ayudado a su crecimiento además que la atención y los materias que comercializa.
texts.en:
Martha Argentina S. is 58 years old. Since 2002 she has had a bookshop which has been supplied with a variety of school products such as notebooks, construction paper, cards, scissors, mechanical pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners, markers, crayons, and decals among other things.

This modest business is the only one of its kind in the neighborhood which is helping it grow with the attention and the materials she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and stationery

loans.name: Deam

texts.en: Deam S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife in the Battambang province. He is a construction foreman and makes about $4 of profit a day, while his wife sells fish at the local market, earning approximately $3 per day. This couple has two school-aged children.  Deam is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike so he can start a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja vive en alquiler en la Av. Ramos Gavilán de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de dulces y refrescos en la Terminal de la ciudad en un puesto de venta de su propiedad. El crédito que solicita es para aumento de capital y poder comprar más dulces y refrescos para ofrecer a sus clientes..

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Impro, y por la actividad que desempeña y el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito
texts.en:
Maruja lives in a rented home on Ramos Gavilán Ave. in the Achachicala area of La Paz. She sells candy and refreshments in the city’s terminal from a stand she owns. The loan she seeks is to increase her capital and be able to buy more candy and refreshments to offer her customers. This is the first time she seeks a loan throughImpro, and through her work and character she can access a line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and refreshments to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun C., 29, is married and lives with her three children in Battambong Province, Cambodia. C. works in the agriculture sector growing rice and she sells fish when she is available from her rice fields. Both businesses are able to generate an income of USD 4 per day to help assist the family.  She has been in these businesses since 1999.

Her husband helps his wife at the rice field and helps his father grind rice. He is able to earn an income of USD 4 per day as well. C. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well to help with their daily necessary expenses.

As a result, C. is requesting a loan of US $900 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to pay for hiring people who will help at the rice field and to buy more fish for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To pay for hiring people at the rice field and to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: Marétou W. est âgée de 50 ans, elle et mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle fait un petit commerce de poissons fumés, d'huile de palme et de produits halieutiques. Elle vise à améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Marétou W. is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of four children whom she cares for. She trades smoked fish, palm oil, and fishing products for a living. She is striving to better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promotion of commercial activity

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
S. is 56 years old and is a resident of Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. S. sells a few grocery items in front of her home where she is able to earn about $3 per day.

S. was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has five children: three are married and two are single and are in the garment industry.

S. is looking for a loan in order to purchase more stock for her store. She intends to use some of the loan to buy different kinds of fruit to sell for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeurn S. is from the village of Srae Boeng, Takeo province. She is a 48 year old married woman with a child who is a student in the local school.

Mrs. Khoeurn S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Thoch Chhaeng, owns a wedding hall that he rents out. Now her husband wants to purchase an electric machine and 3 speakers. Thus, Khoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to support her husband's business. This loan she hopes will increase her income and improve her family's living too. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase an electric machine and 3 speakers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Mrs. Milagros J. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living she operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband is a farmer. She has managed her business for more than two years. The family earns approximately $315 a month including the income from their farm.

Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial support in order to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used for the improvement of their farm, which serves as their main source of income. Now she is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°13 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Le sous groupe Femmes Commerçantes N°13 est dirigé par Madame Khady N.. Elle commerce du maïs, riz et du gombo. Mère de 8 enfants, Madame Khady N. partage ce sous groupe avec Madame Néné D. vendeuses de poissons frais, Madame Fatou N.  vendeuse de poissons séchés, Madame Fatou Y. qui vend des légumes, Omo et Madame Ndeye F. vendeuse de fruits et d’arachide.
texts.en:
As its name suggests, the Femmes Commerçantes group (F.C.) is a network of businesswomen. It is based at Grand Thiès and was created in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, its current president. She got the idea of forming the network after receiving training from the NGO OXFAM at Thiès. Thus she is knowledgeable about group management, running a business, etc. The members of the group are dedicated to what they do, and meet together once a month. Over and above membership dues, each of them pays 200 FCFA a month into a collective fund. Seeking financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. The network is divided into 19 subgroups of five people to take better advantage of funding. Each subgroup has its own president and treasurer. They now seek, for the second time, a loan of 100,000 FCFA per member or 500,000 FCFA for each subgroup, to grow their various business activities. The members repay their loans to the president and the treasurer, Mrs. Coumba Seck, during their monthly meetings. These two, in turn, are responsible for repaying U-IMCEC. According to the president, the group has only one noble goal -- to fight family poverty. The sub-group Femmes Commerçantes N°13 is led by Ms. Khady N.. She sells corn, rice, and okra. Mother of eight children, she belongs to this sub-group which includes Ms. Néné D., who sells fresh fish; Ms. Fatou N., who sells dried fish; Ms. Fatou Y., who sells vegetables; and Ms. Ndeye F., who sells fruit and peanuts.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop their respective businesses

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
Germán tiene   31 años de edad,  está casado con Vilma, tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno está en la escuela,la familia viven en casa propia.
Desde  muy  joven  se dedicó a trabajar arduamente  para  poder  llevar  un mejor  nivel  de  vida, se inició como  vendedor ambulante en una empresa con un tío de quien aprendió la profesión. En ese  periodo conoció a su compañera actual, fueron  progresando  de a poco  hasta que llegaron a   a  reunir capital suficiente para formar  su  propia  microempresa.
Hoy  día  trabaja en grande y  le da trabajo a sus dos hermanos, es  muy  luchador y  sueña  con  que sus  hijos  sean  personas de  bien  y lleguen a  ser alguien en la vida.
Solicita el préstamo para aumentar la variedad de productos de su pequeña empresa, como sería la compra de edredones, sabanas,golosinas, llaveros, cigarrillos, al por mayor para su venta al detalle, de modo a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Germán is 31 years old, married to his wife Vilma, and has three children of whom one is in school. The family lives in their own home.

From a young age, Germán has worked hard so that he could have a better standard of living. He began working for his uncle’s business as a traveling merchant so that he could learn the profession. During this time, Germán met his wife and together they made gradual progress until they were able acquire sufficient capital to start their own micro-enterprise.

Today his business is larger and he provides employment to his two brothers. Germán is a hard worker who hopes that his children will develop into good people and make something out of their lives. He is requesting a loan to increase the variety of products offered by his small business. Germán plans to purchase bedspreads, bed sheets, candy, key chains, and cigarettes in bulk so that he can sell these items retail and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads, bed sheets, candy, key chains, and cigarettes

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 41 years old, married and has four children. In the past 16 years, he has been operating a butcher shop. He also has rental houses from which he earns more income to support his family. He is a new member of Faulu Kenya and belongs to a group in Faulu Kenya whose main aim is to save money, share business ideas and guarantee each other's loans. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a weighing machine, fridge and a water tank. This will be his first loan and he hopes that it will help him to improve his business. He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase a weighing machine, fridge and water tank

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida es casada, tiene 59 años y tuvo 4 hijos, Lida junto a su esposo tienen una cochera en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días y cuentan con la ayuda de un empleado, Lida tiene proyectado ampliar su garaje pues cuenta con mucha demanda. Además Lida se dedica a la venta de vinos en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Lida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de vinos.
texts.en:
Lidia, 59, is married and had 4 children. Together with her husband she owns a parking garage downtown that they run daily with the help of an employee. Lidia is planning to enlarge her garage because there is a lot of demand. Besides, Lidia is a wine merchant in the area's various markets. Lidia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy wine.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine.

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en:
Georgia walked past a shabby hair salon in San Francisco’s Mission District almost every day for twelve years without giving it a second glance; it was a far cry from the spaces where she worked as a hair stylist.

Over the years, Georgia has paid other business owners considerable monthly fees to rent chairs in their plush salons. Last year she grew tired of sharing her earnings with salons that did not share her vision. She declared, “I want do something innovative, fun and my own…it is my turn.”

One day, rather than just passing by the shabby hair salon, Georgia marched in and asked to buy the space. From this bold move, “Pretty Pretty Collective” was born.

It is no secret that Georgia loves to create fantasy and imagery. She grew up in England and Canada, left home when she was 14, and has been styling and modeling ever since. Georgia’s vision for “Pretty Pretty Collective” is to create an imaginative venue where she can style clients during the day.

In addition to serving her own client base, Georgia will proudly rent out the space to five other stylists who share her passion and her vision. To help keep overhead costs low and to maximize the real estate, at night the space will transform into a setting for art shows and fundraisers featuring local artists and popular neighborhood vendors. She hopes to host a fundraiser for her son’s school, which, like other schools across California, faces serious budget cuts.

Upon purchasing the salon space last year, a friend referred her to the small business section in City Hall where she found Women’s Initiative for Self Employment, and Opportunity Fund. Georgia will use this $10,000 loan from Opportunity Fund to become an authorized vendor of the Bumble and Bumble product lines and to purchase salon furniture.

loans.use: To buy inventory and furniture for her hair salon

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: K. Christine est née en 1974 à Akpro-Missérété dans le département du Plateau. Christine est mariée à SATONWANOU Etienne et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Christine vit ensemble avec sa famille à Missérété Centre. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Christine a appris la coiffure. De façon secondaire, Christine vend de l'huile végétale dans son atelier de coiffure. Christine s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui avait obtenu antérieurement trois crédits et qu'elle a tous bien remboursés, malgré les méventes qu'elle a enregistré quelquefois au niveau de son activité. Actuellement, Christine désire augmenter son stock de produits et mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
K. Christine was born in 1974 in Akpro-Missérété in 'Plateau' county. Christine is married to SATONWANOU Etienne and is the mother of four children, some of whom are enrolled in school. Christine lives with her family in Missérété Centre. The couple share the various responsibilities of supporting their family. Christine learned to be a hairdresser. Secondarily, she sells vegetable oil in her beauty salon. She gets her supplies in the market of Ouando in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé and has received three prior loans which she reimbursed correctly, despite certain misadventures with her businesses. Presently, Christine wishes to add to her inventory and better satisfy the needs of her clientele. This is the reason why Christine is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics and jerrycans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Ixoqui´b Ajchac Group

texts.es: Doña Marcelina I. C. de 27 años de edad, casada tiene 1 hija de 2 años de edad, doña Marcelina se dedica a la crianza de animales, actividad que venia realizando desde hace 5 años, doña Marcelina quiere darle un mejor futuro a su hija juntamente con su esposo, ya que tienen 5 años de casados y ella necesita ampliar su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida, doña Marcelina es una persona responsable y solidaria por lo cual convocó a sus vecinas a formar un grupo para que todas mejoren sus condiciones de vida y apoyen a su familia,  conformaron un grupo de 10 personas algunos se dedican a la crianza de animales, confección de ropa y venta de ropa, todas quieren  ampliar su negocio por lo cual solicitan el apoyo de la institución ASDIR.
texts.en:
Doña Marcelina I. C. is 27 years old and is married. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. Marcelina raises animals, an activity that she has been doing for 5 years. Marcelina and her husband want to provide a better future for their daughter. They have been married for 5 years, and she needs to expand her business to obtain greater earnings and in this way improve their living conditions. Marcelina is a person who is very responsible and cooperative; she got her neighbors together to form a group so that they could all improve their living conditions and support their families. They formed a group with 10 people; some of the members raise animals, and others make and sell clothing. All of the members want to expand their businesses, and to do this they are requesting support from the institución ASDIR.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel L. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in dressmaking, pig fattening and a business selling soft drinks. She lives in Barangay Dakit, Bogo City, Cebu, with her 42-year-old husband, Jose L., who works as a salesman, and their two school-aged children who are 9 and 12 years old. Maribel has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dressmaking, pig fattening and soft drinks businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,200. Maribel is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her businesses. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 14,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Maribel aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like shampoo, flakes, and soap in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una madre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de comida en un puesto ambulante situado en un mercadillo del distrito en donde  vive, ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos durante las mañanas y parte de la tarde, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Silvia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos, lo que le generara un aumento de ventas y por consiguiente un aumento en sus ganancias, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Silvia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es lograr tener su propio restaurante. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una buena mujer y le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 57 year old mother who lives with her family in the District of Chepén, an agricultural area with considerable business activity. This district is part of Chepén Province and located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lamayeque region.

Silvia has been selling food as a street vendor for several years at the flea market in her district. She offers her customers different dishes in the mornings and part of the afternoons. The revenue she generates from this business helps to support her family financially.

Silvia wants to expand her business by purchasing more ingredients to prepare her dishes, increase her sales, and continue generating more income. She does not have sufficient capital, which is why she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Silvia is a hardworking and determined woman. Her greatest wish is to open her own restaurant. The people who know her consider her to be a good woman who is very respectful.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia I. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, married, and has six adult children. To make a living, Amalia raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Amalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa S. lives with her five-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local elementary school. Bayarmaa worked as a seamstress and quality control specialist in a tailoring factory from 2000 to 2005. She operated her sewing business in 2005 by making and repairing a variety of clothing items in a rented space at Urt Tsagaan Street, a central and crowded area of Ulaanbaatar. Between 2007 and 2009, she worked as a seamstress in the Czech Republic and restarted her sewing business in 2010. Recently she was able to enlarge her workplace. She needs more funds to purchase necessary tools and equipment and to renovate her workplace. Therefore, she is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is divorced with a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. Tetyana owns a retail bakery business, selling bread and pastry in her home town. All of her eight vending kiosks are located either in downtown or in the busy food marketplace. Tetyana’s mother bakes fresh products along with fifteen hired employees. Tetyana helps her sell baked goods in eight vending kiosks and also delivers them wholesale to fifteen more grocery store locations in town.   

Tetyana started this business eight years ago. Presently, she has 60,000 UAH in turnover capital. This time she is requesting a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase food stock products for her bakery business and pay rent for eight vending facilities where she sells the baked goods.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise and pay rent for 8 vending facilities

loans.name: Paula Genara

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”, ubicado en el distrito Santiago D. Pupuja, provincia D. Azángaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, D. estado civil  casada y tiene 06 hijos (04 independientes), la señora  estudio hasta 5to D. educación  primaria.

Paula viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 3 años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. venta D. carne, chuño y papa.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando carne, chuño y papa para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar sus productos.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad D. préstamo, las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the "Santiago Patron" community bank, located in the Santiago D. Pupuja district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 46 years old, is married and has six children (4 adults). She studied up until fifth year of elementary school.

Paula has been working with the Manuela Ramos community bank for three years. The first loan requested was for 300 new soles, which was used to increase the capital of her business selling meat, cornstarch and potatoes.

She will request a new loan for the sum of 3,000 new soles which will be invested in purchasing meat, cornstarch and potatoes for her business.

Her dream is to have a car to transport her products.

What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of the loans, the meetings and the talks.

loans.use: Purchase meat, cornstarch and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Activas es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 20 de Abril del 2010, integrado por 17  mujeres. 
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra.  Miguela F., quien ya formó parte anteriormente de otro grupo junto con otras compañeras   se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca de la posibilidad de retomar nuevamente el de Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
En vistas de que la respuesta de la asesora fue positiva, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 3er. ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Todas se  dedican a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra de frutas y verduras, compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de mercerías, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (azúcar, arroz, yerba, panificados, lácteos, carnes, etc.), compra de ropa para la venta.
Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Miguela F. quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma elabora.
La venta lo realiza en desde su casa y obtiene buenos ingresos y comenta que esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente para los comestibles que ella prepara especialmente carne, ya que el precio se encuentra muy alta.
texts.en:
The 'Comité Mujeres Activas' (Committee of Active Women) is an excellent committee which was established on 20th April 2010.  It has 17 female members.

This group was formed when Mrs Miguela F., who was previously part of another group, approached the advisor in a loan renewal meeting in her district, to find out about the possibility of regrouping in the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program.

The advisor's response was positive and Miguela was very enthusiastic and very keen to be able to work within the program.  Her group now finds itself working very happily on its third loan cycle in the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' program.

All the members of the group work in different business activities such as buying fruits and vegetables, buying ingredients to prepare food, buying notions, buying merchandise for a grocery store (sugar, rice, yerba, bakery products, dairy products, meat, etc.) and buying clothes to sell.

This is a very active group.  All its members show team spirit and support each other.  They attend the weekly meetings and carry out activities to collect funds for the common good of the group.

One of the group's members is Miguela F. who sells food which she makes herself.  She sells her food from her home and makes a good income.  She comments that this activity makes her good profits.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to make the food which she prepares, especially meat as the price of meat is very high right now.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, especially meat

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región que se caracteriza por que su población está concentrada mayoritaria en zonas urbano marginales.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la fabricación y comercialización de ladrillos. El cuenta con un pequeño horno fuera del distrito y cuenta también con una clientela fidelizada, debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio y a la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo se ha hecho bastante conocido.

El se encuentra solicitando un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de material para seguir fabricando más ladrillos, Alejandro es una persona bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 55, is a father living with his wife and children in José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most densely populated districts in the region, which is characterized by having its population mostly concentrated in marginal urban zones.

For over ten years he has manufactured and sold bricks.  He has a small kiln outside the district and also has regular customers. Thanks to the time he’s been in business and the quality with which he does his work he has become quite well known.

He is asking for a 2000 new sol loan to buy materials to continue making bricks.  Alejandro is a person who is quite responsible and devoted to his family.  People who know him consider him to be levelheaded and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand brick making business.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Bodegones del distrito de San José, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. Se encuentra ubicado por lo menos a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas desde que era bastante joven. Empezó trabajando como peón agrícola y luego pudo ahorrar dinero para poder obtener sus propios ingresos como agricultor. El suele sembrar diversos granos y cereales como arroz y maíz. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Teófilo necesita preparar su terreno para instalar un nuevo cultivo de arroz y poder trabajar durante esta campaña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Teofilo is a 50 year old father who lives with his family in the town of Bodegones in the San Jose district which is in the province of Lambayeque. It is about a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has made a living in agriculture since he was quite young. He began working as a farm hand and was able to save enough money to make money as a farmer on his own. He plants various grains such as rice and corn. The money he makes helps him get his family ahead and  offer them a better quality of life. 

Teofilo needs to prepare his land for a new crop of rice and so be able to work this season. That is why he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Nuevos Soles that will help him meet his goal.

loans.use: Prepare land for rice production

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchi y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Hernán; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pan, el socio elabora los panes para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, y a la vez vende en forma ambulatoria al público en general, el socio lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como harina, manteca, azúcar entre otros más.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hernán is a member of the "Qori Orcco" community bank which is located in Urcos district, in Quispicanchi province, in Cusco department.

Hernán is 38 years old and lives with his partner and four children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling bread.  He makes bread which he then delivers to his customers who have requested it.  He also sells as an itinerant street vendor to the general public.  He has been in this business for years and feels happy because this is how he gets his family ahead in life.

Hernán is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his business such as flour, butter, sugar, etc.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business such as flour, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 52 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su domicilio y en la cual ofrece en venta una variedad de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y verduras tanto al contado y al crédito. Este negocio es administrado por él y por su hermana y debido al buen trato que brindan sus clientes actualmente cuentan con una clientela fiel y estable. Adicionalmente Teodoro trabaja como jornalero en los campos agrícolas de la zona en donde reside.

Teodoro necesita adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Teodoro is a 52-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the district of Mórrope. Mórrope is an agricultural area with a steady amount of commercial activity, located in the province of Lambayeque, over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He runs a grocery store out of his home where he sells a variety of staple products, groceries and vegetables. They accept payment by cash or credit. He and his brother co-manage the store and thanks to their excellent customer service, they have a steady number of loyal customers. Teodoro also works as a day laborer in the fields of the farms near where he lives.

Teodoro needs to purchase more products in order to satisfy the current demand. He found it convenient to request a loan through Edyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, which will help him to meet his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of more products in order to satisfy the current demand.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
Vilma Doris H. B. de 27 años de edad habitante del municipio de Coatepeque en Santa Ana, El Salvador.
Es madre de dos pequeños entre las edades de 7 y 14 años, es propietaria de una tienda en la entrada de su municipio y es muy conocida por ello, también se le conoce en su comunidad por ser tranquila y amable además de responsable con todas sus tareas. 
 A pesar que tiene muchos clientes necesita el préstamo para agrandar el lugar y también poder surtirla con más productos, este pequeño negocio es la única entrada que ella tiene para suplir las necesidades de su familia, al agregar mas productos podrá tener más ganancias y también podrá ayudar mucho mas a sus hijos que aun estudian.
texts.en:
Vilma Doris Hernandez B. is 27 years old and she lives in the municipality of Coatepeque in Santa Ana, El Salvador. 

She is the mother of two little ones, aged 7 and 14. She is the owner of a store located at the access point of her municipality and she is very well known for this fact. She is known in her community for being easy going and kind and responsible for all of her responsibilities. 

Even though she has many clients she needs a loan to expand her store and to add more products to the inventory. This small business is the only source of income she has to supply her family’s needs. With the addition of more products she will increase her earnings and she will also be able to help her children much more, especially because they are still in school.

loans.use: To purchase general groceries for resale.

loans.name: Ekua Essoun Kakraba

texts.en:
Ekua Essoun Kakraba H. is divorced and has 6 dependents. Ekua sells maize and cooking oil at Dompoase near Elmina in Cape Coast. Ekua uses her income for her dependents’ upkeep. Ekua says the loan is going to serve as additional income to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a shop.

In this picture Ekua is showing a small portion of the maize she sells. The jug is used to store her oil for sale.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products to stock her store

loans.name: Odonhuu

texts.en:
Odonhuu, 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a house and they have a decent standard of living. His wife helps him with his business, and his youngest son attends local secondary school. 

Odonhuu used to operate a welding service and began a cell phone repair service and cellphone parts trading business in 2009. He operates his cell phone repair service in a rented shop where his wife sells cell phones. He pays 45,000 MNT for the monthly rent of the shop and his monthly gross income is between 200,000 and 250,000 MNT.

 Odonhuu is a hard-working and modest person and as a result of their family-based business, they have bought their current house and the car, which is in the photo. By expanding the business, they want to buy a shelter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, for their children. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more cell phone parts and tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cell phone parts and tools

loans.name: Vestine

texts.fr: Vestine M. est enseignante dans le secteur de Rubavu, et diacre de son église.  Elle a 43 ans, elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a 4 enfants entre 5 ans et 12 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et Vestine a fini ses A-levels en psychologie clinique.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des matériels de construction et main d’œuvre, pour construire une maison à louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter ses sources de revenu an ayant des maisons à louer, et améliorer sa situation d’habitation.  Pour sa vie, elle voudrait améliorer le bien être de sa famille, et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Vestine M. is a teacher in the Rubavu sector, and is also the deaconess of her church. She was born in Rwanda and is currently 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are between 5 and 12 years old. All of her children attend school, and Vestine finished her A-levels in clinical psychology. She is going to use her loan to pay for construction materials and manual labour to build a house for rent. Her strategy to increase her business is to augment her sources of income by having houses to rent and also to improve her living situation. With regards to her life, she would like to improve her family's well-being and to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials and manual labour in order to build a house for rent.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: María tiene 51 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene un hijo aún dependiente. Vive en casa propia junto a su madre, hermana e hijo en la parte urbana del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida vendiendo ropa de hombres y mujeres. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. También genera ingresos adicionales alquilando cuartos disponibles en su casa. Alquila a los estudiantes, viajantes y empresarios que visitan la zona. Desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más inventario de ropa. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Maria es una clienta recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias de sus vecinos y conocidos en su comunidad urbana.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old, single, and has one child who is still a dependent.  She lives in her own home with her mother, her sister, and her son in the urban section of the District of Motupe.  This farming district is part of Lambayeque Province and located an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

María earns her living by selling clothes for men and women.  She is well-known in the area and has an established customer base.  María also generates additional income by renting out rooms in her home.  She rents to students, travelers, and businesspeople who visit the area.  

María wants to expand her business and buy more clothing to increase her inventory.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.  María is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa.  She presents excellent references from her neighbors and acquaintances within her urban community.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha V. is a 27 year-old man who makes a living by helping his neighbor in his mobile computer business. He has been working in this job for over two years, and he earns about $7 per day for the family’s needs. His wife  is a sewing worker in the garment factory. The couple is blessed with one child who still lives under their care. Pha's old motorbike broke down and he doesn’t have sufficient cash to buy a new one.  Pha V. will be use his loan to buy a new motorbike. He will use the new motorbike for business and other needs.

loans.use: to buy a second motorbike.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 21 and has a one year old child. She works together with her husband selling milk. They have done this business for one year and it has enabled her to pay school fees for her family and to improve their standard of living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more quantities of fresh milk and hence make more profit. With her savings and the profits, she plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida stays at home and takes care of her family. She is a very hardworking lady and performs her work with full devotion. Sajida is the mother of three children. All of them are very young and haven't started their education yet. 

She is married by status and her husband operates a paint and polish business. He paints buildings and polishes furniture, windows, doors, etc. He has been operating this business for many years and has vast experience in it. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her cousin who also lives with her and is involved in the painting and polishing business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes and polishes to improve the condition of his business. This will help him fulfill the demands of his clients and improve his business. 

Sajida feels a great level of happiness by helping others. She is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for her cousin. 

This is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sajida.

loans.use: to buy paint and polish for a painting & polishing business

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem is a resident of Siem Reap Province where he plants a few crops on his existing fertile farm. Since 1999, he has been spending his life working in his farming business. He can earn an average of US$2.50 a day to use for cash expenses. Besides this job, he also buys firewood from other villagers to burn in a coal oven to produce charcoal and then sell for more profit. He is a widower and currently lives with his seven children some of whom already have jobs. 

Due to a lack of money, Chhem decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as paying for plowing, buying fertilizer, and other supplies to begin a farming business. With the remainder of the loan, he will purchase additional firewood for firing into charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, to buy seed, and to purchase additional firewood for firing into charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
La señora Elba, es una mujer de 38 años, quien curso unicamente el primer año de la educación primaria,vecina de Puntarenas, Corredores, La Cuesta, Bella Luz de la Vaca, Río Incendio, trecientos metros Norte de la escuela; una de las zonas del país con un menor indice de desarrollo humano;  madre de dos hijos menores de edad quienes cursan la educación primaria; se dedica a la actividad de la ganaderia, cria de cerdos, esta señora convivio durante años con un compañero, pero no se caso, sin embargo por haver convivido como pareja y tener dos hijos meñores de edad de esra relación, y verse imposibilitada por esta razón a realizar un trabajo remunerado fuera del hogar, se le concede una pensión del regimen de invalidez, vejez y muerte por un monto de 70,125.00 colones costarricenses, lo que es muy poco para poder dar calidad de vida a sus hijos, de allí es donde decide desde hace cinco años, buscar un complemento al ingreso familiar, lo que hace mediante la cria de cerdo, los que compra pequeños para poder engordarlos, durante un periodo de seis meses, y posteriomente los vende, para poder iniciar nuevamente un nuevo ciclo de producción; esta actividad se desarrolla en la parte de atras de la casa, donde ella ha acondicionado un espacio(chiquero), para tener los cerdos, esto ha sido posible por la reinversión de utilidades de ventas anteriores de cerdos.
En la zona de residencia de doña Elba, esta es una actividad factible de desarrollar, por cuanto se tiene sembrado en las parcelas banano y platano, que junto con el alimento concentrado, se utiliza para la alimentación de los cerdos con muy buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Sra. Elba is a 38-year-old woman who only has a first grade education. She lives in an area near Puntarenas, Corredores, La Cuesta, Bella Luz de la Vaca, Río Incendio. This location is 300 meters north of the school and has one of the lowest Human Development Index scores in the country.

Elba is the mother of two children who are attending elementary school. She raises livestock, specifically pigs. Elba has been in a common-law relationship with her companion for two years. Even though she and her partner are not married, they have two children as a result of their relationship. For this reason, she has not been able to work outside of the home. She receives a pension in the amount of 70,125 CRC, which is a very small amount for her to provide a decent quality of life for her children. Five years ago, Elba looked for a way to supplement the family income so she decided to raise pigs. She buys the animals when they are small so that she can fatten them. Elba raises them for a period of six months before selling them and starting the process over again. Her business is located in an area behind her house that is well-suited for keeping her pigs. She was able to construct a pig sty by reinvesting the profits from her previous sales.

Doña Elba has a viable business that she can develop from her home. She also has land on which she planted bananas and plantains. Elba will use her loan to buy concentrated feed for her pigs so that she can obtain excellent results.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and concentrated feed.

location.town: La Cuesta, Bella Luz de la Vaca

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 46 years old and is married with 2 children who are in school. Lucrecia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Lucrecia requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Lucrecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rubylin

texts.en:
Rubylin is a married mother of four children, three of whom are currently studying. With her husband, Rubylin works hard to maintain their farming business, which they have been operating for 10 years.

Currently earning PHP 20,000 each cropping season, Rubylin is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive and facilitate growth in their operations. In the future, she hopes to generate more income to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 44, is a hardworking, ambitious businesswoman who is a servant to the community. She is single and a proud mother to a 15-year-old school-going child. Since the year 2010, Margaret has been running a consultancy firm in psychology and HIV counseling. She supplements her income from this trade with the rent she collects from her rental houses. Previously, she was a salaried employee.
Margaret is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a computer. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for making credit facilities easily accessible to her.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong has been spending her life cultivating crops in Kompong Cham Province. This is a skill she learned from her father when she was young. She is now married and has three children. One of them is school-aged and two of her children are working in Phnom Penh city where they can earn a suitable salary each month. Her husband works as a machine repairer in the village. 

Mong’s husband faces difficulties with his traveling needs because he always has to pay a lot of money to a taxi driver when he wants to go to his work place and other places. Therefore, Mong hopes to reduce the amount her husband has to spend on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is 30 years of age and married with five children. Aliitasi owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.  

Aliitasi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Aliitasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aliitasi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a  39 year old married woman with two children. She has been selling fish in Maweni Town in Malindi for the past ten years now. She gets a monthly income of about Kshs.40,000 from the business. 

Benter has borrowed and repaid a previous loan and this serves as her second loan cycle. She plans to use the money to add more fish stock and to buy a new and bigger weighing machine for her business. 

Benter wishes to use the anticipated profit to assist her husband in taking care of the family as well as save some of it for future investments.

loans.use: To buy more fish and a new weighing scale

loans.name: Flor Esneda

texts.es:
Flor es una emprendedora de 37 años de edad que junto ha su esposo ha trabajado en una empresa durante muchos años, sin embargo hace poco se les presentó la oportunidad de generar un ingreso adicional con su propio negocio, y actualmente, en sus tiempos libres se encargan de cortar madera y pulirla según lo que los clientes requieran, esto les ha permitido generar mas ingresos para su hogar.

Hoy en día ven la necesidad de comprar una máquina circular con la cual darle un mejor acabado a sus productos y agilizar el proceso de producción pero desafortunadamente no cuenta con el capital para dicha compra. Por lo cual solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar la máquina y seguir con este progreso que poco a poco viven, con la ilusión de brindarle a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is a 37-year old entrepreneur who, alongside her husband, has worked for a company for many years. However, a short while ago, an opportunity arose to generate additional income by operating her own business. Now, in her free time, she cuts and finishes wood according to her customers' needs. This work has allowed Flor to earn more money for her household.

Now she needs to buy a circular saw to give a better finish to the products and speed up the production process. Unfortunately she doesn't not have enough money to make this purchase. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy the saw so she continue making the steady progress in which the family lives. Her hope is to provide a better quality of life for her two children.

loans.use: to buy a circular saw

loans.name: Bahaa'

texts.en: Bahaa' is a 24 year old young man. He is a taxi driver and takes external and internal transports which is the only source of income for him. Bahaa' wants to complete the cost of purchasing a new taxi, so he needs to take a loan of amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Bahaa' gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to complete the cost of purchasing a new taxi. This will enable him to improve his work and to work extra hours to increase his income and to improve his living conditions. Bahaa' is photographed next to the new taxi he wants to purchase.

loans.use: To complete the  purchase of a new taxi.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has six children, four of which currently attend school. Her husband works as a driver. Dorcas operates a poultry business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years and was previously employed as a shop worker. Her primary customers are butchers and restaurants. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation. Her largest monthly expense is food. 

Dorcas will use the loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to rebuild her chicken coop and buy more chicken feed. Dorcas aspires to have several bigger chicken coops in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: to rebuild her chicken coop and buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 39 years old and illiterate. Her parents could not provide her with an education due to financial constraints. 

Rukhsana is married and her husband operates a grocery store in their home, selling daily-use items like spices, sugar, cooking oils, etc. Rukhsana is the mother of a young son who also works. 

Rukhsana provides support to her husband in her free time. She helps him operate his grocery store and serves his clients. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who, with the help of the loan, will purchase groceries in bulk, which will allow him to fulfill client orders on time and increase his profits. 

Rukhsana's husband has been operating his business for 10 years, and Rukhsana is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Wil

texts.en:
Wil is a 30-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For the past year, he has been running a wholesale business selling soda and beer. Wil’s hardships are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital. 

Will is requesting a loan to buy beer to sell. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to expand into new markets and find a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl se dedica a la albañilería desde hace ya más diez años, su esposo se encarga del cuidado y atención de sus dos hijos. 
Son originarios de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí y tiene más de doce años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Es una familia trabajadora que sean tener mejor patrimonio y saben que trabajando lo lograran. 
 Solicitan un préstamo para comprar el material que es block, varilla, arena y cemento, ya que Don Raúl se encargara de realizar la mejora en horarios adicionales a su trabajo. 
Ya que les preocupa la seguridad de su familia y el patrimonio que han lograda con mucho esfuerzo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Raúl has been a bricklayer for more than 10 years. His wife is responsible for the care and attention of their 2 children. They are originally from the city of San Luis Potosí and have lived for more than 12 years in the city of Nuevo Laredo. Theirs is a hardworking family that wants a better inheritance and knows that by working they will succeed.

They are asking for a loan to buy building materials such as cement blocks, rods, sand and cement as Don Raúl will take care of the improvement  during his spare time from work as he is worried about his family's safety and the inheritance they have managed to achieve for their children with so much effort.

.

loans.use: to build a wall around the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new stock of groceries such as fruits, vegetables, rice, etc.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (two sisters).  

Milly  has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week.  Milly sells her products from home by means of retail.   She also generates additional income through poultry farming.  The main business challenges for Milly include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease on transportation.

Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.   

Milly lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a father of six who works in Mukono. For the past 16 years, Muhammad has been in the tailoring business. Muhammad speaks at length about how much he'd like to expand his business, in order to generate more revenue. On average, his monthly income returns currently add up to UGX 200,000. He says that he anticipates earning much more than this sum once he gets this loan and puts it to work. 

Muhammad will use this loan to purchase more fabric to make clothes. With more such fabric, he says that he will be able to make more clothes to sell to his growing clientele.

loans.use: the purchase of more cloth making fabric

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth de 33 años de edad , es una mujer muy alegre, emprendedora y dinámica. Convive con Daniel  quien es empleado, tiene dos hijos menores quienes son su inspiración para progresar. Juntos habitan en su casa propia la cual logró construir con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja  y sus dos menores hijos. El trabajo que realiza Janeth es la venta de materiales de construcción, accesorios, entre  otros, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa. Tiene más de 3 años realizando está actividad, y en donde su esposo siempre la apoyo desde un principio, y durante este tiempo le ha valido hacerse conocida, siendo ahora su negocio las más concurrida de su localidad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es el ingreso económico, ya que le permite mantener un sustento a su hogar, y le ha permitido pagar los estudios de hijos los cuales son la inspiración de seguir trabajando para darles una mejor calidad de vida. y viendo que sus productos no son perecibles y los puede almacenar por mas tiempo, además de eso la rentabilidad de su negocio. Tiene planes de seguir incrementado y ampliar su negocio. Este sería su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el  grupo que viene trabajando ya que son personas responsables, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el préstamo solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para implementar su ferretería, ella considera que a mayor variedad mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Janeth is 33 years old and a cheerful, enterprising, and dynamic woman. She is in a common-law relationship with Daniel, who is employed, and they have two young children who are her inspiration for making progress. They live together in their own home that was built with the unconditional support of her partner and her two children. Janeth sells construction materials, accessories, and other products from a space that is set aside in her house. She has been in business for more than three years. Her husband has always supported her from the beginning and she has become recognized throughout this time. What she enjoys about her work is being able to generate a financial income that allows her to sustain her household. This has also enabled her to pay for her children’s studies since they are the inspiration that drives her to continue working so that they can have a better quality of life. Since the products she sells are nonperishable, she is able to store them for long periods of time. In addition, her business is profitable. Janeth has plans to continue growing and expanding her business.

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP organization. She is very pleased with and appreciative of the group she works with because the members are responsible people. For this reason, Janeth promises to be punctual with her payments. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy merchandise to keep her hardware store in operation. She believes having a greater variety will generate more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to restock her hardware store.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 33-year-old Lebanese woman.  She is married and lives with her husband and five children, who are all in school.  Together with her husband, she works hard to bring added income to the family and to pay the fees for her children to study.  

She has owned an accessories, bags and perfume shop in her town since 2009, where all ladies can benefit from her products.  Today, she intends to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to add additional items, such as perfume and many other products, to her existing inventory.  She expects that she will increase her profit by expanding her inventory of goods sold.  In the future, she plans to add clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase perfume and other products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena vive con su compañero de vida y con 6 hijos, de los cuales 5 son menores de edad y van a la escuela con esfuerzo y dedicación y uno que es mayor de edad que ayuda en los oficios y quehaceres del hogar. María Elena es una mujer muy responsable, comprometida con lo que sus hijos le pidan, es honesta, atenta y muy colaboradora. En la actualidad María tiene un negocio de venta de tamales y de tortillas, es muy conocida por la zona donde reside y posee de abundante clientela, los elabora en variedad de carne de gallina, cerdo y mixtos. Ella cree que necesita aumentar un poco las ventas y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como: Maíz, Pimienta, Aceite, Consomé, Sal, papas, ejotes, tomates, güisquil, pollo, achote, Hojas de huerta, entre otros insumos. Esta segura que con la ayuda recibida el negocio se desarrollará mejor y espera solventar la deuda antes de lo previsto.

loans.use: para la compra de materia prima como: Maíz, Pimienta, Aceite, Consomé, Sal, papas, ejotes, tomates, güisquil, pollo, achote, Hojas de huerta

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en: Nana is involved in selling watermelon in her village of Domenase near Elmina. Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a taxi driver) support their three children. She has been involved in selling watermelon for five years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of melon, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her watermelon enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of melons.

loans.name: Victory Learning School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ritah. She is the Head teacher of Victory learning Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 1300 students. 

Victory learning Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Victory learning Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Ritah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO improve on business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is a widow. She has 4 children, and two of them are going to school. She is educated to level 10 and dropped out of school due to the problem of school fees. She has been in business since 1999, and the business has been able to meet the needs of the family.

With the loan, she wants to diversify so that both of the two businesses can generate income. This will enable her to to maximize on profit which she relies on to take care of the family. She wants to use part of the profits to save in preparation for sending her children to secondary school and part to buy a plot and build a home for herself.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
