Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, medicines and fertilizers

loans.name: Grover

texts.es:
Es un señor trabajador, cuenta con una familia reducida, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio, el Sr Grover O. tiene una peluquería con mucho sacrificio ya que  ha sufrido mucho en su vida, pero el pudo sobrellevar sus problemas y la situación en que se encuentra.
 
Actualmente hizo cursos de nivelación en un  institutito y quiere  seguir  superándose , el  paso por y nos solicito un crédito para capital de trabajo, donde fue aceptado ya que por  referencia de sus vecinos siempre ha sido una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
This is a very hard-working man. He has a small family and his children are in school. Mr. Grover O. has a beauty salon which he has obtained through great sacrifice, since he has suffered greatly in his life. However, he has been able to endure his problems and his situation.

He has just finished courses in an institute and he wants to continue bettering himself. He came to us and requested a loan for working capital, and he was accepted because, according to his neighbours' reference, he has always been a responsible and hard-working person.

loans.use: working capital for his hair salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa M. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 55 years old. Narcisa is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Narcisa raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Narcisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Narcisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Narcisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Larissa Sandrine

texts.fr:
Larissa M. W. est une commerçante de HOPE Congo, âgée de 25ans, universitaire et célibataire sans enfant. 

Elle débute son acticité dès l’âge de 15ans avec un capital de 25000. Ses revenus journaliers sont de 80000 à 150000frs. 

Avec ce second prêt elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbon.

Elle veut devenir une grande commerçante dans l’avenir ainsi que finir ses études universitaires et fondé une famille afin d’offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Larissa M. W. is a merchant with HOPE Congo. She is 25 years old, a university student, unmarried, and has no children. With 25,000 francs in capital, she started her business at the age of 15.  Her revenues range from 80,000 to 150,000 francs per day.

With this second loan, Larissa wants to bolster her business by buying sacks of charcoal. She wants to become a major merchant in the future, along with finishing her university education and starting a family, so as to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Saad

texts.en: Saad is a 34-year-old married man from Nablus. He owns a wood shop in Nablus. He lives with his wife and five children, three of whom are in school. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store and buy new equipment. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to increase the size of his store and buy new equipment.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en: Nazia lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 16 years. She is 29 years old, married to M. S. and has three children. Unfortunately, none of them are able to attend school due to financial constraints. Nazia's husband has a business selling Punjabi food. He has a small restaurant where he sells different types of food items such as Nan Chanay (made with chickpeas and served with bread) and Daal Chawal (made with lentils and served with rice and pickle). These dishes have a very good taste in his hands and his clients like his food very much. Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to improve his business further. With this loan, he will buy required ingredients such as lentils, cooking oil, rice, spices and chickpeas, etc., that will enable him to prepare better quality food and increase his profits. Nazia is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him more profits in future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul M. is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to a farmer. She has a daughter and two sons. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The first son works as a security guard and the second son studies at school. 

Baktygul, together with her husband, cultivates agricultural products. She has been doing it since 1991. Her husband also earns money for the family budget by transporting passengers from Balykchi to Bishkek. 

With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to purchase potato and wheat seeds. In the future, she plans to improve the family’s living conditions and provide her younger son a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift valley Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years and sells her milk locally. She also earns additional income from her small-scale farming of tea which she sells to the local market.

Emily has made a loan request of 50,000 Kes to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her five children. She faces the challenge of not enough dairy feed which affects her production. She hopes to increase the number of her dairy cows and plant enough dairy feed in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Aydee

texts.es: Rosa Aydee vive con su compañero de vida y sus  tres hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca de la localidad donde residen. Ella posee una venta de artículos de uso personal, y su venta es muy conocida en el lugar pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y  tienen precios accesibles, además los clientes la prefieren porque les ofrece un buen servicio, siempre esta alegre y los atiende con gran amabilidad; Rosa es una mujer que quiere superarse para ella la manera en la que atrae y motiva a las personas a comprar sus productos es lo que definirá su éxito; esto la impulsa a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como shampo, cremas, desodorantes, cosméticos, perfumes, calcetines entre otros. Con esto Rosa siempre mantendrá mercancía para lo que sus clientes necesiten y tiene fe que los frutos de su negocio le darán la oportunidad de darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Rosa Aydee lives with her life partner and three children who attend school close to their home. She has a shop where she sells personal items and her business is well known since she sells high quality products with reasonable prices. In addition, clients prefer her because she offers them great service. She is always cheerful and attends to them kindly. Rosa is a woman who wants to succeed in life. Her ability to attract clients and motivate them to buy her products are what she considers to be her success. This motivates her to request INTEGRAL a loan to buy products such as shampoo, creams, deoderants, cosmetics, perfumes, socks, etc. With the loan Rosa will always be able to have products available for her clients and she has faith that the profits she makes from this business will give her opportunities to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, creams, deoderants, cosmetics, perfumes, socks, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jessica es una persona que le gusta luchar por si sola ella tiene un salon de belleza que dia a dia lo atiende ella nos cuenta que sus clientes han aumentado y gracias a eso sus ganacias han cresido, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para salon de belleza ya esta conbecido de que lo falta mas capital para trabajar, el sueño de ella es tener otro salon de belleza para que en un futuro estar mojor economicamente.
texts.en: Mrs. Jessica likes to strive to support herself.  She has a beauty salon where she works day by day.  She shares that the number of her clients has increased and thanks to this, her earnings have grown.  She is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics for the beauty salon.  She realizes that she lacks the capital to work.  Her dream is to have another beauty salon so that in the future she will be better off economically.

loans.use: buy cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SOUMBA, la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour(sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi II group are married women, who average 40 years of age an 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the village in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, pearl millet, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Soumba (first one standing on the right) intends to buy fertilizers, small tools, and pay for weeding to maintain about 0.9 hectare of rice and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) during the season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicide, and small tools, and pay for weeding

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es:
Santiago de 54 años es un hombre que se dedica al servicio de mantenimiento y reparaciòn de vehículos motocicletas y bicicletas, además de vender repuestos para su mantenimiento y reparación técnica y mecánica, en su taller ubicado en su lugar de vivienda ubicado  en el municipio de Soledad, cerca de Barranquilla, donde muchos lo conocen y habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 21 años, con los que sueña ver prósperos y desarrollando su propio éxito. 
Su negocio nació hace 16 años, cuando se instaló en el departamento del Atlántico, procedente de su pueblo natal  y debió entonces buscar la forma de sostener a su familia,  generando  ingresos autónomos.  Al principio en su negocio solo cargaba de aire los neumáticos de motos y algunos vehículos, posteriormente su capacidad observadora le facilitó captar la oportunidad de vender accesorios como guayas, llantas, neumáticos, codos, tensores, con los cuales aún sigue trabajando  y ha logrado un M. creciente. Santiago   muchas veces siente que le hace falta capital para responder  oportunamente a todas las  necesidades de sus clientes. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, con él comprará variedades de rines, neumáticos, y guayas de moto.  Con esta inversión tendrá en su negocio de todo un poco y resolverá el tema de respuesta efectiva a sus clientes. Su gran sueño y desafío es tener una serviteca en un local bien ubicado, donde diversifique totalmente su oferta y logre con su negocio ser reconocido cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 54, provides maintenance and repair services for motorcycles and bicycles.  In his workshop he also sells replacement parts for technical and mechanical maintenance and repair.  His shop is located where his home is.  It is in the Soledad municipality close to Barranquilla, where a lot of people know him.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 21.  He dreams of seeing his children prosper and develop their own success. 

His business was born 16 years ago when he left his native town and set his business up in the Atlántico department.  He needed to look for a way to support his family and generate income on his own.  In the beginning he only worked on air in tires for motorcycles and some other vehicles.  Later, his observational ability helped him seize the opportunity to sell accessories like control cables, tires, rims, elbow adaptors, and turnbuckles.  He still uses them to work, and he has managed to get a growing market.

Santiago often feels that he does not have the money to opportunely respond to all of his customers’ needs.  This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy a variety of motorcycle rims, tires, and control cables.

With this investment he will have a little bit of everything in his business .  This will be an effective solution for his customers.  His biggest dream and challenge is to have a service station in a good location.  That is where he will totally diversify his services, and he will make his business increasingly well-known.

loans.use: to buy a variety of motorcycle rims, tires, and control cables.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is involved in the teaching profession. She has studied till intermediate level and teaches different subjects to her students. She is a very good teacher and her students like her way of teaching very much. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her brother’s embroidery business. He operates his business from his home and is an expert in his field. Due to his good quality work, he receives regular orders every month.  

With the loan, he will buy embroidery materias in bulk quantity which will help him fill his orders on time and increase his profits. He has been doing this business for the past five years and Rabia is confident that after the loan investment, her brother will be able to meet requirements of his customers and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Jeenbubu's Group

texts.en:
Jeenbubu is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and two daughters. The first son and the older daughter are married and live separately with their families. The second son works in construction and the youngest daughter studies at school. In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, Jeenbubu breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after fattening. With money received from the loan, Jeenbubu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz de 45 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 14 años. Allí tiene un negocio llamado “Confecciones Aldescu”, que inició desde hace 10 años, como una alternativa de ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su hogar y complementar los gastos que hasta el momento estaban a cargo solamente de su esposo. Muy pronto su negocio que nació de una manera doméstica ofreciendo el servicio de costura, fue creciendo y ya sus clientes no  le llevaban solo las telas e insumos para obtener un vestido sobre medidas, sino que ella lo fabricaba a todo costo  y  también exhibía las prendas por tallas; gradualmente fue agregando mercancías como cosméticos, labiales, perfumes entre otras y sus ventas se incrementaron. En la actualidad aprovecha las épocas en las cuales repuntan sus ventas, surtiendo su negocio de lo que conoce que sus clientes requieren. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita su credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para fabricar vestidos, perfumería, cosméticos, calzado entre otros artículos, pues se acerca el día del amor y de la amistad y aprovechará para hacer su gran venta.  Porque su sueño es tener un local amplio para ubicar su taller, generando empleos y posicionado en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Martha Luz is 45 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children who range in age from 4 to 14. There she has a business called “Confecciones Aldescu”, which she started 10 years ago as a way to help support her household and cover some of the expenses since only her husband was contributing at the time. Soon after her business was started, she began offering sewing services from her home. Her business grew, but her customers did not provide her with the fabrics and supplies that she needed to make a particular dress, so she began producing at all costs and also started exhibiting dresses of different sizes. Martha gradually acquired more merchandise such as cosmetics, lipsticks, perfumes, and other items so that she could increase her sales. At the moment, she is taking advantage of the time of year when her sales rebound by stocking her business with products that she knows her customers will need.

For this reason Martha is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy raw materials for making dresses, as well as perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items in time for the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian equivalent to Valentine’s Day). Martha will take advantage of this time to make many sales. Her dream is to have a larger space where she can relocate her workshop so that she can create jobs and position herself within the community.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
For the last four years Erickson has been operating a curio shop in West Gate, in the town of Westlands. He is 25 years old and is married to Evelyn.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy ready made African curios which he will later sell at a profit.

In future Erickson hopes to expand his business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy ready-made African curios which he will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Carmen Emperatriz

texts.es:
Carmen Emperatriz tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero niños y niñas.Las compras de la mercadería lo hace en una distribuidora y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.El crédito lo solicita para comprar mercaderia variedad de ropa interior y poder ampliar el local  para aumentar los ingresos económicos.

El sueño es  ampliar el negocio y adquirir más mercaderia para obtener mayores utilidades.En el tiempo libre le gusta enseñar las tareas al hijo y pasear con el.
texts.en:
Carmen Emperatriz is 32 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives with her child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '1º de Mayo' community bank is located in 1º de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  The bank's members work in commerce.

Carmen sells men's, women's and children's clothes.  She buys her merchandise from a wholesaler's and sells it in Ventanas market.  She is requesting this loan to buy a range of underwear and to expand her premises so that she can increase her income.

Carmen's dream is to expand her business and acquire more merchandise so that she can make more profit.  In her free time, she enjoys teaching her son and going out for walks with him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (a range of underwear) and to expand her premises

loans.name: Florina

texts.en: Florina is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan city, Isabela. She is 49 years old and has been engaged in the piggery business for 10 years. She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation. Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide for their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog raising business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and the father of two children.

Mohamad has owned a shop since 2004, selling mobile phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where a lot of potential customers pass by.

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 11 years. 

Merriam has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela has been operating a pharmacy business for the last two years in order to help support her family. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman. Thanks to a previous loan through Faulu Kenya, she has managed and improved her business. Previous to starting her own business, she was employed elsewhere. 

Pamela has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She and her husband have two children, both enrolled in school.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy medicines to offer for sale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Pamela also dreams of buying a piece of land in future.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.es: Maria Enriqueta: de 50 años de edad ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos de telares,y a la costureria desde hace 10 años, ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque gracias a Dios su negocio a prosperado,y que a demas es una forma de ayudar a su familia,poreso ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos con telar, a la compra de tela para seguir costurando y asi de esa forma seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Enriqueta is 50 years old and has been weaving and sewing for 10 years.  She says that she’s happy because, thanks to God, her business is prospering and it provides a means for her to help her family.  This is why she is requesting this loan.  She will use the money to buy weaving materials and fabric in order to continue her work and her business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar a sus 26 años de edad es un emprendedor quien decide hace 5 meses iniciar su negocio con la finalidad de obtener ingresos adicionales a su actual trabajo. El señor Cesar trabaja en su tienda en las horas de la mañana y en la tarde deja a una persona encargada. Gracias a capacitaciones que el señor Cesar ha recibido en su actual trabajo ha podido mejorar su tienda.  El señor Cesar desea comprar surtido como arroz, aceite, panela, productos de aseo personal y del hogar, además de una vitrina y sillas para su tienda. El sueño del señor Cesar es ver crecer su negocio y que este posicionado en el sector, con el fin de dejar su actual trabajo de medio tiempo y así poder estar tiempo completo en su negocio, asimismo el señor Cesar espera brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 26, is an entrepreneur who decided five months ago to start a business, with the aim of earning additional income to supplement what he receives in his current job. Cesar works during the morning hours in his store, and in the afternoon, leaves someone in charge. 

Thanks to the training Cesar has received in his current job, he has been able to improve his store. Cesar wishes to buy stock such as rice, cooking oil, brown sugarloaf, personal hygiene products and home products. He also wants to buy a display case and chairs for his store. 

Cesar's dream is to see his business grow, and be well-established in the neighborhood; with the aim of leaving his current half-time job and being able to work full-time in his business. Cesar also hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy stock and fixed assets.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She has operated a grocery stall for the last two years, a business she set up from her savings.

Joyce learned of Milango from her friends and is now applying for a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase dry fish, potatoes, greens, and tomatoes. The main business challenge she faces is inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. Her ambition is to open a cereals wholesale shop. She will use the extra income to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish, potatoes, greens, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mari's Group

texts.es:
Mari's Group es una sociedad de mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean mejorar su calidad de vida, en esta sociedad María es la presidenta ya que es una mujer alegre, responsable y trabajadora. María tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive en Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador.

María tiene un local de comidas, negocio que le ayuda a mantener y dar el estudio a sus dos hijos ya que es el único ingreso económico de su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un horno para asar pollos ya que quiere innovar y variar las comidas en su negocio, esta inversión ayudará a que gane más clientela y así incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mari’s Group is a society of women workers and entrepreneurs who want to improve their quality of life. 

María is 38 years old. She is single and has two children. She lives in Otavalo in the province of Imbabur in northern of Ecuador.

María  has a food stand. Her business helps her to support and pay for the studies of her two children and is the only source of income for her family. This is the first loan that she has asked for through Fodemi. She is going to use the money to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food in her business. The money from the loan would help her to win more customers, increasing her sales and profits.

Her dream is that her business grows and she wants to have a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 41 years old and married with three children, aged 9, 14 and 17. She runs a retail shop where she sells maize flour, rice and sugar to earn a living. She earns extra income from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Kimyin

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Kimyin is 44 years old and married. She has two children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming, growing oranges and chili peppers for 10 years. Besides this, Kimyin also raises fish and cows to earn additional income. The current business earns about 56,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

Kimyin has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fish to raise and spend some of it on a pumping machine for supporting her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy more fish and a pumping machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase Milk Cans and expand milk buying business.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
Ayoko A. was born in 1977 and lives in Atchamé. She is married, the mother of two, and is also responsible for her brothers and sisters. And since her husband does not work, she is essentially the head of household. The principal source of Ms. A.'s income derives from making coconut oil out of coconuts. It must be said that the meager income from this business is not enough to support her household. Her previous loans have allowed her to see some progress and have indeed been repaid.

To reinvigorate her business, she is asking for a loan of $650 to stock up on firewood and coconuts. She would also like to buy a cart for transporting the coconuts. This will augment her production in hopes of increasing her revenues.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteers.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame A. Ayoko est née en 1977 et est domiciliée a Atchamé. Elle a également ses frères et sœurs en charge et joue pratiquement le rôle de chef de ménage, le mari étant sans activité. La transformation des noix de coco en huile de coco constitue son activité principale d’où elle tire son revenu. Il faut dire que cette activité ne lui permet pas avec le revenu maigre qu’elle en tire, de supporter toutes ses charges. Les crédits antérieurs lui ont permis de réaliser des progrès et ont été bien soldés.

Pour redynamiser ses activités, elle sollicite $650 pour s’approvisionner en bois de chauffe, en noix de coco et pour acheter un pousse-pousse pouvant lui permettre de transporter les noix de coco. Ceci augmentera sa production en vu d’accroître son revenu.

loans.use: To stock firewood and coconuts and to buy a cart

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 15, 17 and 19. Cirilo, her husband has worked for the Ferromex Railroad Company for 18 years, but because the wages that he receives are not sufficient to cover the household costs and the education of their three children, it is necessary for her find a way to bring in extra income. For the past three years Maria has worked selling used clothing and orange juice, which she makes herself.

Love for her family and dedication to her husband drive Maria to work harder every day. She is asking for a $275 loan with she will use to purchase merchandise so that she can offer greater variety to her clients, and by doing so increase her sales. This will proviD. important help in the life of this family and in the growth of this business, and they thank you for your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 36 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. tres hijos, D. 15, 17 y 19 años. Cirilo, su esposo, trabaja desD. hace 18 años como ferrocarrillero en L. empresa Ferromex, pero el ingreso que recibe es muy poco para solventar los gastos D. su hogar y D. L. educación D. sus tres hijos, ante L. necesidad D. obtener un ingreso extra, Maria decidió iniciar, hace tres años, son L. venta D. ropa usada y jugos D. naranja, que elL. misma prepara.

El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo son los motivos más grandes D. Maria para esforzarse cada días más, ahora necesita D. un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas. Se parte importante es L. viada D. esta familia y en el crecimiento D. este negocio, ellos agradecen tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Mr Lucas started his supply business in his own house some nine years ago. Due to familial difficulties over the course of six years, his shop deteriorated. He was able to find a new location where he aquired property and built a new house and a new shop. Right now, his business prospers due to this strategic and centralized location.

Mr Lucas asks for a loan to purchase more merchandise for his clients living on the outskirts of the city who regularly stop in his shop on their travels to and from the city in search of work. He believes that with more merchandise his profits will increase and his business will prosper.

Mr Lucas is 49 years old and has one child who is in school. His wife helps him with the business. His house is made of cement, and he is certain that with the business' prosperity he will be able to provide the stability for which his family has been looking.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Lucas empezó su negocio de venta de víveres en su propia casa hace unos nueve años pero después de seis por dificultades familiares su tienda decayó ahora el encontró un nuevo sector donde pudo adquirir un terreno y hacer una casa y de nuevo implanto su tienda en ese sector. Actualmente su negocio ha prosperado mucho por que esta ubicado en un sitio estratégico y céntrico.

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería ya que ahora los clientes de pueblos aledaños salen en busca de trabajo a la ciudad y necesariamente pasan por su despensa y así llevan su producto. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero

El Sr. Lucas tiene 49 años de edad y tiene un hijo que estudia, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio su casa de cemento y Él tiene certeza de que con la prosperidad de su negocio va a poder darle a su familia la estabilidad que tanto ha buscado

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Abulfas

texts.en:
Mr. Abulfas is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 50, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Abulfas and his son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Abulfas sells beef in the Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle. Their volume of beef sold is growing. To supply the demand of his customers, Abulfas decided to apply for a $1000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. In the Caucasus region, the price of a cow is up to $400. If Abulfas receives the loan, he will add two cows more to his herd. It will allow him to provide the necessities of life for the family.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Ni Nengah Nerti

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Nerti at this time lives with her husband and 2 high school aged children. Ni Nengah Nerti is in the red sugar making business. She is already in this business for several years, since Ni Nengah Nerti saw that her income as a common tenant farmer who only work on the fields the traditional way, would not be enough to meet ever increasing family needs. With a capital of Rp700,000 (about US$77), Ni Nengah Nerti with the help of her husband started to make red sugar from 15 coconut trees in their field. Every day Ni Nengah Nerti could produce 15 kg of red sugar, that she sold for Rp60,000 (about $6.60), sugar price per kg is Rp4000 (about 44cents), and within a month Ni Nengah Nerti could have an income of Rp1,100,000 (about $121) from this business. From this income, Ni Nengah Nerti could meet her household needs, including education of her 2 children, and repair her simple home. Ni Nengah Nerti also sees an opportunity to expand her business, by being a red sugar distributor, buying sugar from others, and resell it to a large vendor. However because of capital limitations, Ni Nengah Nerti could not expand it freely. However with Dinari's laon, Ni Nengah Nerti hopes her business could expand again, and income would also increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Nerti saat ini tinggal bersama suami dan 2 orang anaknya yang masih SMA. Ni Nengah Nerti menjalankan usaha sebagai pembuat gula merah. Usaha ini sudah digelutinya sudah beberapa tahun lamanya karena Ni Nengah Nerti melihat bahwa pendapatannya sebagai petani biasa yang hanya mengelola lahan kebunnya dengan cara tradisional tidak mampu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yang sudah semakin meningkat. Dengan modal Rp. 700.000,- Ni Nengah Nerti dibantu suaminya memulai usaha pembuatan gula merah dengan memanfaatkan 15 pohon kelapa yang ada di kebunnya. Setiap hari Ni Nengah Nerti mampu memproduksi 15 kg gula merah dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 60.000,- ( harga gula per kilogram = Rp. 4.000.- ) dan dalam sebulan Ni Nengah Nerti mendapat hasil dari usahanya Rp. 1.100.000,-. Dari pendapatannya inilah Ni Nengah Nerti memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya termasuk menyekolahkan ke dua anaknya dan memperbaiki keadaan rumahnya yang masih sangat sederhana. Ni Nengah Nerti juga melihat peluang untuk mengembangkan usahanya dengan menjadi pengepul gula merah yaitu dengan membeli gula dari orang lain dan kemudian dijual lagi kepada pengusaha besar tapi karena keterbatasan modal yang dimiliki Ni Nengah Nerti tidak bisa leluasa mengembangkannya. Tetapi dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI Nengah Nerti berharap usahanya bisa berkembang lagi dan hasilannyapun bisa bertambah.

loans.use:
To buy red sugar from other makers, so that it could be sold at higher price to large vendor

Membeli gula merah dari pembuat gula merah lainnya sehingga bisa dijual kembali dengan harga yang lebih tinggi kepada pedagang besar
